<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Length    of medial bony ridge of opercle (170): (1 &gt; 0) 60% or greater than opercular    length. Paralleled in node 210 and in <i>Astyanax abramis</i>, <i>Creagrutus</i>    cf. <i>taphorni</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, and <i>Roeboides    microlepis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Acestrorhynchus pantaneiro</i>    and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Bony    lamellae between second and third basibranchials (184): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled    in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>,    <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Jupiaba scologaster</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>,    <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates    bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Lateral    base of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (199): (0 &gt; 1) broad and laminar    at least on anteriormost gill rakers. Paralleled in in nodes 166 and 177 and    in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>. Reversed in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Abdominal    ribs on anterior caudal vertebrae (225): (0 &gt; 1) present, associated to first    and occasionally second caudal vertebrae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Number    of dorsal pterygiophores (278): (0 &gt; 1) 12 or more. Paralleled in <i>Characidium    rachovii</i>, <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>,    and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Bony    lamellae associated with supraneurals (282): (0 &gt; 1) wider than primary axis    of supraneurals. Paralleled in <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Fusion    of hypural 2 to compound centrum (298): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in nodes    174 and 184 and in <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>,    and <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> <i>Radii</i>    on scales (320): (1 &gt; 0) absent or reduced in number. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae,    in node 174, and in <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>, <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>,    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, and <i>Phenagoniates macrolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>14.</b> Median    predorsal scales (325): (0 &gt; 1) leaving naked area anterior to dorsal fin.    Paralleled in node 284 and in <i>Lonchogenys ilisha</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>15.</b> Ventral    serrae (326): (0 &gt; 1) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>16.</b> Scales    covering anal-fin base (327): (0 &gt; 1) several rows covering basal third of    anal fin. Paralleled in nodes 210 and 221 and in <i>Bario steindachneri</i>,    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Paragoniates alburnus</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>,    <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>, and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>17.</b> Diffuse    spots on flanks (346): (0 &gt; 1) present, especially in young specimens.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>18.</b> Number    of 2n chromosomes (363): (0 &gt; 1) 52 or more. Paralleled in the Characinae,    in node 196, and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon herbertaxelrodi</i>,    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Hemigrammus unilineatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>19.</b> Number    of 2n chromosomes (364): (0 &gt; 1) 54 or more. Paralleled in <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Piaractus mesopotamicus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Branching    of laterosensory canals of fourth or fifth infraorbitals (74): (0 &gt; 1) present.    Paralleled in the <i>Bryconops</i> clade, in nodes 167, 177, 218, 260, and 276,    and in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i> and <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Canal    of lateral line on caudal-fin membrane (92): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled    in the Characidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Interdigitations    between premaxillae (103): (1 &gt; 0) present. Paralleled in the Bryconinae    and in <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Form    of interdigitations between dentaries (112): (0 &gt; 1) undulate lamellae. Paralleled    in node 183.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Anterior    extension of interopercle (163): (0 &gt; 1) not extending anteriorly beyond    terminus of horizontal arm of preopercle. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae,    in nodes 162, 174, and 212, and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (195): (1 &gt; 0)    16 or more. Paralleled in nodes 177 and 183 and in <i>Astyanax latens</i>, <i>A</i>.    cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>A</i>. <i>pelegrini</i> Eigenmann, <i>Hoplias</i> cf.    <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon socolofi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia dichroura</i>,    <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Teeth    on third pharyngobranchial (206): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Number    of branchiostegal rays (213): (0 &gt; 1) five. Paralleled in <i>Characidium    borellii</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>,    and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 186: (100    / 100 / 90 / 54)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acnodon</i>?,    <i>Catoprion</i>?, <i>Colossoma</i>?, <sup>&#8224;</sup><i>Megapiranha</i>?,    <i>Metynnis</i>, <i>Mylesinus</i>?, <i>Myleus</i>?, <i>Mylossoma</i>?, <i>Ossubtus</i>?,    <i>Pristobrycon</i>?, <i>Pygocentrus</i>?, <i>Pygopristis</i>?, <i>Serrasalmus</i>,    <i>Tometes</i>?, and <i>Utiaritichthys</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The internal relationships    of the Serrasalmidae are unresolved, and several hypotheses has been proposed    regarding this issue. Machado-Allison (1983) proposed the monophyly of a clade    including the genera <i>Catoprion</i>, <i>Metynnis</i>, <i>Pygocentrus</i>,    <i>Pygopristis</i>, <i>Pristobrycon</i>, and <i>Serrasalmus</i>. In the hypothesis    of Calcagnotto <i>et al</i>. (2005), <i>Piaractus</i> is the sister group of    the remaining analyzed members of the family, which include species of <i>Metynnis</i>    and <i>Serrasalmus</i>. Both hypotheses are compatible with the one herein obtained,    although the synapomorphies of this node should be further evaluated, because    it is likely that some of those features are diagnostic of more or less inclusive    clades. The fossil genus <sup>&#8224;</sup><i>Megapiranha</i> was proposed to    be the sister group of <i>Pygopristis</i>, <i>Pristobrycon</i>, 
<i>Pygocentrus</i>,    and <i>Serrasalmus</i> (Cione <i>et al</i>., 2009), and is tentatively included    at this node.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Fourth    infraorbital (66): (0 &gt; 1) absent or much reduced and bordered posteriorly    by third and fifth infraorbitals. Paralleled in the Aphyocharacinae and Gasteropelecidae,    and in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Hemigrammus erythrozonus</i>,    <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>, and <i>Nematobrycon    palmeri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Articulation    between dentary teeth (145): (0 &gt; 1) present with associated processes and    fossae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Predorsal    spine formed by first dorsal pterygiophore (275): (0 &gt; 1) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (288): (0 &gt; 1) 25 or more. Paralleled in the Characidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Longitudinal    position of insertion of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> tendon on dentary (330):    (0 &gt; 1) on vertical through middle or anterior half of Meckelian cartilage.    Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in nodes 184, 209, 241, 261, and 270, and    in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i> and <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Insertion    of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> tendon on dentary (331): (0 &gt; 1) anterior to    Meckelian cartilage. Paralleled in nodes 183 and 253 and in <i>Xenagoniates    bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Number    of 2n chromosomes (365): (0 &gt; 1) 58 or more.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Serrasalmus maculatus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventral    longitudinal lamellae of basioccipital (2): (1 &gt; 0) falling short of posterior    border of basioccipital. Paralleled in nodes 170 and 205.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Position    of sphenotic spine relative to hyomandibula (11): (0 &gt; 1) displaced anteriorly    relative to anterior margin of hyomandibula. Paralleled in nodes 162 and 211    and in <i>Acestrorhynchus pantaneiro</i>, <i>Piabina argentea</i>, and <i>Salminus    brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Dorsal    process of pterotic where tendon from epaxial musculature attach (45): (0 &gt;    1) present, projecting dorsally from tube for semicircular canal. Paralleled    in the Heterocharacinae, in node 193, and in <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Posterior    branch of posttemporal laterosensory canal (88): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled    in <i>Characidium rachovii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Inner    row of dentary teeth (143): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae,    in nodes 166, 168, and 189, and in <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Ectopterygoid    teeth row (159): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes 168 and 300 and in    <i>Acestrorhynchus pantaneiro</i>, <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>, <i>Hoplias</i>    cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Fusion    between hypurals 1 and 2 (299): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in <i>Distichodus    maculatus</i> and <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Contact    between frontals anteriorly to frontal fontanel (21): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled    in node 167. Some trees: Paralleled in nodes 175 and 206 and in <i>Brycon meeki</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Anterior    margin of supraoccipital (51): (0 &gt; 1) situated anterior to vertical through    posterior orbital margin. Paralleled in node 220 and in <i>Cynopotamus argenteus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Lateral    surface of vertical canal of preopercle (81): (1 &gt; 0) canal uncovered and    situated posteriorly to musculature and infraorbitals. Paralleled in nodes 170,    175, and 204 and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Posterior    extent of ventral process of quadrate (151): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of posterior    margin of symplectic. Paralleled in the <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i> clade    and Iguanodectinae, in nodes 284, 289, and 298, and in <i>Astyanax mexicanus</i>,    <i>A</i>. cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>,    <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Micralestes    stormsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>,    <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>, <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>, and <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Cartilages    anterior to basihyal (188): (0 &gt; 1) two well developed blocks of cartilage.    Paralleled in nodes 244 and 299 and in <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    bifasciatus</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i> Eigenmann, and <i>Roeboides    descalvadensis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 265.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Transitional    vertebrae with haemal canal (229): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in nodes 195    and 212, and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>, and    <i>Piabina argentea</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 247 and in <i>Bryconamericus    alpha</i> and <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Dorsal-fin    rays articulating with first dorsal pterygiophore (266): (0 &gt; 1) three or    four. Paralleled in nodes 203 and 276 and in <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>. Some    trees: Paralleled in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (289): (0 &gt; 1) 35 or more. Paralleled in nodes    207 and 212 and in <i>Gymnocorymbus ternetzi</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>,    <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, <i>Stethaprion erythrops</i>,    and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 261 and in    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 179: (-16    / 90 / - / 21)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Families Alestidae    and Characidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The family Alestidae    was longly considered as related with the Characidae or even included in it    (<i>e</i>. <i>g</i>. Greenwood <i>et al</i>., 1966; Weitzman &amp; Malabarba,    1998). In the hypothesis of Buckup (1998), the Alestidae is the sister group    of a clade composed of the Acestrorhynchidae, Characidae, and Erythrinoidea.    In the phylogenetic hypothesis of Lucena (1993), the Alestidae is included in    the Characidae, being related with <i>Brycon</i> and <i>Serrasalmus</i> (the    only serrasalmid included in his analysis). Murray &amp; Stewart (2002) proposed    both the monophyly and the familial level of the Alestidae. In the phylogeny    of Calcagnotto <i>et al</i>. (2005) the African Alestidae are monophyletic and    included in a node also containing the Erythrinoidea and Crenuchidae. Zanata    &amp; Vari (2005) published a comprehensive phylogeny of the Alestidae including    several members of 
other characiform families in their analysis. The sister-group    relationships of the Alestidae, however, were not hypothesized by Zanata &amp;    Vari (2005). In the present analysis the Alestidae are proposed to be the sister    group of the Characidae. However, this hypothesis has low stability across the    different analyses made in this study given that under most conditions, but    not in the globally more stable hypotheses, the alestids are instead the sister    group of the serrasalmids.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Form    of anterior process of lateral ethmoid (14): (0 &gt; 1) slender and separated    from vomer. Paralleled in <i>Distichodus maculatus</i> and <i>Hemiodus</i> cf.    <i>thayeria</i>. Reversed in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>,    and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Distance    between cartilage anterior to orbitosphenoid and lateral ethmoids (38): (1 &gt;    0) contacting, or almost contacting, lateral ethmoids. Paralleled in node 168    and in <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i> and <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.    Reversed in node 204.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (1 &gt; 0) one. Paralleled in    node 170. Reversed in the Iguanodectinae, in node 280, and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>,    <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>,    <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>,    <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Reversed in node 249 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Coracoid    foramen (243): (0 &gt; 1) well developed. Reversed in node 205 and in <i>Salminus    brasiliensis</i>. Some trees: Reversed in node 302 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Relative    length of anterior dorsal-fin rays (271): (0 &gt; 1) reaching tip of posterior    rays when adpressed. Paralleled in node 163 and in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>    and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>. Reversed in <i>Mimagoniates rheocharis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Proximal    and medial radials of anal fins (294): (2 &gt; 0) fused on anterior five pterygiophores.    Paralleled in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>. Transformed to state 1 in nodes    184, 208, 218, and 221 and in <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i> and <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>. Some trees: Transformed to state 1 in node 295.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 185: Alestidae    (100 / 100 / 46 / 19)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Alestes</i>,    <i>Alestopetersius</i> Hoedeman, <i>Arnoldichthys</i> Myers, <i>Bathyaethiops</i>    Fowler, <i>Brachypetersius</i> Hoedeman, <i>Brycinus</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops</i>,    <i>Bryconalestes</i>, <i>Chalceus</i>, <i>Clupeocharax</i> Pellegrin, <i>Duboisialestes</i>    Poll, <i>Hemigrammopetersius</i>, <i>Hydrocynus</i>, <i>Ladigesia</i> G&eacute;ry,    <i>Lepidarchus</i> Roberts, <i>Micralestes</i>, <i>Nannopetersius</i> Hoedeman,    <i>Petersius</i> Hilgendorf, <i>Phenacogrammus</i> Eigenmann, <i>Rhabdalestes</i>,    <i>Tricuspidalestes</i> Poll, and <i>Virilia</i> Roberts.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    the Alestidae as composed of the "African characids" of Greenwood <i>et al</i>.    (1966) was not greatly discussed in the literature. The phylogenetic analysis    of the Alestidae by Zanata &amp; Vari (2005) represented a great improvement    in the knowledge of the morphology and phylogeny of the family. These authors    defined the monophyly of the family and proposed the Neotropical genus <i>Chalceus</i>    as the sister group of the remaining alestids. Thus, at present, Alestidae is    the unique trans-Atlantic family within the Characiformes. The results obtained    herein concerning this group are congruent with the hypothesis of Zanata &amp;    Vari (2005).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Overlap    of maxilla by second infraorbital (61): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in node    205. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Dorsal    end of laterosensory canal of preopercle and suprapreopercle (82): (0 &gt; 1)    overlapping anterodorsal process of opercle. Paralleled in node 230 and in <i>Bario    steindachneri</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon eques</i>, <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>,    <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Degree    of ventral curvature of lateral line (90): (0 &gt; 1) distinctly curved and    ventrally situated, with posterior lying within ventral half of caudal peduncle    and aligned with lower lobe of caudal fin. Paralleled in the <i>Bryconops</i>    clade. Reversed in <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Form    of anterior portion of ectopterygoid (157): (0 &gt; 1) slender and articulating    only to lateral margin of palatine, and lacking ligaments to neurocranium. Paralleled    in node 170 and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i> and <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Edentulous    basihyal lamella (189): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae,    in nodes 175 and 302, and in <i>Bryconops affinis</i> and <i>Carnegiella strigata</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (287): (1 &gt; 0) 17 or less. Reversal of synapomorphy    6 of the Characoidea. Paralleled in nodes 280 and 290, and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>    and <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>. Some trees: Reversed in <i>Hasemania nana</i>.    Paralleled in node 182.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Lateral    lamellae on anterior anal pterygiophores (295): (0 &gt; 1) present. Reversal    of synapomorphy 7 of the Characoidea.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Number    of epurals (297): (0 &gt; 1) three. Paralleled in node 167 and in <i>Brycon    meeki</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Posterior    margin of hypural 3 (300): (1 &gt; 0) equal to or narrower than posterior margin    of hypural 4. Paralleled in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i> and in node 181.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Form    of mesethmoid spine (27): (0 &gt; 1) relatively short, with premaxillae articulating    with each other anterior to mesethmoid. Paralleled in nodes 225 and 234 and    in <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Laterosensory    canal in antorbital (72): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the <i>Bryconops</i>    clade and in <i>Brycon falcatus</i> and <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Branching    of laterosensory canals of fourth or fifth infraorbitals (74): (0 &gt; 1) present.    Paralleled in the <i>Bryconops</i> clade, in nodes 167, 177, 218, 260, and 276,    and in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i> and <i>Piaractus mesopotamicus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Direction    of posterior branch of laterosensory canal of fourth or fifth infraorbital (75):    (0 &gt; 1) to a pore conspicuously ventral to hyomandibular condyle. Paralleled    in <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Lateral    surface of vertical canal of preopercle (81): (1 &gt; 0) canal uncovered and    situated posteriorly to musculature and infraorbitals. Paralleled in nodes 170,    175, and 204 and in <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Number    of rows of premaxillary teeth (123): (0 &gt; 1) three. Paralleled in the Bryconinae    and in <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Number    of maxillary teeth (136): (0 &gt; 1) four or more. Paralleled in nodes 177,    181, and 205 and in <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Extent    of implantation of teeth along maxilla (137): (0 &gt; 1) extending across almost    entire maxillary lamella. Paralleled in nodes 177 and 205 and in <i>Hoplias</i>    cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Contact    between lamella on anterior portion of first basibranchial with lamella on posterior    portion of second basibranchial (183): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the    <i>Bryconops</i> clade, in nodes 168, 177, and 216, and in <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>,    <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>,    and <i>Piabina argentea</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Relative    number of precaudal vertebrae (226): (1 &gt; 0) exceeding caudal vertebrae in    two or more elements. Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of Characoidea. Paralleled    in <i>Brycinus carolinae</i> and <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii.</i></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (286): (1 &gt; 0) 10 or less. Reversal of synapomorphy    5 of the Characoidea.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Number    of 2n chromosomes (363): (0 &gt; 1) 52 or more. Paralleled in the Characinae    and Serrasalmidae, in node 196, and in <i>Hyphessobrycon herbertaxelrodi</i>,    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Hemigrammus unilineatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 184: (100    / 100 / 99 / 26)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Alestes</i>,    <i>Alestopetersius</i>, <i>Arnoldichthys</i>, <i>Bathyaethiops</i>, <i>Brachypetersius</i>,    <i>Brycinus</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops</i>, <i>Bryconalestes</i>, <i>Clupeocharax</i>,    <i>Duboisialestes</i>, <i>Hemigrammopetersius</i>, <i>Hydrocynus</i>, <i>Ladigesia</i>,    <i>Lepidarchus</i>, <i>Micralestes</i>, <i>Nannopetersius</i>, <i>Petersius</i>,    <i>Phenacogrammus</i>, <i>Rhabdalestes</i>, <i>Tricuspidalestes</i>, and <i>Virilia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This clade corresponds    to the family Alestidae as recognized before the paper of Zanata &amp; Vari    (2005), including only the African members of the clade. As a relatively small    number of alestids are included in this analysis, the proposed synapomorphies    could actually be diagnostic for more or less restricted nodes, as is the situation    with the Gasteropelecidae and Serrasalmidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventromedial    opening of posttemporal fossa (8): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae    and in node 175.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Ventral    diverging lamellae of mesethmoid (30): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy    2 of node 180.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Relative    position of anterior margin of antorbital and first infraorbital (57): (0 &gt;    1) anterior margin of antorbital posterior to first infraorbital. Reversal of    synapomorphy 1 of the Characoidea. Paralleled in <i>Galeocharax humeralis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (1 &gt; 0) reaching horizontal arm of preopercle.    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 180. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae and    Iguanodectinae, in nodes 198, 225, and 302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Brycon pesu</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Moenkhausia    sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>,    and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>. Some trees: Reversed in node 292.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Anterior    end of ascending process of maxilla (94): (1 &gt; 0) with conspicuous notch.    Paralleled in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Form    of posterolateral portion of premaxilla (106): (0 &gt; 1) with pedicle expanded    laterally to maxilla.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Contact    between ectopterygoid and anterodorsal region of quadrate (162): (0 &gt; 1)    absent. Paralleled in node 242, and in <i>Aphyocharax dentatus</i>, <i>Engraulisoma    taeniatum</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in the Cheirodontinae and in <i>Microschemobrycon casiquiare</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Dorsal    longitudinal ridge on medial lamella of pelvic bone (264): (1 &gt; 0) present.    Reversal of synapomorphy 4 of the Characoidea.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Number    of dorsal pterygiophores (276): (1 &gt; 0) nine. Paralleled in the Stevardiinae    and in <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i> and <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Proximal    and medial radials of anal fins (294): (0 &gt; 1) fused in most pterygiophores.    Paralleled in nodes 208, 218, and 221 and in <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i> and    <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 295.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Fusion    of hypural 2 to compound centrum (298): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in the    Serrasalmidae, in node 174, and in <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i>    cf. <i>thayeria</i>, and <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Caudal-fin    bony stays (304): (0 &gt; 1) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Longitudinal    position of insertion of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> tendon on dentary (330):    (0 &gt; 1) on vertical through middle or anterior half of Meckelian cartilage.    Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in nodes 186, 209, 241, 261, and 270, and    in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i> and <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventral    projection of lagenar capsule (3): (0 &gt; 1) extending ventrally to articulation    between basioccipital and parasphenoid. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae, in    nodes 170, 205, and 302, and in <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Posterior    extent of third infraorbital (65): (0 &gt; 1) relatively reduced, angle of preopercle    covered partially by fourth infraorbital. Paralleled in <i>Hemiodus</i> cf.    <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Supraorbital    (70): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in nodes 170, 185, and 205.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Laterosensory    canal of sixth infraorbital (76): (1 &gt; 0) not branched. Paralleled in the    Iguanodectinae, in node 203, and in <i>Charax stenopterus</i>, <i>Cyphocharax    stellatus</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Position    of opening on neurocranium communicating with laterosensory canal of sixth infraorbital    (77): (0 &gt; 1) in frontal. Paralleled in nodes 193 and 249 and in <i>Attonitus    ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Ventral    margin of horizontal process of anguloarticular (109): (0 &gt; 1) perpendicular    to laterosensory canal of dentary from medial view. Paralleled in node 199 and    in <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, and <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Cusps    of teeth on outer premaxillary row (125): (0 &gt; 1) five or more cusps. Paralleled    in nodes 265 and 294 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconops melanurus</i>,    <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, and <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>. Some trees:    Paralleled in <i>Bryconamericus agna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Posterior    extent of ventral process of quadrate (151): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of posterior    margin of symplectic. Paralleled in the <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i> clade    and Iguanodectinae, in nodes 284, 289, and 298, and in <i>Astyanax mexicanus</i>,    <i>A</i>. cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>,    <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Metynnis    maculatus</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>,    <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>, <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>, and <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Ventral    margin of anterior ceratohyal (179): (0 &gt; 1) with notches for articulation    of branchiostegal rays. Paralleled in nodes 167 and 189 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>    and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Total    number of transitional vertebrae (228): (0 &gt; 1) three or fewer. Paralleled    in node 205 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus pantaneiro</i>, <i>Characidium rachovii</i>,    <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>, and <i>Triportheus pantanensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (234): (0 &gt; 1) with concavity ventral to first postcleithrum.    Paralleled in node 189.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Form    of third postcleithrum (250): (1 &gt; 0) slender, without associated lamella.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Supraneural    anterior to neural spine of fourth vertebra (279): (1 &gt; 0) absent or small.    Reversal of synapomorphy 7 of node 180. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae and    in node 204.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>14.</b> Bony    lamellae associated with supraneurals (282): (0 &gt; 1) wider than primary axis    of supraneurals. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 183: (100    / 100 / 100 / 100)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Alestes</i>,    <i>Brycinus</i>, and <i>Bryconaethiops.</i></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    a clade including the species of <i>Alestes</i>, <i>Brycinus</i>, and <i>Bryconaethiops</i>    was proposed by Zanata &amp; Vari (2005) as supported by four synapomorphies.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    bony coverage of olfactory nerve (36): (0 &gt; 2) covered by an anterior tubular    projection of orbitosphenoid.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Form    of interdigitations between dentaries (112): (0 &gt; 1) undulate lamellae. Paralleled    in <i>Piaractus mesopotamicus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Teeth    on inner premaxillary row (126): (1 &gt; 2) with anteriorly concave pattern    plus anterior cusps.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Alignment    of cusps of medial teeth on inner premaxillary row (127): (1 &gt; 0) forming    anteriorly concave semicircle from ventral view. Paralleled in node 262 and    in <i>Moenkhausia dichroura</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Articulation    between quadrate and anguloarticular (153): (1 &gt; 0) anterior to or at vertical    through lateral ethmoid. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae and in node 166.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (195): (1 &gt; 0)    16 or more. Paralleled in node 177 and in <i>Astyanax latens</i>, <i>A</i>.    cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>A</i>. <i>pelegrini</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon socolofi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia dichroura</i>, <i>Parecbasis    cyclolepis</i>, <i>Piaractus mesopotamicus</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Insertion    of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> tendon on dentary (331): (0 &gt; 1) anterior to    Meckelian cartilage. Paralleled in nodes 186 and 253 and in <i>Xenagoniates    bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Brycinus carolinae</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Frontal    fontanel (22): (0 &gt; 1) totally occluded by frontals. Paralleled in <i>Brycon    pesu</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Parietal    fontanel (41): (0 &gt; 1) absent in adults. Paralleled in nodes 162, 170, and    181 and in <i>Brycon pesu</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Relative    number of precaudal vertebrae (226): (1 &gt; 0) exceeding caudal vertebrae in    two or more elements. Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of Characoidea. Paralleled    in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i> and <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 182: (100    / 100 / 90 / 100)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Alestes</i>    and <i>Bryconaethiops</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    a clade including the species of <i>Alestes</i> and <i>Bryconaethiops</i> was    previously proposed by Zanata &amp; Vari (2005) and supported by two characters    not analyzed here: the presence of well-developed indentations between the fifth    and sixth infraorbitals in the margin of the eye, and a well-developed eyelid    covering part of the eye. This node was also obtained in the present analysis    based on two different characters.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (53): (1 &gt; 0) extends posteriorly to, at least, middle    length of neural complex of Weberian apparatus. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae,    in node 205, and in <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i> and <i>Prochilodus lineatus</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Brycon meeki</i> and <i>B</i>. <i>orbignyanus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (287): (0 &gt; 1) 18 or more. Reversal of synapomorphy    6 of the Alestidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Degree    of ventral curvature of lateral line (90): (1 &gt; 0) straight or only slightly    curved, with posterior portion aligned with middle caudal-fin rays. Reversal    of synapomorphy 3 of the Alestidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of rows of premaxillary teeth (123): (0 &gt; 1) three. Paralleled in the Bryconinae    and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (0 &gt; 1) two. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 179. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in node 280, and in <i>Brycon    orbignyanus</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax    goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>,    <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 249 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Pelvic    bone (260): (0 &gt; 1) bifurcate with conspicuous notch.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of supraneurals (280): (1 &gt; 0) four or fewer. Paralleled in nodes 211, 223,    and 262 and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon bifasciatus</i>,    and <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>No autapomorphies    found for <i>Alestes</i> cf. <i>macrophthalmus</i>.</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>INGROUP</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 178: Characidae    (100 / 100 / 44 / 17)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Acestrorhynchinae,    Agoniatinae, Aphyocharacinae, Aphyoditeinae, Bryconinae, Characinae, Cheirodontinae,    Cynodontinae, Gymnocharacinae, Heterocharacinae, Iguanodectinae, Rhoadsiinae,    Salmininae, Stevardiinae, and Tetragonopterinae; <i>Astyanax</i> clade, <i>Astyanax    paris</i> clade, <i>Bramocharax</i> clade, <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>    clade, <i>Bryconops</i> clade, <i>Hyphessobrycon anisitsi</i> clade, and <i>Pseudochalceus</i>    clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The composition    and diagnosis of the Characidae are among the most problematic issues in the    phylogeny of the Characiformes, and no explicit diagnosis based on synapomorphic    features was proposed under previous phylogenetic studies of the family (Uj,    1990; Lucena, 1993; Buckup, 1998). This node is not completely congruent with    some clade from previous phylogenies, but it is the one that requires the fewest    nomenclatural changes relative to previous definitions of the family (<i>e</i>.    <i>g</i>. G&eacute;ry, 1977). The present definition of the Characidae is largely    compatible with the hypothesis of Uj (1990) and Buckup (1998), but the node    H of the hypothesis of Uj (1990) also includes the Serrasalmidae, while the    node 14 of Buckup (1998) excludes <i>Acestrorhynchus</i> from the Characidae.    This hypothesis is relatively less congruent with that of Lucena (1993), in    which the node most 
similar to the Characidae of this study excludes <i>Acestrorhynchus</i>,    <i>Cynodon</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon</i>, and includes the Alestidae and Serrasalmidae.    Results of molecular analyses are also rather different from the the results    of the present hypothesis. The node of Ort&iacute; &amp; Meyer (1997) most similar    to the Characidae of this paper excludes the Cynodontinae and includes the Alestidae    and Ctenoluciidae, while the node referred to as "Neotropical characids" by    Calcagnotto <i>et al</i>. (2005) excludes the Cynodontinae but includes the    genus <i>Chalceus</i>, in the Alestidae of this study. It is notable that both    molecular phylogenies agree in the exclusion of the Cynodontinae from the Characidae,    and in the non-monophyly of Alestidae, with <i>Chalceus</i> separated from the    African alestids. Both the monophyly of a clade composed of the Acestrorhynchinae    and Cynodontinae, and the sister-group relationship between <i>Chalceus</i>    and 
the African Alestidae are supported by morphological phylogenies (Lucena    &amp; Menezes, 1998; Zanata &amp; Vari, 2005), and are corroborated herein.    In the present analysis the monophyly of the Characidae is supported by one    additional unambiguous character (ch. 92) relative to the analysis of Mirande    (2009).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Form    of orbitosphenoid (37): (1 &gt; 0) slender, relatively small and separate from    parasphenoid. Paralleled in nodes 168 and 170 and in <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>.    Reversed in node 193 and in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>,    and <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Rhinosphenoid    (47): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes 168 and 170 and in <i>Hemiodus</i>    cf. <i>thayeria</i>. Reversed in nodes 207, 260, 280, and 298 and in <i>Aphyocharax    nattereri</i>, <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconamericus    scleroparius</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>, and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Canal    of lateral line on caudal-fin membrane (92): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled    in <i>Piaractus mesopotamicus</i>. Reversed in the Aphyoditeinae and <i>Bryconops</i>    clade, in nodes 227, 229, 244, 287, 294, and 298, and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>,    <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i>, <i>Charax stenopterus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon anisitsi</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster    tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Total    number of vertebrae (227): (0 &gt; 1) 41 or more. Paralleled in <i>Apareiodon    affinis</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, and <i>Prochilodus lineatus</i>.    Reversed in nodes 205 and 302 and in <i>Brycon pesu</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (288): (0 &gt; 1) 25 or more. Paralleled in node 186.    Reversed in nodes 200, 277, and 300 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus pantaneiro</i>    and <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Anterior    ventral procurrent caudal-fin rays (305): (0 &gt; 1) fused in laminar medial    bones.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> <i>Radii</i>    of scales (322): (1 &gt; 0) not converging at focus. Paralleled in node 168    and in <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>. Reversed in node 273 and in <i>Stichonodon    insignis</i> and <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>. Some trees: Reversed in node    302 and in <i>Microschemobrycon casiquiare</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Attachment    of medial tendon of A1 section of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> (333): (1 &gt;    0) on quadrate near its articulation with preopercle. Reversed in node 211.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> <i>Radii</i>    oriented towards anterior field of scales (321): (0 &gt; 2) absent. Reversed    in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 177: (100    / 100 / 7 / 10)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Acestrorhynchinae,    Agoniatinae, Bryconinae, Cynodontinae, and Salmininae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    a group equivalent with this clade was not proposed in previous phylogenies.    The Acestrorhynchinae and Cynodontinae were recently considered as families,    separate from the Characidae (as the Acestrorhynchidae and Cynodontidae; <i>e</i>.    <i>g</i>. Buckup, 1998; Menezes, 2003; Toledo-Piza, 2003). In the analysis by    Buckup (1998), <i>Acestrorhynchus</i> is the sister group of the Erythrinoidea,    and both the Acestrorhynchidae and Cynodontidae were included in the superfamily    Cynodontoidea. In the present paper both clades are included as subfamilies    of the Characidae. According to the hypothesis of Uj (1990), his Agoniatidae    (=Agoniatinae) and Bryconidae (=Bryconinae and Salmininae) are sequentially    arranged at the base of a clade corresponding to the Characidae of this study.    In the analysis of Buckup (1998), <i>Brycon</i> is the sister group of the remaining    members 
attributable to the Characidae; that author did not analyze the position    of <i>Agoniates</i> and <i>Salminus</i>. In the analysis of Lucena (1993) the    Acestrorhynchinae and Cynodontinae form the sister group of a clade including    most genera of the Characidae. <i>Agoniates</i> is the sister group of the remaining    members of this clade, while <i>Brycon</i> and <i>Triportheus</i> are situated    more distally. This node includes most of the characids having a supraorbital    bone, and only <i>Bryconops</i>, some of the Heterocharacinae, and the Iguanodectinae    have an ossified supraorbital among the members of the Characidae not included    in this clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Posteriorly-oriented    epioccipital spine (7): (1 &gt; 0) present. Paralleled in nodes 162, 177, and    218. Reversed in node 174.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Contact    between supraorbital and sixth infraorbital (71): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled    in node 162 and in <i>Prochilodus lineatus</i>. Reversed in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Branching    of laterosensory canals of fourth or fifth infraorbitals (74): (0 &gt; 1) present.    Paralleled in the <i>Bryconops</i> clade, in nodes 167, 218, 260, and 276, and    in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>, <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>, and <i>Piaractus    mesopotamicus</i>. Reversed in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Length    of caudal-fin canal of lateral line (93): (0 &gt; 1) almost reaching posterior    margin of caudal fin. Paralleled in node 216 and in <i>Astyanax pelegrini</i>    and <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of maxillary teeth (136): (0 &gt; 1) four or more. Paralleled in nodes 181 and    205 and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i> and <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>.    Reversed in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Extent    of implantation of teeth along maxilla (137): (0 &gt; 1) extending across almost    entire maxillary lamella. Paralleled in node 205 and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>    and <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>. Reversed in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Contact    between lamella on anterior portion of first basibranchial with lamella on posterior    portion of second basibranchial (183): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the    <i>Bryconops</i> clade, in nodes 168 and 216, and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>,    <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Hoplias</i>    cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, and <i>Piabina argentea</i>. Reversed in <i>Agoniates    anchovia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (195): (1 &gt; 0)    16 or more. Paralleled in node 183 and in <i>Astyanax latens</i>, <i>A</i>.    cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>A</i>. <i>pelegrini</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon socolofi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia dichroura</i>, <i>Parecbasis    cyclolepis</i>, <i>Piaractus mesopotamicus</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.    Reversed in <i>Brycon pesu</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Lateral    base of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (199): (0 &gt; 1) broad and laminar    at least on anteriormost gill rakers. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae, in node    166, and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>. Reversed in <i>Agoniates    anchovia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Position    of ventral end of posttemporal (253): (0 &gt; 1) posterior to lateral margin    of epioccipital. Paralleled in nodes 211 and 228 and in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>,    <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Probolodus    heterostomus</i>, and <i>Prochilodus lineatus</i>. Reversed in <i>Brycon pesu</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 176: (100    / 100 / 52 / 23)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Acestrorhynchinae,    Agoniatinae, Cynodontidae, and Salmininae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    this assemblage was not previously proposed. The relationships of <i>Salminus</i>    were superficially treated by Roberts (1974), who considered this genus to be    a primitive and relatively unspecialized characid. Roberts highlighted what    he thought were close morphological resemblance between <i>Salminus</i> and    <i>Brycon</i>, although he suggested that such resemblance could be produced    by the persistence in both genera of plesiomorphic features. This supposition    is congruent with the results obtained in this paper.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of sphenotic spine (10): (1 &gt; 0) not extending ventrally to articulation    between sphenotic and hyomandibula. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 180.    Paralleled in the Characinae and in node 197.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Articulation    between second and third infraorbitals (62): (0 &gt; 2) posteroventrally angled.    Paralleled in the Characinae, in node 300, and in <i>Bryconops melanurus</i>    and <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Horizontal    process of anguloarticular (108): (1 &gt; 0) laterally covered by dentary only    anteriorly. Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node 180. Paralleled in node 206.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Position    of coronomeckelian (110): (1 &gt; 0) situated mainly lateral to Meckelian cartilage.    Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae, in node 206, and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>    and <i>Prochilodus lineatus</i>. Reversed in <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Form    of quadrate (150): (0 &gt; 1) with anterodorsal portion equal or longer than    ventral region. Paralleled in the <i>Pseudochalceus</i> clade, in nodes 170,    211, and 299, and in <i>Exodon paradoxus</i> and <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Articulation    between quadrate and anguloarticular (154): (0 &gt; 1) posterior to middle eye.    Paralleled in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Articulation    between ventral margin of metapterygoid and posterodorsal margin of quadrate    (155): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in node 299 and in <i>Deuterodon langei</i>,    <i>Heterocharax macrolepis</i>, <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>, <i>Roeboides descalvadensis</i>,    and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Form    and degree of ossification of first ceratobranchial gill rakers (200): (0 &gt;    1) rather thick and completely ossified distal region. Paralleled in nodes 212    and 299 and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>,    and <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first epibranchial (203): (1 &gt; 0) one. Reversed in <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Salmininae:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genus <i>Salminus</i></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The Salmininae    was proposed by Eigenmann (1917) as a line diverging from the Cheirodontinae.    Roberts (1969) alternatively considered <i>Salminus</i> to be a basal characid.    G&eacute;ry (1977) included this genus in the tribe Salminini, as part of the    subfamily Bryconinae. The genus <i>Salminus</i> was classified as <i>incertae    sedis</i> within the Characidae by Lima <i>et al</i>. (2003), and it is herein    proposed to be removed from that group and classified in its own subfamily.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Position    of sphenotic spine relative to hyomandibula (11): (0 &gt; 1) displaced anteriorly    relative to anterior margin of hyomandibula. Paralleled in nodes 162 and 211    and in <i>Acestrorhynchus pantaneiro</i>, <i>Piabina argentea</i>, and <i>Serrasalmus    maculatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Temporal    fossa (13): (1 &gt; 0) well developed. Paralleled in node 300 and in <i>Brycon    meeki</i> and <i>Bryconexodon juruenae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Form    of anterior process of lateral ethmoid (14): (1 &gt; 0) broad in ventral view,    contacting proximal region of vomer in its entire length. Reversal of synapomorphy    1 of node 179. Paralleled in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i> and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Rhinosphenoid    (47): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of the Characidae. Paralleled    in nodes 207, 260, 280, and 298 and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Attonitus    ephimeros</i>, <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>,    <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, and <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of teeth in inner premaxillary row (130): (0 &gt; 1) eight or more. Paralleled    in the Aphyoditeinae, in node 170, and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Grundulus    cochae</i>, <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>, and <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Foramen    in posterior region of metapterygoid (168): (2 &gt; 1) present, encircled by    metapterygoid or bordered partially by cartilage. Paralleled in node 205.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Ventral    margin of anterior ceratohyal (179): (0 &gt; 1) with notches for articulation    of branchiostegal rays. Paralleled in nodes 167 and 189 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>    and <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Articulation    between anterior and posterior ceratohyals (181): (0 &gt; 1) with bony interdigitations.    Paralleled in node 210 and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i> and <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Coracoid    foramen (243): (1 &gt; 0) absent or reduced to small pore. Reversal of synapomorphy    4 of node 179. Paralleled in node 205. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302 and    in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Dorsal-fin    rays articulating with first dorsal pterygiophore (266): (0 &gt; 1) three or    four. Paralleled in nodes 203 and 276 and in <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>. Some    trees: Paralleled in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Number    of ventral procurrent caudal-fin rays (302): (0 &gt; 1) 12 or more. Paralleled    in the <i>Bryconops</i> clade and in nodes 229 and 252.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Anterior    extension of <i>adductor arcus palatini</i> (336): (1 &gt; 0) covering most    of dorsal surface of mesopterygoid. Paralleled in node 166 and in <i>Creagrutus    anary</i> and <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Brycon    orbignyanus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Sclerotic    bones (350): (1 &gt; 0) single anteroventrally open bone.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>14.</b> Length    of medial bony ridge of opercle (170): (1 &gt; 0) 60% or greater than opercular    length. (k11-14). Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae, in node 210, and in <i>Astyanax    abramis</i>, <i>Creagrutus</i> cf. <i>taphorni</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>,    and <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Acestrorhynchus    pantaneiro</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 175: (100    / 100 / 62 / 60)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Acestrorhynchinae,    Agoniatinae, and Cynodontinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Several hypotheses    about the relationships of <i>Agoniates</i> have been proposed, all of which    agree in the relatively basal position of this genus within the Characidae (G&eacute;ry,    1963, 1972; Castro, 1984; Uj, 1990; Lucena, 1993). Uj (1990) proposed the Agoniatidae    (=Agoniatinae) to be the sister group of the remaining members of his clade    H (the most compatible of his groupings with the Characidae as herein recognized).    Uj partially based his hypotheses in the proposal by G&eacute;ry (1963). In    the hypothesis of Lucena (1993), <i>Agoniates</i> is the sister group of a clade    which includes most of the Characidae, with the exceptions of the Acestrorhynchinae    and Cynodontinae. A close relationship between the monogeneric Agoniatinae and    the Acestrorhynchinae and Cynodontinae was not previously proposed.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventromedial    opening of posttemporal fossa (8): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae    and in node 184.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Lateral    surface of vertical canal of preopercle (81): (1 &gt; 0) canal uncovered and    situated posteriorly to musculature and infraorbitals. Paralleled in nodes 170    and 204 and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i> and <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Anterior    projection of anterior ceratohyal articulating laterally with hypohyals (177):    (0 &gt; 1) present and achieving half length of hypohyals.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Edentulous    basihyal lamella (189): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the Alestidae and    Heterocharacinae, in node 302, and in <i>Bryconops affinis</i> and <i>Carnegiella    strigata</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Base    of second pectoral ray (231): (0 &gt; 1) similar in form and size to base of    posterior rays. Paralleled in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Position    of anteriormost epineurals (274): (0 &gt; 1) reaching to cranium. Paralleled    in nodes 170 and 302 and in <i>Distichodus maculatus</i> and <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Contact    between frontals anteriorly to frontal fontanel (21): (1 &gt; 0) absent. (k11-14).    Paralleled in node 167 and in <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in node 206 and in <i>Brycon meeki</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Agoniatinae:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genus <i>Agoniates</i></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The relationships    of the monogeneric subfamily Agoniatinae were analyzed by G&eacute;ry (1963,    1972), who considered the presence in this genus of some presumably "primitive"    and "adaptive" characters. G&eacute;ry proposed that <i>Agoniates</i> was related    with <i>Clupeacharax</i>. Castro (1984) proposed a sister-group relationship    of <i>Clupeacharax</i> and <i>Engraulisoma</i>, contrary to the relationships    suggested by G&eacute;ry (1963) for <i>Agoniates</i>. Zanata (2000) later proposed    a close relationship of <i>Agoniates</i> with <i>Lignobrycon</i>, and <i>Triportheus</i>,    but Lima &amp; Zanata (2003) maintained the Agoniatinae as valid and monogeneric.    Lima <i>et al</i>. (2003) classified <i>Lignobrycon</i> and <i>Triportheus</i>    as <i>incertae sedis</i> within Characidae. The results of the present study    do not support a close relationship between <i>Agoniates</i> and 
<i>Triportheus</i>.    Perhaps the inclusion of <i>Lignobrycon</i> in a broader phylogenetic analysis    could resolve these discrepancies.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Position    of ventromedial opening of posttemporal fossa (9): (0 &gt; 1) bordered entirely    by epioccipital. Paralleled in node 163.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Dorsal    expansion of rhinosphenoid (48): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in nodes 201,    212, and 300.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (1 &gt; 0) reaching horizontal arm of preopercle.    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 180. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae and    Iguanodectinae, in nodes 184, 198, 225, and 302, and in <i>Brycon pesu</i>,    <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>,    <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>, and <i>Stichonodon    insignis</i>. Some trees: Reversed in node 292.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Contact    between supraorbital and sixth infraorbital (71): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal    of synapomorphy 2 of node 177.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Opening    of epiphyseal laterosensory canals (86): (0 &gt; 1) canals continue dorsomedially    in soft tissue, opening over or just lateral to the cranial fontanel.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Form    of anterior portion of ectopterygoid (157): (0 &gt; 1) slender and articulating    only to lateral margin of palatine, and lacking ligaments to neurocranium. Paralleled    in the Alestidae, in node 170, and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Contact    between lamella on anterior portion of first basibranchial with lamella on posterior    portion of second basibranchial (183): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy    7 of node 177.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Lateral    base of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (199): (1 &gt; 0) slender. Reversal    of synapomorphy 9 of node 177.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Development    of transverse process of neural arch of third vertebra (219): (0 &gt; 1) well    developed and extending beyond anterior margin of tripus. Paralleled in node    302, and in <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>, <i>Deuterodon langei</i>, <i>Engraulisoma    taeniatum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>,    and <i>Thayeria obliqua</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Microschemobrycon    casiquiare</i> and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Anteriorly    directed spine at base of first rib (223): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in    the Heterocharacinae. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (235): (0 &gt; 1) with markedly concave margin, almost forming    straight angle. Paralleled in nodes 162, 247, and 253 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>,    <i>Characidium borellii</i>, <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>, <i>Moenkhausia</i>    cf. <i>intermedia</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates    bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Dorsal    development of third postcleithrum (251): (0 &gt; 1) not projects dorsally to    posterior region of scapula. Paralleled in node 192 and in <i>Gymnocharacinus    bergii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Articulation    between pelvic bones (261): (0 &gt; 1) with bony interdigitations between ischiatic    processes. Paralleled in node 302 and in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>14.</b> Number    of epurals (296): (1 &gt; 0) one. Paralleled in <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>15.</b> <i>Circulii</i>    on posterior field of scales (319): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae    and in nodes 168 and 206. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>16.</b> Posterior    attachment of A1 section of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> (332): (0 &gt; 1) restricted    or almost restricted to horizontal arm of preopercle. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae,    in node 211, and in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i> and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 174: (100    / 100 / 99 / 73)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Acestrorhynchinae    and Cynodontinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    a clade composed of the Acestrorhynchinae and Cynodontinae was proposed in several    morphological phylogenies (Uj, 1990; Lucena, 1993; Lucena &amp; Menezes, 1998);    however, this clade was not resolved as a monophyletic unit in the molecular    analyses of Ort&iacute; &amp; Meyer (1990) and Calcagnotto <i>et al</i>. (2005).    This analysis corroborates a sister-group relationship between these two subfamilies,    which is supported by numerous synapomorphies.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Posteriorly-oriented    epioccipital spine (7): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node    177.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Dilator    fossa on lateral surface of frontal (24): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in node    181.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Bony    lamellae bordering sensory canal of nasal (34): (0 &gt; 1) wider at some point    than tubular region. Paralleled in node 181 and in <i>Galeocharax humeralis</i>,    <i>Leporinus striatus</i>, and <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Ventral    border of rhinosphenoid (50): (0 &gt; 1) almost contacting parasphenoid. Paralleled    in node 193.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Posterior    dorsoventral expansion of fourth infraorbital (68): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled    in nodes 210 and 299.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Morphology    of premaxillary, maxillary, and dentary teeth (118): (1 &gt; 0) all teeth conical,    caniniform or mamilliform. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae, in nodes 181    and 211, and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>, <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, and <i>Exodon    paradoxus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> A pair    of large conical teeth in premaxilla (121): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in    node 299.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Anterior    extension of interopercle (163): (0 &gt; 1) not extending anteriorly beyond    terminus of horizontal arm of preopercle. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae,    in nodes 162 and 212, and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i> and <i>Piaractus    mesopotamicus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Mesopterygoid    teeth (165): (0 &gt; 1) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Shape    of first ceratobranchial gill rakers (197): (0 &gt; 2) short, broad and strongly    denticulated.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Length    of interhyal (211): (0 &gt; 1) equal to or longer than one-half of symplectic    length. Paralleled in node 211 and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>    and <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Number    of branchiostegal rays attached to posterior ceratohyal (217): (0 &gt; 1) two.</font></p>
