<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Position    of last supraneural (283): (0 &gt; 1) located more than two vertebrae in front    of first dorsal pterygiophore. Paralleled in node 244 and in <i>Engraulisoma    taeniatum</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>14.</b> Fusion    of hypural 2 to compound centrum (298): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in the    Serrasalmidae, in node 184, and in <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i>    cf. <i>thayeria</i>, and <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>15.</b> <i>Radii</i>    on scales (320): (1 &gt; 0) absent or reduced in number. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae    and Serrasalminae and in <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>, <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>,    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, and <i>Phenagoniates macrolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Cynodontinae:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Cynodon</i>,    <i>Gilbertolus</i>?, <i>Hydrolycus</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon</i>, and <i>Roestes</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Hydrolycus</i>    and <i>Rhaphiodon</i> (including <i>Cynodon</i>) were included in the characid    subfamily Rhaphiodontinae by G&eacute;ry (1977). Lucena &amp; Menezes (1998)    proposed this clade as the sister group of the Acestrorhynchidae, and the familial    name Cynodontidae (already used by Greenwood <i>et al</i>., 1966) was given    to this clade plus the genera <i>Gilbertolus</i> and <i>Roestes</i> (not analyzed    here). The phylogeny of <i>Acestrorhynchus</i> undertaken by Toledo-Piza (2007)    included the genera of the Cynodontinae as part of the outgroup. In her paper    <i>Gilbertolus</i> and <i>Roestes</i> are not closely related with <i>Cynodon</i>,    <i>Hydrolycus</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon</i>, but rather related with other members    of the Characidae. Therefore, the position of <i>Gilbertolus</i> and <i>Roestes</i>    is currently uncertain. Toledo-Piza (2007), however, argued that not all the    
known evidence relating these five genera was used in her analysis. Thus, these    genera are herein tentatively maintained within the Cynodontinae. The monophyly    of the Cynodontinae (as Cynodontidae) was corroborated by Lucena &amp; Menezes    (1998) and Toledo-Piza (2000).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Posterior    laminar expansion of epiphyseal bar (1): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in <i>Piabucus    melanostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Form    of anterior process of lateral ethmoid (14): (1 &gt; 0) broad in ventral view,    contacting proximal region of vomer in its entire length. Reversal of synapomorphy    1 of node 179. Paralleled in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i> and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Synchondral    articulation between lateral ethmoid and anterodorsal border of orbitosphenoid    (35): (1 &gt; 0) present. Paralleled in the Aphyocharacinae and in <i>Leporinus    striatus</i>, <i>Mimagoniates rheocharis</i>, <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>, and    <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Form    of orbitosphenoid (37): (0 &gt; 1) massive, almost reaching parasphenoid ventrally.    Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of the Characidae. Paralleled in node 193 and in    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i> and <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Pores    of laterosensory canal of lower jaw (80): (0 &gt; 1) seven or more. Paralleled    in nodes 211 and 299.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Form    of lateral line (89): (1 &gt; 0) approximately straight. Reversal of synapomorphy    2 of the Characoidea.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Position    of coronomeckelian (110): (0 &gt; 1) situated mainly dorsal to Meckelian cartilage.    Reversal of synapomorphy 4 of node 176.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Inner    row of dentary teeth (143): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae,    in nodes 166, 168, and 189, and in <i>Serrasalmus maculatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Patch    of ectopterygoid teeth (160): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in <i>Hoplias</i>    cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Suprapreopercle    (175): (0 &gt; 1) autogenous, separated from preopercle. Paralleled in nodes    210 and 302 and in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i> and <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Articulation    between anterior and posterior ceratohyals (181): (0 &gt; 1) with bony interdigitations.    Paralleled in node 210 and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i> and <i>Salminus    brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Bony    lamellae between second and third basibranchials (184): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled    in the Serrasalmidae and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Jupiaba    scologaster</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>,    and <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (0 &gt; 1) two. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 179. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in node 280, and in <i>Brycon    orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Cheirodon    interruptus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>,    <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>, <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, and <i>Prodontocharax    melanotus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 249 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>14.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on second ceratobranchial (193): (0 &gt; 1) two. Paralleled in    nodes 210, 225, 276, and 297 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax    goethei</i>, and <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>15.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first epibranchial (203): (0 &gt; 1) two. Reversal of synapomorphy    9 of node 176.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>16.</b> Number    of branchiostegal rays (213): (0 &gt; 1) five. Paralleled in <i>Characidium    borellii</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Piaractus mesopotamicus</i>,    and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>17.</b> Anterior    portions of branchiostegal rays (214): (0 &gt; 1) slender near their articulation    with ceratohyals. Paralleled in nodes 212 and 256.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>18.</b> Ascending    process of neural pedicle of third vertebra (220): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal    of synapomorphy 6 of node 180.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>19.</b> Dorsal    development of cleithrum (237): (0 &gt; 1) ending in a position just dorsal    of tip of mesocoracoid. Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>20.</b> Development    of medial lamella of coracoid (238): (0 &gt; 1) expanded as a keel. Paralleled    in nodes 170 and 302 and in <i>Paragoniates alburnus</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>,    and <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>21.</b> Second    postcleithrum (248): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae,    in node 302, and in <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>22.</b> Third    postcleithrum (249): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae,    in node 302, and in <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>,    and <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>23.</b> Ventral    exit of laterosensory canal of supracleithrum (254): (0 &gt; 1) ventral to lamella    of supracleithrum and exiting on posterior margin of this bone. Paralleled in    node 205.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>24.</b> Anterior    extension of pelvic-bone along main axis (262): (0 &gt; 1) projecting anterior    of lateral and medial lamellae of pelvic bone. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae,    in node 302, and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>,    and <i>Stethaprion erythrops</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>25.</b> Number    of dorsal-fin rays on last pterygiophore (272): (0 &gt; 1) two, adnate.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>26.</b> Dorsal    myorhabdoi (273): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in node 170.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>27.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (289): (0 &gt; 1) 35 or more. Paralleled in nodes    207 and 212 and in <i>Gymnocorymbus ternetzi</i>, <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>,    <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, <i>Stethaprion    erythrops</i>, and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    node 261 and in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>28.</b> Scales    covering anal-fin base (327): (0 &gt; 1) several rows covering basal third of    anal fin. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae, in nodes 210 and 221, and in <i>Bario    steindachneri</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Paragoniates alburnus</i>,    <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>, and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>29.</b> Posterior    region of <i>levator arcus palatini</i> (337): (0 &gt; 1) limited lateral and    medially by A2 and A3 sections of <i>adductor mandibulae</i>. Paralleled in    <i>Piabina argentea</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>30.</b> Number    of 2n chromosomes (363): (0 &gt; 1) 52 or more. Paralleled in the Characinae    and Serrasalmidae, in node 196, and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    herbertaxelrodi</i>, and <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Hemigrammus unilineatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>31.</b> Number    of 2n chromosomes (364): (0 &gt; 1) 54 or more. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Acestrorhynchinae:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genus <i>Acestrorhynchus</i></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The subfamily Acestrorhynchinae    was originally proposed to include <i>Acestrorhynchus</i> and <i>Oligosarcus</i>    by Menezes (1969). G&eacute;ry (1977) classified these two genera plus <i>Bramocharax</i>    in the tribe Acestrorhynchini, as part of the subfamily Characinae. That author    even stated that the Acestrorhynchini was "one of the best-known characid groups"    (G&eacute;ry, 1977: 323). This hypothesis of a close relationship was challenged    by Menezes &amp; G&eacute;ry (1983) and refuted by Buckup (1998). The latter    author found that <i>Oligosarcus</i> and <i>Acestrorhynchus</i> are only distantly    related. In his phylogeny <i>Oligosarcus</i> is deeply nested in the Characidae,    while <i>Acestrorhynchus</i> was not included in the Characidae, but rather    in its own family, the Acestrorhynchidae. The Acestrorhynchidae was also considered    as valid by Lucena &amp; Menezes (1998) and Menezes 
(2003), among others. The    monophyly of <i>Acestrorhynchus</i> was tested by Toledo-Piza (2007), who obtained    a sister-group relationship between this genus and the Cynodontidae as previously    proposed by Lucena &amp; Menezes (1998). This clade containing <i>Acestrorhynchus</i>    and <i>Rhaphiodon</i> is nested in a group composed of the Agoniatinae and Salmininae,    which is the sister group of the Bryconinae. All of these were traditionally    included in the Characidae. Consequently, both the Acestrorhynchinae and Cynodontinae    are herein proposed to be subfamilies of the Characidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Acestrorhynchus pantaneiro</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Position    of sphenotic spine relative to hyomandibula (11): (0 &gt; 1) displaced anteriorly    relative to anterior margin of hyomandibula. Paralleled in nodes 162 and 211    and in <i>Piabina argentea</i>, <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>, and <i>Serrasalmus    maculatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Position    of sphenotic spine relative to the orbit (12): (0 &gt; 1) distinctly posterior    to orbital margin. Paralleled in nodes 193 and 299 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>,    <i>Cynopotamus argenteus</i>, and <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Anterior    region of laterosensory canal of frontal (83): (0 &gt; 1) opens into a chamber    limited. dorsally by frontal and ventrally by lateral ethmoid.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Ectopterygoid    teeth row (159): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes 168 and 300 and in    <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Serrasalmus    maculatus</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on third and fourth ceratobranchials (194): (1 &gt; 0) one.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Total    number of transitional vertebrae (228): (0 &gt; 1) three or fewer. Paralleled    in node 205 and in <i>Characidium rachovii</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>,    <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, and <i>Triportheus pantanensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (288): (1 &gt; 0) 24 or less. Reversal of synapomorphy    5 of the Characidae. Paralleled in nodes 200, 277, and 300 and in <i>Iguanodectes    geisleri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Humeral    spot (341): (0 &gt; 1) horizontally-ovate. Paralleled in node 259 and in <i>Brycon    orbignyanus</i>, <i>Jupiaba mucronata</i>, and <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Length    of medial bony ridge of opercle (170): (1 &gt; 0) 60% or greater than opercular    length. (k11-14). Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae, in node 210, and in <i>Astyanax    abramis</i>, <i>Creagrutus</i> cf. <i>taphorni</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>,    and <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 190: Bryconinae    (86 / 97 / 1 / 10)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Brycon</i>,    <i>Chilobrycon</i> G&eacute;ry &amp; de Rham, <i>Henochilus</i> Garman, <i>Lignobrycon</i>,    and <i>Triportheus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The subfamily Bryconinae    was considered by G&eacute;ry (1977) to be composed of the tribes Bryconini,    Salminini, and Triportheini. Although a close relationship between <i>Brycon</i>    and <i>Triportheus</i> has been suggested several times in the literature (<i>e</i>.    <i>g</i>. G&eacute;ry, 1977), only Malabarba (1998b) obtained evidence supporting    this hypothesis. In her phylogeny, <i>Lignobrycon</i> is the sister group of    <i>Triportheus</i>, supported by eight synapomorphies. Lima (2003b), mainly    based in the analysis of Zanata (2000) restricted the Bryconinae to <i>Brycon</i>,    <i>Chilobrycon</i>, and <i>Henochilus</i>, leaving <i>Lignobrycon</i>, <i>Salminus</i>,    and <i>Triportheus</i> as <i>incertae sedis</i> within the Characidae (Lima    <i>et al</i>., 2003). This subfamily is herein redefined to include the previously    <i>incertae sedis</i> genera <i>Lignobrycon</i> and 
<i>Triportheus</i>. The    included species of <i>Brycon</i> form a polytomy in this node, and the monophyly    of the genus is not supported in this analysis. However, only a small sample    of this genus was analyzed, and a study focused on the question of the monophyly    of <i>Brycon</i> lies far beyond the scope of this paper.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Interdigitations    between premaxillae (103): (1 &gt; 0) present. Paralleled in <i>Distichodus    maculatus</i> and <i>Piaractus mesopotamicus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of rows of premaxillary teeth (123): (0 &gt; 1) three. Paralleled in <i>Bryconaethiops    macrops</i> and <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Polymorphism    of teeth on inner premaxillary row (131): (0 &gt; 1) present, with two medial    teeth somewhat larger and usually separated from remaining ones by a gap. Paralleled    in the Serrasalmidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Brycon pesu</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Frontal    fontanel (22): (0 &gt; 1) totally occluded by frontals. Paralleled in <i>Brycinus    carolinae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Parietal    fontanel (41): (0 &gt; 1) absent in adults. Paralleled in nodes 162, 170, and    181 and in <i>Brycinus carolinae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (1 &gt; 0) reaching horizontal arm of preopercle.    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 180. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae and    Iguanodectinae, in nodes 184, 198, 225, and 302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>,    <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>, and <i>Stichonodon    insignis</i>. Some trees: Reversed in node 292.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (195): (0 &gt; 1)    15 or fewer. Reversal of synapomorphy 8 of node 177.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Total    number of vertebrae (227): (1 &gt; 0) 40 or fewer. Reversal of synapmorphy 4    of the Characidae. Paralleled in nodes 205 and 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Position    of ventral end of posttemporal (253): (1 &gt; 0) anterior or lateral to lateral    margin of epioccipital. Reversal of synapomorphy 10 of node 177.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Scales    covering supraoccipital spine (324): (0 &gt; 1) present and completely covering    supraoccipital spine. Paralleled in <i>Prochilodus lineatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Rhinosphenoid    (47): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of the Characidae. Paralleled    in nodes 207, 260, 280, and 298 and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Attonitus    ephimeros</i>, <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>,    <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Cusps    of teeth on outer premaxillary row (125): (0 &gt; 1) five or more cusps. Paralleled    in nodes 265 and 294 and in <i>Bryconops melanurus</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>,    <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, and <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Bryconamericus agna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of teeth in inner premaxillary row (130): (0 &gt; 1) eight or more. Paralleled    in the Aphyoditeinae, in node 170, and in <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, <i>Phenacogaster    tegatus</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>, and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of cusps of anterior maxillary teeth (139): (0 &gt; 1) five or more cusps. Paralleled    in the Rhoadsiinae, in nodes 273, 283, and 294, and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>,    <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Hemibrycon dariensis</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    pulchripinnis</i>, and <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in node 246.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Ventral    margin of anterior ceratohyal (179): (0 &gt; 1) with notches for articulation    of branchiostegal rays. Paralleled in nodes 167 and 189 and in <i>Micralestes    stormsi</i> and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (0 &gt; 1) two. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 179. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in node 280, and in <i>Bryconaethiops    macrops</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax    goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>,    <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 249 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on second ceratobranchial (193): (0 &gt; 1) two. Paralleled in    nodes 210, 225, 276, and 297 and in <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    elachys</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Humeral    spot (341): (0 &gt; 1) horizontally-ovate. Paralleled in node 259 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus    pantaneiro</i>, <i>Jupiaba mucronata</i>, and <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (53): (1 &gt; 0) extends posteriorly to, at least, middle    length of neural complex of Weberian apparatus. (k11-14). Paralleled in the    Serrasalmidae, in nodes 182 and 205, and in <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i> and    <i>Prochilodus lineatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Brycon meeki</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Coracoid    foramen (243): (1 &gt; 0) absent or reduced to small pore. (k11-14). Reversal    of synapomorphy 4 of node 179. Paralleled in node 205 and in <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Dorsal-fin    rays articulating with first dorsal pterygiophore (266): (0 &gt; 1) three or    four. (k9-10). Paralleled in nodes 203 and 276 and in <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>    and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Anterior    extension of <i>adductor arcus palatini</i> (336): (1 &gt; 0) covering most    of dorsal surface of mesopterygoid. (k9-10). Paralleled in node 166 and in <i>Creagrutus    anary</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Brycon meeki</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Temporal    fossa (13): (1 &gt; 0) well developed. Paralleled in node 300 and in <i>Bryconexodon    juruenae</i> and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of epurals (297): (0 &gt; 1) three. Paralleled in the Alestidae and in node    167.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Contact    between frontals anteriorly to frontal fontanel (21): (1 &gt; 0) absent. (k11-14).    Paralleled in node 167 and in <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in nodes 175 and 206.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (53): (1 &gt; 0) extends posteriorly to, at least, middle    length of neural complex of Weberian apparatus. (k11-14). Paralleled in the    Serrasalmidae, in nodes 182 and 205, and in <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i> and    <i>Prochilodus lineatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Brycon falcatus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Laterosensory    canal in antorbital (72): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the <i>Bryconops</i>    clade and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i> and <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 302: (100    / 100 / 100 / 47)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Lignobrycon</i>    and <i>Triportheus.</i></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    <i>Triportheus</i> was generally accepted even before the cladistic analysis    of Malabarba (1998b), who identified four synapomorphies for <i>Triportheus</i>    and proposed <i>Lignobrycon</i> as the sister group of the genus. Some of the    synapomorphies found here for the two analyzed species of <i>Triportheus</i>    could be applicable to more or less restricted clades within this genus, or    to the node composed of <i>Lignobrycon</i> plus <i>Triportheus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventral    projection of lagenar capsule (3): (0 &gt; 1) extending ventrally to articulation    between basioccipital and parasphenoid. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae, in    nodes 170 and 205, and in <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i> and <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Opening    between orbitosphenoid and pterosphenoid (39): (1 &gt; 0) present, rounded or    ovate, usually margined by frontal dorsally. Paralleled in node 205 and in <i>Thoracocharax    stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Position    of antorbital relative to lateral ethmoid in lateral view (56): (0 &gt; 1) antorbital    overlapping lateral ethmoid. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Lateral    overlap of first infraorbital by anterior margin of second infraorbital (60):    (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the <i>Bryconops</i> clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (1 &gt; 0) reaching horizontal arm of preopercle.    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 180. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae and    Iguanodectinae, in nodes 184, 198, and 225, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Brycon pesu</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Moenkhausia    sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>,    and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>. Some trees: Reversed in node 292.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Form    of fourth infraorbital (67): (0 &gt; 1) longer dorsoventrally than longitudinally.    Paralleled in node 189.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Branching    of laterosensory canals of fourth or fifth infraorbitals (74): (1 &gt; 0) absent.    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 177.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Epiphyseal    branch of corresponding supraorbital canals (85): (0 &gt; 1) oriented obliquely,    opening posteriorly to epiphyseal bar. Paralleled in <i>Heterocharax macrolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Number    of maxillary teeth (136): (1 &gt; 0) up to three. Reversal of synapomorphy 5    of node 177.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Extent    of implantation of teeth along maxilla (137): (1 &gt; 0) not reaching middle    of maxillary lamella. Reversal of synapomorphy 6 of node 177.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Anterodorsal    lobe of metapterygoid oriented towards mesopterygoid (166): (0 &gt; 1) present,    conspicuous and anteriorly oriented.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Relative    length of palatine (172): (0 &gt; 1) distinctly longer than one-half length    of ectopterygoid. Paralleled in nodes 197 and 261 and in <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>    and <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Suprapreopercle    (175): (0 &gt; 1) autogenous, separated from preopercle. Paralleled in node    210 and in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>14.</b> Bony    lamella dorsal to fourth basibranchial (185): (1 &gt; 0) present. Paralleled    in nodes 168, 170, and 203 and in <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>15.</b> Edentulous    basihyal lamella (189): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the Alestidae and    Heterocharacinae, in node 175, and in <i>Bryconops affinis</i> and <i>Carnegiella    strigata</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>16.</b> Anterior    development of basihyal (190): (1 &gt; 0) broadly extending beyond anterior    margin of hypohyals. Paralleled in node 170.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>17.</b> Distribution    of denticles on gill rakers (202): (1 &gt; 0) restricted to margins, or absent.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>18.</b> Attachment    of first branchiostegal ray (215): (0 &gt; 1) posterior to one-half length of    anterior ceratohyal.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>19.</b> Development    of transverse process of neural arch of third vertebra (219): (0 &gt; 1) well    developed and extending beyond anterior margin of tripus. Paralleled in <i>Agoniates    anchovia</i>, <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>, <i>Deuterodon langei</i>, <i>Engraulisoma    taeniatum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>,    and <i>Thayeria obliqua</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Microschemobrycon    casiquiare</i> and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>20.</b> Total    number of vertebrae (227): (1 &gt; 0) 40 or fewer. Reversal of synapmorphy 4    of the Characidae. Paralleled in node 302 and in <i>Brycon pesu</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>21.</b> Medial    laminar expansion at dorsal tip of cleithrum (236): (0 &gt; 1) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>22.</b> Dorsal    development of cleithrum (237): (0 &gt; 1) ending in a position just dorsal    of tip of mesocoracoid. Paralleled in <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>23.</b> Development    of medial lamella of coracoid (238): (0 &gt; 1) expanded as a keel. Paralleled    in node 170 and in <i>Paragoniates alburnus</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>,    <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>24.</b> Second    postcleithrum (248): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae and    in <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i> and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>25.</b> Third    postcleithrum (249): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae and    in <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>26.</b> Number    of branched pelvic-fin rays (258): (1 &gt; 0) six or less. Paralleled in the    Aphyocharacinae, in nodes 220, 236, and 280, and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>, <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>, <i>Hollandichthys    multifasciatus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, and <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>27.</b> Articulation    between pelvic bones (261): (0 &gt; 1) with bony interdigitations between ischiatic    processes. Paralleled in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i> and <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>28.</b> Anterior    extension of pelvic-bone along main axis (262): (0 &gt; 1) projecting anterior    of lateral and medial lamellae of pelvic bone. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae    and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>,    <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, and <i>Stethaprion erythrops</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>29.</b> Position    of anteriormost epineurals (274): (0 &gt; 1) reaching to cranium. Paralleled    in nodes 170 and 175 and in <i>Distichodus maculatus</i> and <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>30.</b> Overlap    of maxilla by second infraorbital (61): (1 &gt; 0) absent. (k9-10). Paralleled    in the Alestidae and in node 205.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>31.</b> Alignment    of cusps of medial teeth on inner premaxillary row (127): (1 &gt; 0) forming    anteriorly concave semicircle from ventral view. (k9-10). Paralleled in nodes    183 and 262 and in <i>Moenkhausia dichroura</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>32.</b> Posterior    extent of ventral process of quadrate (151): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of posterior    margin of symplectic. (k 9-10). Paralleled in the <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>    clade and Iguanodectinae, in nodes 284, 289, and 298, and in <i>Astyanax mexicanus</i>,    <i>A</i>. cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>,    <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Metynnis    maculatus</i>, <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>,    <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>, <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>, <i>Psellogrammus    kennedyi</i>, and <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>33.</b> Anteriorly    directed spine at base of first rib (223): (0 &gt; 1) present. (k9-10). Paralleled    in the Heterocharacinae and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>34.</b> Base    of second pectoral ray (231): (0 &gt; 1) similar in form and size to base of    posterior rays. (k9-10). Paralleled in node 175 and in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>35.</b> Coracoid    foramen (243): (1 &gt; 0) absent or reduced to small pore. (k11-14). Reversal    of synapomorphy 4 of node 179. Paralleled in node 205 and in <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>36.</b> <i>Circulii</i>    on posterior field of scales (319): (0 &gt; 1) absent. (k9-10). Paralleled in    the Gasteropelecidae, in nodes 168 and 206, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>37.</b> <i>Radii</i>    oriented towards anterior field of scales (321): (2 &gt; 0) present. (k9-10).    Reversal of synapomorphy 9 of the Characidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>38.</b> <i>Radii</i>    of scales (322): (0 &gt; 1) converging at focus. (k9-10). Reversal of synapomorphy    7 of the Characidae. Paralleled in node 273 and in <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>    and <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Microschemobrycon    casiquiare</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Triportheus pantanensis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Total    number of transitional vertebrae (228): (0 &gt; 1) three or fewer. Paralleled    in node 205 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus pantaneiro</i>, <i>Characidium rachovii</i>,    <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>, and <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>No autapomorphies    found for <i>Triportheus nematurus</i>.</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 189: (100    / 100 / 61 / 20)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Aphyocharacinae,    Aphyoditeinae, Characinae, Cheirodontinae, Gymnocharacinae, Heterocharacinae,    Iguanodectinae, Rhoadsiinae, Stethaprioninae, Stevardiinae, and Tetragonopterinae;    <i>Astyanax</i> clade, <i>Astyanax paris</i> clade, <i>Bramocharax</i> clade,    <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i> clade, <i>Bryconops</i> clade, <i>Hyphessobrycon    anisitsi</i> clade, and <i>Pseudochalceus</i> clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This node is congruent    with clade 15 of Buckup (1998), which included the genera <i>Bryconops</i>,    <i>Charax</i>, <i>Cynopotamus</i>, <i>Oligosarcus</i>, <i>Phenacogaster</i>,    and <i>Tetragonopterus</i>. According to that author, this clade is supported    by two synapomorphies: the frontal expanded lateral to the supraorbital laterosensory    canal and the absence of an inner dentary row of teeth. The former of these    synapomorphies is related with the presence and size of the supraorbital bone,    and it is coded differently in this study. The second synapomorphy is corroborated    here.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Form    of fourth infraorbital (67): (0 &gt; 1) longer dorsoventrally than longitudinally.    Paralleled in node 302. Reversed in nodes 200, 210, 228, 277, and 282.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Inner    row of dentary teeth (143): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae,    in nodes 166 and 168, and in <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i> and <i>Serrasalmus maculatus</i>.    Reversed in the Heterocharacinae, in node 276, and in <i>Aphyocharacidium bolivianum</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Ventral    margin of anterior ceratohyal (179): (0 &gt; 1) with notches for articulation    of branchiostegal rays. Paralleled in node 167 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>,    <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>. Reversed in node    211 and in <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Form    and articulation of neural pedicle of third vertebra (218): (0 &gt; 1) pedicle    much smaller and without an articular surface with neural complex.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Dorsal    development of dorsal process of neural pedicle of third vertebra (221): (1    &gt; 0) not broadly overlapping neural complex. Reversed in node 212.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (234): (0 &gt; 1) with concavity ventral to first postcleithrum.    Paralleled in <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>. Reversed in node 204.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 188: Iguanodectinae    (100 / 100 / 100 / 57)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Iguanodectes</i>    and <i>Piabucus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    the Iguanodectinae was proposed by Vari (1977), based in three characters of    the gas-bladder; several new synapomorphies are added in this paper, although    some of them could correspond to inner nodes within this subfamily. The monophyly    of the Iguanodectinae was corroborated by Moreira (2002), who also studied the    composition and internal relationships of this clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (1 &gt; 0) reaching horizontal arm of preopercle.    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 180. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae,    in nodes 184, 198, 225, and 302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>, <i>Brycon    pesu</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Moenkhausia    sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>,    and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>. Some trees: Reversed in node 292.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Lateral    coverage of dilator fossa by sixth infraorbital (69): (0 &gt; 1) leaving a conspicuous    naked area in anterior region of dilator fossa. Paralleled in the Iguanodetinae,    in node 197, and in <i>Charax stenopterus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Phenacogaster    tegatus</i>, and <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Laterosensory    canal of sixth infraorbital (76): (1 &gt; 0) not branched. Paralleled in node    203 and in <i>Charax stenopterus</i>, <i>Cyphocharax stellatus</i>, <i>Micralestes    stormsi</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Posterior    extent of maxilla (99): (1 &gt; 0) not reaching second infraorbital.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Medial    process of dentary bordering Meckelian cartilage dorsally and medially (115):    (0 &gt; 1) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Posterior    extent of ventral process of quadrate (151): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of posterior    margin of symplectic. Paralleled in the <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i> clade,    in nodes 284, 289, and 298, and in <i>Astyanax mexicanus</i>, <i>A</i>. cf.    <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>, <i>Diapoma    speculiferum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>,    <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Nematocharax    venustus</i>, <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>, <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>,    and <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Longitudinal    ridge in quadrate bordering <i>adductor mandibulae</i> muscle ventrally and,    to some degree, laterally (152): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes 209    and 252.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Articulation    between quadrate and anguloarticular (153): (1 &gt; 0) anterior to or at vertical    through lateral ethmoid. Paralleled in nodes 166 and 183.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Dorsal    process of ectopterygoid oriented towards lateral ethmoid (158): (0 &gt; 1)    present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Shape    of metapterygoid-quadrate fenestra (167): (0 &gt; 1) anteriorly collapsed by    convergence of metapterygoid and ventral region of quadrate.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (0 &gt; 1) two. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 179. Paralleled in node 280 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops    macrops</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax    goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>,    <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 249 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Shape    of dentigerous plate of fifth ceratobranchial (204): (1 &gt; 0) rounded, with    posterior notch. Paralleled in node 252 and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Supraneural    anterior to neural spine of fourth vertebra (279): (1 &gt; 0) absent or small.    Reversal of synapomorphy 7 of node 180. Paralleled in node 204 and in <i>Micralestes    stormsi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>14.</b> Number    of anal pterygiophores anterior to first haemal spine (293): (0 &gt; 1) four    or more. Paralleled in in node 214 and in <i>Cynopotamus argenteus</i> and <i>Gymnocorymbus    ternetzi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>15.</b> <i>Radii</i>    on scales (320): (1 &gt; 0) absent or reduced in number. Paralleled in the Serrasalminae,    in node 174, and in <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>, <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>,    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, and <i>Phenagoniates macrolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>16.</b> Longitudinal    position of insertion of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> tendon on dentary (330):    (0 &gt; 1) on vertical through middle or anterior half of Meckelian cartilage.    Paralleled in nodes 184, 186, 209, 241, 261, and 270 and in <i>Engraulisoma    taeniatum</i> and <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>17.</b> Insertion    of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> tendon on dentary (331): (0 &gt; 2) on a medial    process of the dentary.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>18.</b> Posterior    attachment of section A1 from <i>adductor mandibulae</i> (332): (0 &gt; 1) restricted    or almost restricted to horizontal arm of preopercle. Paralleled in node 211    and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>, <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina    australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>19.</b> Ventral    union of gill membranes (349): (0 &gt; 1) joined along length of isthmus but    not attached to isthmus. Paralleled in node 162 and in <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Posterior    laminar expansion of epiphyseal bar (1): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (53): (1 &gt; 0) extends posteriorly to, at least, middle    length of neural complex of Weberian apparatus. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae,    in nodes 182 and 205, and in <i>Prochilodus lineatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Brycon meeki</i> and <i>B</i>. <i>orbignyanus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Posterior    extent of third infraorbital (65): (0 &gt; 1) relatively reduced, angle of preopercle    covered partially by fourth infraorbital. Paralleled in <i>Hemiodus</i> cf.    <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of rows of premaxillary teeth (122): (1 &gt; 0) one. Paralleled in node 195    and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Carnegiella    strigata</i>, <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>, <i>Paracheirodon    axelrodi</i>, and <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Bony    lamellae between second and third basibranchials (184): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled    in the Serrasalmidae and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Jupiaba    scologaster</i>, <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, and    <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Form    of posterior margin of cleithrum (233): (0 &gt; 1) with notch just anterior    to pectoral-fin insertion.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Development    of medial lamella of coracoid (238): (0 &gt; 1) expanded as a keel. Paralleled    in nodes 170 and 302 and in <i>Paragoniates alburnus</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Third    postcleithrum (249): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae,    in node 302, and in <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>,    and <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Anterior    extension of pelvic-bone along main axis (262): (0 &gt; 1) projecting anterior    of lateral and medial lamellae of pelvic bone. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae,    in node 302, and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>,    and <i>Stethaprion erythrops</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Number    of branched-rays on dorsal-fin (270): (1 &gt; 0) eight or fewer. Paralleled    in the Stevardiinae and in <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i>, and <i>Hoplocharax    goethei</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Position    of anteriormost epineurals (274): (0 &gt; 1) reaching to cranium. Paralleled    in nodes 170, 175, and 302 and in <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Number    of dorsal pterygiophores (276): (1 &gt; 0) nine. Paralleled in the Stevardiinae,    in node 184, and in <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Anal-fin    position (284): (0 &gt; 1) extended anteriorly ventral to dorsal fin. Paralleled    in nodes 170, 208, 212, and 236.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>14.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (289): (0 &gt; 1) 35 or more. Paralleled in nodes    207 and 212 and in <i>Gymnocorymbus ternetzi</i>, <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>,    <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i> , <i>Stethaprion    erythrops</i>, and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    node 261 and in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>15.</b> Contact    between dorsal margin of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> and ventral margin of <i>dilator    operculi</i> (335): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in <i>Creagrutus anary</i>,    <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>, <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>,    <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>. Some trees:    Paralleled in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Relative    length of pterotic spine (46): (0 &gt; 1) restricted to attachment region of    hyomandibular ligament. Paralleled in node 205.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Laterosensory    canal in antorbital (72): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the <i>Bryconops</i>    clade and in <i>Brycon falcatus</i> and <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Medial    anteroventral notch of dentary (114): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in node    209.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Maxillary    teeth (134): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Coptobrycon    bilineatus</i>, <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i> and <i>Psellogrammus    kennedyi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of maxillary teeth (135): (1 &gt; 0) only one, or absent. Paralleled in the    <i>Astyanax</i> clade, in nodes 284 and 290, and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>,    <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>, <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i>, and <i>Hyphessobrycon    bifasciatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Paracheirodon    axelrodi</i>, and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (196): (0 &gt; 1)    ten or fewer. Paralleled in the Characinae and in <i>Bryconops melanurus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>, and <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in node 196 and in <i>Hemigrammus erythrozonus</i> and    <i>Hyphessobrycon herbertaxelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (235): (0 &gt; 1) with markedly concave margin, almost forming    straight angle. Paralleled in nodes 162, 247, and 253 and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Characidium borellii</i>, <i>Moenkhausia</i>    cf. <i>intermedia</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates    bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Number    of unbranched anal-fin rays (285): (1 &gt; 0) three or fewer. Paralleled in    node 252 and in <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (288): (1 &gt; 0) 24 or less. Reversal of synapomorphy    5 of the Characidae. Paralleled in nodes 200, 277, and 300 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus    pantaneiro</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 206: (-2    / 97 / - / 26)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Aphyocharacinae,    Aphyoditeinae, Characinae, Cheirodontinae, Gymnocharacinae, Heterocharacinae,    Rhoadsiinae, Stethaprioninae, Stevardiinae, and Tetragonopterinae; <i>Astyanax</i>    clade, <i>Astyanax paris</i> clade, <i>Bramocharax</i> clade, <i>Bryconamericus    scleroparius</i> clade, <i>Bryconops</i> clade, <i>Hyphessobrycon anisitsi</i>    clade, and <i>Pseudochalceus</i> clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Mirande (2009)    obtained a trichotomy composed of the Iguanodectinae, the <i>Bryconops</i> clade,    and a large clade containing the Heterocharacinae and the characids lacking    a supraorbital. This trichotomy is resolved in this study, being the Iguanodectinae    the sister group of the remaining two clades, which form in the present study    a monophyletic group herein described. Although this node was obtained in the    globally more stable hypothesis, in most analyses under self-weighted optimization    (see Mirande, 2009) the Iguanodectinae is the sister group of the <i>Bryconops</i>    clade, a resolution which is incongruent with this node.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Horizontal    process of anguloarticular (108): (1 &gt; 0) laterally covered by dentary only    anteriorly. Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node 180. Paralleled in node 176.    Reversed in nodes 246, 253, and 261 and in <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Position    of coronomeckelian (110): (1 &gt; 0) situated mainly lateral to Meckelian cartilage.    Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae, in node 176, and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>    and <i>Prochilodus lineatus</i>. Reversed in nodes 200, 282, and 290 and in    <i>Hemigrammus erythrozonus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> <i>Circulii</i>    on posterior field of scales (319): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae,    in node 168, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node    302. Reversed in node 261 and in <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>, <i>Phenagoniates macrolepis</i>,    and <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Contact    between frontals anteriorly to frontal fontanel (21): (1 &gt; 0) absent. (k11-14).    Paralleled in node 167 and in <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in node 175 and in <i>Brycon meeki</i>. Reversed in <i>Bario steindachneri</i>,    <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>, <i>Galeocharax humeralis</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>,    and <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>. Some trees: Reversed in <i>Knodus breviceps</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 278: <i>Bryconops</i>    clade (100 / 100 / 100 / 30)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genus <i>Bryconops</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Monophyly of <i>Bryconops</i>    had not previously been tested. Three subgenera were proposed within this genus,    <i>Brycochandus</i> Eigenmann, <i>Bryconops</i>, and <i>Creatochanes</i> G&uuml;nther    (G&eacute;ry, 1977). The two species analyzed here correspond to the subgenus    <i>Creatochanes</i> according to that classification, and the diagnosis provided    for this clade may be different if species of the other subgenera were included.    In most analyses under self-weighted optimization this clade is the sister group    of the Iguanodectinae, and <i>Bryconops</i>, even if monophyletic, will not    justify a subfamilial-level name. Thus, both the monophyly and the proposed    relationships of <i>Bryconops</i> should be further corroborated.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    overlap of first infraorbital by anterior margin of second infraorbital (60):    (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Laterosensory    canal in antorbital (72): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in <i>Brycon falcatus</i>,    <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>, and <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Branching    of laterosensory canals of fourth or fifth infraorbitals (74): (0 &gt; 1) present.    Paralleled in nodes 167, 177, 218, 260, and 276 and in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>,    <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>, and <i>Piaractus mesopotamicus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Degree    of ventral curvature of lateral line (90): (0 &gt; 1) distinctly curved and    ventrally situated, with posterior lying within ventral half of caudal peduncle    and aligned with lower lobe of caudal fin. Paralleled in the Alestidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Canal    of lateral line on caudal-fin membrane (92): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of the Characidae. Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae, in nodes    227, 229, 244, 287, 294, and 298, and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Bryconamericus    rubropictus</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i>, <i>Charax stenopterus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    anisitsi</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Abrupt    decrease in size of dentary teeth (148): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes    222, 255, and 299, and in <i>Astyanax latens</i> and <i>A</i>. <i>paris</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Contact    between lamella on anterior portion of first basibranchial with lamella on posterior    portion of second basibranchial (183): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes    168, 177, and 216 and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>, <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>,    <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>,    and <i>Piabina argentea</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Number    of ventral procurrent caudal-fin rays (302): (0 &gt; 1) 12 or more. Paralleled    in nodes 229 and 252 and in <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Number    of 2n chromosomes (362): (1 &gt; 0) 48 or less. Paralleled in node 181.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Bryconops melanurus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Articulation    between second and third infraorbitals (62): (0 &gt; 2) posteroventrally angled.    Paralleled in the Characinae, in nodes 176 and 300, and in <i>Hollandichthys    multifasciatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Cusps    of teeth on outer premaxillary row (125): (0 &gt; 1) five or more cusps. Paralleled    in nodes 265 and 294 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>,    <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, and <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Bryconamericus agna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (196): (0 &gt; 1)    ten or fewer. Paralleled in the Characinae and in <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>,    <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>, and <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>. Some    trees: Paralleled in node 196 and in <i>Hemigrammus erythrozonus</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon    herbertaxelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Bryconops affinis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Edentulous    basihyal lamella (189): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the Alestidae and    Heterocharacinae, in nodes 175 and 302, and in <i>Carnegiella strigata</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 205: (100    / 100 / 92 / 26)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Aphyocharacinae,    Aphyoditeinae, Characinae, Cheirodontinae, Gymnocharacinae, Heterocharacinae,    Rhoadsiinae, Stethaprioninae, Stevardiinae, and Tetragonopterinae; <i>Astyanax</i>    clade, <i>Astyanax paris</i> clade, <i>Bramocharax</i> clade, <i>Bryconamericus    scleroparius</i> clade, <i>Hyphessobrycon anisitsi</i> clade, and <i>Pseudochalceus</i>    clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    this clade had not been proposed in previous phylogenies. A comparable clade    obtained by Lucena (1993) included, in addition the, families Alestidae and    Serrasalmidae, the subfamily Bryconinae, and the genera <i>Bryconops</i> and    <i>Roestes</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventral    longitudinal lamellae of basioccipital (2): (1 &gt; 0) falling short of posterior    border of basioccipital. Paralleled in node 170 and in <i>Serrasalmus maculatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Ventral    projection of lagenar capsule (3): (0 &gt; 1) extending ventrally to articulation    between basioccipital and parasphenoid. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae, in    nodes 170 and 302, and in <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i> and <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>.    Reversed in node 210 and in <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Opening    between orbitosphenoid and pterosphenoid (39): (1 &gt; 0) present, rounded or    ovate, usually margined by frontal dorsally. Paralleled in node 302 and in <i>Thoracocharax    stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Relative    length of pterotic spine (46): (0 &gt; 1) restricted to attachment region of    hyomandibular ligament. Paralleled in <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>. Reversed    in <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (53): (1 &gt; 0) extends posteriorly to, at least, middle    length of neural complex of Weberian apparatus. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae,    in node 182, and in <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i> and <i>Prochilodus lineatus</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Brycon meeki</i> and <i>B</i>. <i>orbignyanus</i>.    Reversed in nodes 272 and 287 and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>, <i>Deuterodon    iguape</i>, and <i>Lonchogenys ilisha</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Overlap    of maxilla by second infraorbital (61): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in the    Alestidae. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302. Reversed in <i>Hollandichthys    multifasciatus</i> and <i>Mimagoniates rheocharis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Supraorbital    (70): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in nodes 170 and 185 and in <i>Micralestes    stormsi</i>. Reversed in <i>Lonchogenys ilisha</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Number    of maxillary teeth (136): (0 &gt; 1) four or more. Paralleled in nodes 177 and    181 and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i> and <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>.    Reversed in nodes 232 and 246 and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Extent    of implantation of teeth along maxilla (137): (0 &gt; 1) extending across almost    entire maxillary lamella. Paralleled in node 177 and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>    and <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>. Reversed in node 202.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Foramen    in posterior region of metapterygoid (168): (2 &gt; 1) present, encircled by    metapterygoid or bordered partially by cartilage. Paralleled in <i>Salminus    brasiliensis</i>. Reversed in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i> and <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Total    number of vertebrae (227): (1 &gt; 0) 40 or fewer. Reversal of synapomorphy    4 of the Characidae. Paralleled in node 302 and in <i>Brycon pesu</i>. Reversed    in node 209.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Total    number of transitional vertebrae (228): (0 &gt; 1) three or fewer. Paralleled    in <i>Acestrorhynchus pantaneiro</i>, <i>Characidium rachovii</i>, <i>Cyphocharax    spilotus</i>, <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, and <i>Triportheus pantanensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Coracoid    foramen (243): (1 &gt; 0) absent or reduced to small pore. Reversal of synapomorphy    4 of node 179. Paralleled in <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in node 302 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>. Reversed in <i>Heterocharax macrolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>14.</b> Ventral    exit of laterosensory canal of supracleithrum (254): (0 &gt; 1) ventral to lamella    of supracleithrum and exiting on posterior margin of this bone. Paralleled in    <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>. Reversed in node 193 and in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>15.</b> Uroneurals    (306): (1 &gt; 0) absent or just one pair. Reversal of synapomorphy 8 of node    180. Reversed in the Tetragonopterinae, in nodes 276 and 300, and in <i>Bryconamericus    scleroparius</i>, <i>Galeocharax humeralis</i>, and <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 217: Heterocharacinae    (100 / 100 / 99 / 35)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Gnathocharax</i>?,    <i>Heterocharax</i>, <i>Hoplocharax</i>, and <i>Lonchogenys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    a clade composed of <i>Gnathocharax</i> (not analyzed here), <i>Heterocharax</i>,    <i>Hoplocharax</i>, and <i>Lonchogenys</i> was proposed by Lucena (1998). According    to his hypothesis, this clade also included the subfamily Characinae. The tentative    inclusion of <i>Gnathocharax</i> in this subfamily follows Lucena (1998). Lucena    &amp; Menezes (2003) followed this classification and included these genera    in the Characinae. The relationships of the miniature genus <i>Priocharax</i>    Weitzman &amp; Vari (not analyzed here) are uncertain. In the phylogeny of Lucena    (1998) <i>Priocharax</i> is the sister group of the remaining members of the    Characinae (including the members of this clade). Lucena &amp; Menezes (2003)    also included <i>Priocharax</i> in the Characinae, and that classification is    followed herein as far as the placement of this genus pending focused studies    of 
this question. Toledo-Piza (2007) obtained a sister-group relationship between    <i>Gnathocharax</i> and the cynodontin <i>Roestes</i> separate from the remaining    taxa of the Cynodontinae. She stated, however, that not all the information    relating <i>Roestes</i> with the remaining Cynodontinae was included in her    analysis. Until the relationships of <i>Gnathocharax</i> be further studied    it is tentatively included in this clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventromedial    opening of posttemporal fossa (8): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes 175    and 184.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Dorsal    process of pterotic where tendon from epaxial musculature attach (45): (0 &gt;    1) present, projecting dorsally from tube for semicircular canal. Paralleled    in node 193 and in <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i> and <i>Serrasalmus maculatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (1 &gt; 0) reaching horizontal arm of preopercle.    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 180. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in    nodes 184, 198, 225, and 302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>, <i>Brycon pesu</i>,    <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>,    <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>, and <i>Stichonodon    insignis</i>. Some trees: Reversed in node 292.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Laterosensory    canal of first infraorbital (73): (1 &gt; 0) projects dorsally from main body    of first infraorbital. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Morphology    of premaxillary, maxillary, and dentary teeth (118): (1 &gt; 0) all teeth conical,    caniniform or mamilliform. Paralleled in nodes 174, 181, and 211 and in <i>Axelrodia    lindeae</i>, <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, and <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Inner    row of dentary teeth (143): (1 &gt; 0) present. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of    node 189. Paralleled in node 276 and in <i>Aphyocharacidium bolivianum</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Anterior    extension of interopercle (163): (0 &gt; 1) not extending anteriorly beyond    terminus of horizontal arm of preopercle. Paralleled in nodes 162, 174, and    212 and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i> and <i>Piaractus mesopotamicus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Shape    of posteroventral corner of preopercle (174): (1 &gt; 0) acute.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Edentulous    basihyal lamella (189): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the Alestidae, in    nodes 175 and 302, and in <i>Bryconops affinis</i> and <i>Carnegiella strigata</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Anteriorly    directed spine at base of first rib (223): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in    <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Horizontal    line of chromatophores just dorsal to anal-fin base (344): (0 &gt; 1) present.    Paralleled in <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Fourth    infraorbital (66): (0 &gt; 1) absent or much reduced and bordered posteriorly    by third and fifth infraorbitals.
