Paralleled in the Aphyocharacinae and Gasteropelecidae,    in node 186, and in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Hemigrammus    erythrozonus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>, and <i>Nematobrycon palmeri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Lateral    coverage of dilator fossa by sixth infraorbital (69): (0 &gt; 1) leaving a conspicuous    naked area in anterior region of dilator fossa. Paralleled in the Iguanodetinae,    in node 197, and in <i>Charax stenopterus</i>, <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>,    and <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Lateral    line (91): (0 &gt; 1) interrupted. Paralleled in nodes 227, 229, 279, 288, and    294 and in <i>Characidium rachovii</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon anisitsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia    sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Bony    lamellae between second and third basibranchials (184): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled    in the Serrasalmidae and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Jupiaba scologaster</i>, <i>Piabucus    melanostomus</i>, <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, and    <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (0 &gt; 1) two. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 179. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in node 280, and in <i>Brycon    orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Cheirodon    interruptus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>,    <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 249 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on second ceratobranchial (193): (0 &gt; 1) two. Paralleled in    nodes 210, 225, 276, and 297 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    elachys</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Number    of branched pelvic-fin rays (258): (1 &gt; 0) six or less. Paralleled in the    Aphyocharacinae, in nodes 220, 236, 280, and 302, and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>, <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>, <i>Hollandichthys    multifasciatus</i>, and <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Hasemania nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Number    of branched-rays on dorsal-fin (270): (1 &gt; 0) eight or fewer. Paralleled    in the Stevardiinae and in <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i>, and <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Number    of dorsal pterygiophores (276): (1 &gt; 0) nine. Paralleled in the Stevardiinae,    in node 184, and in <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Ventral    procurrent caudal-fin rays of adult males (303): (0 &gt; 1) projecting ventrally    through peduncle musculature and skin. Paralleled in node 229 and in <i>Axelrodia    lindeae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 216: (72    / 95 / 12 / 29)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Heterocharax</i>    and <i>Lonchogenys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">A sister-group    relationship of the monotypic genera <i>Heterocharax</i> and <i>Lonchogenys</i>    were previously proposed by Lucena (1998) and is corroborated here.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of caudal-fin canal of lateral line (93): (0 &gt; 1) almost reaching posterior    margin of caudal fin. Paralleled in node 177 and in <i>Astyanax pelegrini</i>    and <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Contact    between lamella on anterior portion of first basibranchial with lamella on posterior    portion of second basibranchial (183): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the    <i>Bryconops</i> clade, in nodes 168 and 177, and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>,    <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Hoplias</i>    cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, and <i>Piabina argentea</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Lonchogenys ilisha</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (53): (0 &gt; 1) extends only to anterior limit of neural    complex. Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node 205. Paralleled in nodes 272 and    287 and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i> and <i>Deuterodon iguape</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Supraorbital    (70): (1 &gt; 0) present. Reversal of synapomorphy 7 of node 205.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Foramen    on articular condyle of quadrate (149): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes    168, 211, and 231 and in <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    eques</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Median    predorsal scales (325): (0 &gt; 1) leaving naked area anterior to dorsal fin.    Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae and in node 284.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Heterocharax macrolepis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Extent    of expansion of first infraorbital lateral to maxilla (59): (0 &gt; 1) covering    most of maxilla. Paralleled in node 277 and in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Epiphyseal    branch of corresponding supraorbital canals (85): (0 &gt; 1) oriented obliquely,    opening posteriorly to epiphyseal bar. Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Articulation    between ventral margin of metapterygoid and posterodorsal margin of quadrate    (155): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes 176 and 299 and in <i>Deuterodon    langei</i>, <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>, <i>Roeboides descalvadensis</i>, and    <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Coracoid    foramen (243): (0 &gt; 1) well developed. Reversal of synapomorphy 13 of node    205.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 204: (100    / 100 / 59 / 7)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Aphyocharacinae,    Aphyoditeinae, Characinae, Cheirodontinae, Gymnocharacinae, Rhoadsiinae, Stethaprioninae,    Stevardiinae, and Tetragonopterinae; <i>Astyanax</i> clade, <i>Astyanax paris</i>    clade, <i>Bramocharax</i> clade, <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i> clade, <i>Hyphessobrycon    anisitsi</i> clade, and <i>Pseudochalceus</i> clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This clade includes    most characids without a supraorbital. A monophyletic group containing the characids    lacking a supraorbital was proposed by Malabarba &amp; Weitzman (2003: <a href="#f2">fig.    2</a>). Most species of this clade are morphologically highly conservative,    and some of the important factors leading to variation between species involve    diet or miniaturization. These usually have poor correlations with phylogeny    and relationships between the members of this clade are among the less resolved    within the Characiformes. The molecular phylogeny of Calcagnotto <i>et al</i>.    (2005) shows a polytomy in the clade containing this group of characids, suggesting    that molecular data are not necessarily better than morphology in assessing    the internal relationships within this clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Distance    between cartilage anterior to orbitosphenoid and lateral ethmoids (38): (0 &gt;    1) distant from lateral ethmoids. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 179. Reversed    in node 223 and in <i>Bryconexodon juruenae</i> and <i>Galeocharax humeralis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Lateral    surface of vertical canal of preopercle (81): (1 &gt; 0) canal uncovered and    situated posteriorly to musculature and infraorbitals. Paralleled in nodes 170    and 175 and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i> and <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>.    Reversed in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Hyoid    artery (178): (0 &gt; 1) emerging from anterior ceratohyal near its articulation    with posterior ceratohyal.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (234): (1 &gt; 0) without concavity ventral to first postcleithrum.    Reversal of synapomorphy 6 of node 189. Reversed in nodes 196 and 289 and in    <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i> and <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Bony    ridge of coracoid between base of mesocoracoid and ventral margin of interosseous    space (239): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Form    of third postcleithrum (250): (0 &gt; 1) with a posterior lamella. Reversed    in node 242 and in <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>,    and <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Supraneural    anterior to neural spine of fourth vertebra (279): (1 &gt; 0) absent or small.    Reversal of synapomorphy 7 of node 180. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae and    in <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 213: Characinae    (67 / 95 / 7 / 4)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acanthocharax</i>    Eigenmann, <i>Acestrocephalus</i> Eigenmann, <i>Bryconexodon</i> G&eacute;ry,    <i>Charax</i>, <i>Cynopotamus</i>, <i>Exodon</i>, <i>Galeocharax</i>, <i>Phenacogaster</i>,    <i>Priocharax</i>?, <i>Roeboexodon</i>, and <i>Roeboides</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Exodon</i> and    <i>Roeboexodon</i> were included in the subfamily Characinae by G&eacute;ry    (1977), but later considered as <i>incertae sedis</i> by Lima <i>et al</i>.    (2003), along with <i>Bryconexodon</i> and many other genera. <i>Exodon</i>    is the sister group of <i>Roeboides</i> in the analysis by Calcagnotto <i>et    al</i>. (2005), whereas it is related to <i>Oligosarcus</i> according to Lucena    (1993). Lucena &amp; Menezes (2003) included <i>Gnathocharax</i>, <i>Heterocharax</i>,    <i>Hoplocharax</i>, and <i>Lonchogenys</i> in the Characinae but these are classified    here, at least preliminarily in the case of <i>Gnathocharax</i>, in the subfamily    Heterocharacinae. According to Lucena (1998) the miniature genus <i>Priocharax</i>    is the sister group of a clade including <i>Gnathocharax</i>, <i>Heterocharax</i>,    <i>Hoplocharax</i>, <i>Lonchogenys</i>, and the remaining characins. This 
position,    basal to Heterocharacinae plus Characinae, would exclude <i>Priocharax</i> from    the latter subfamily. <i>Priocharax</i>, however, was not analyzed and it is    provisionally maintained in the Characinae pending specific studies.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of sphenotic spine (10): (1 &gt; 0) not extending ventrally to articulation    between sphenotic and hyomandibula. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 180.    Paralleled in nodes 176 and 197. Reversed in node 218.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Articulation    between second and third infraorbitals (62): (0 &gt; 2) posteroventrally angled.    Paralleled in nodes 176 and 300 and in <i>Bryconops melanurus</i> and <i>Hollandichthys    multifasciatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (196): (0 &gt; 1)    ten or fewer. Paralleled in <i>Bryconops melanurus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>,    <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>, and <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>. Some    trees: Paralleled in node 196 and in <i>Hemigrammus erythrozonus</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon    herbertaxelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of 2n chromosomes (363): (0 &gt; 1) 52 or more. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae,    in node 196, and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon herbertaxelrodi</i>,    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Hemigrammus unilineatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 277: (100    / 100 / 55 / 16)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Bryconexodon</i>,    <i>Exodon</i>, and <i>Roeboexodon</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The genera <i>Bryconexodon</i>,    <i>Exodon</i>, and <i>Roeboexodon</i> share with <i>Catoprion</i>, <i>Probolodus</i>,    <i>Roeboides</i>, and <i>Serrabrycon</i> the presence of teeth oriented outside    the mouth, which are presumably associated with lepidophagous habits (Lucena,    1998). <i>Catoprion</i> is a member of the Serrasalmidae (J&eacute;gu, 2003),    while <i>Probolodus</i> is herein included in the Tetragonopterinae. Although    <i>Roeboides</i> is a member of the Characinae, the possession of teeth outside    the mouth is a parallelism between the present clade and that genus, something    already proposed by Lucena (1998). The relationships of <i>Serrabrycon magoi</i>    Vari are unknown, although Vari (1986) mentioned the possibility of a close    relationship between that genus and <i>Bryconexodon</i>, <i>Exodon</i>, <i>Probolodus</i>,    <i>Roeboexodon</i>, and/or <i>Roeboides</i>. According to his 
description, <i>Serrabrycon    magoi</i> shares with these genera the possession of teeth outside the mouth,    which are associated with a lepidophagous habit. <i>Serrabrycon</i>, however,    is considered here as <i>incertae sedis</i> given the homoplastic nature of    this character within the order. The three genera included in this clade are    rather dissimilar each other; however this node is well supported.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Extent    of expansion of first infraorbital lateral to maxilla (59): (0 &gt; 1) covering    most of maxilla. Paralleled in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i> and <i>Heterocharax    macrolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Form    of fourth infraorbital (67): (1 &gt; 0) approximately square or more developed    longitudinally than dorsoventrally. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 189.    Paralleled in 200, 210, 228, and 282.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Mamilliform    teeth outside mouth (120): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in node 218 and in    <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (288): (1 &gt; 0) 24 or less. Reversal of synapomorphy    5 of the Characidae. Paralleled in nodes 200 and 300 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus    pantaneiro</i> and <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    opening between ventral diverging lamellae of mesethmoid and anterior process    of lateral ethmoid (15): (0 &gt; 1) small, ovate and partially occluded by diverging    lamellae of mesethmoid and anterior process of lateral ethmoid. Paralleled in    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i> and <i>Roeboides descalvadensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Ventral    projection of mesethmoid spine, forming a keel between premaxillae (26): (0    &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in node 253.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Bony    lamellae bordering sensory canal of nasal (34): (0 &gt; 1) wider at some point    than tubular region. Paralleled in nodes 174 and 181 and in <i>Galeocharax humeralis</i>    and <i>Leporinus striatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (1 &gt; 0) reaching horizontal arm of preopercle.    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 180. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae and    Iguanodectinae, in nodes 184, 198, 225, and 302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Brycon pesu</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Moenkhausia    sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.    Some trees: Reversed in node 292.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Development    of transverse process of neural arch of third vertebra (219): (0 &gt; 1) well    developed and extending beyond anterior margin of tripus. Paralleled in node    302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>, <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>, <i>Deuterodon    langei</i>, <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>,    and <i>Thayeria obliqua</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Microschemobrycon    casiquiare</i> and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (234): (0 &gt; 1) with concavity ventral to first postcleithrum.    Reversal of synapomorphy 4 of node 204. Paralleled in nodes 196 and 289 and    in <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 276: (67    / 95 / 57 / 16)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Bryconexodon</i>    and <i>Exodon</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    a clade composed of <i>Bryconexodon</i> and <i>Exodon</i> was not previously    proposed. In the analysis by Mirande (2009) these two genera formed a trichotomy    along with <i>Roeboexodon</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Branching    of laterosensory canals of fourth or fifth infraorbitals (74): (0 &gt; 1) present.    Paralleled in the <i>Bryconops</i> clade, in nodes 167, 177, 218, and 260, and    in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>, <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>, and <i>Piaractus    mesopotamicus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Inner    row of dentary teeth (143): (1 &gt; 0) present. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of    node 189. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae and in <i>Aphyocharacidium bolivianum</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on second ceratobranchial (193): (0 &gt; 1) two. Paralleled in    nodes 210, 225, and 297 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Dorsal-fin    rays articulating with first dorsal pterygiophore (266): (0 &gt; 1) three or    four. Paralleled in node 203 and in <i>Metynnis maculatus</i> and <i>Salminus    brasiliensis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Uroneurals    (306): (0 &gt; 1) two pairs. Reversal of synapomorphy 15 of node 205. Paralleled    in the Tetragonopterinae, in node 300, and in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>,    <i>Galeocharax humeralis</i>, and <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Contact    between frontals anteriorly to frontal fontanel (21): (0 &gt; 1) present. Reversal    of synapomorphy 4 of node 206. Paralleled in <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Galeocharax    humeralis</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>, and <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Knodus breviceps</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Morphology    of premaxillary, maxillary, and dentary teeth (118): (1 &gt; 0) all teeth conical,    caniniform or mamilliform. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae, in nodes 174,    181, and 211, and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i> and <i>Grundulus cochae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Form    of quadrate (150): (0 &gt; 1) with anterodorsal portion equal or longer than    ventral region. Paralleled in the <i>Pseudochalceus</i> clade, in nodes 170,    176, 211, and 299, and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Position    of longitudinal cartilage dorsal to ectopterygoid (161): (0 &gt; 1) displaced    laterally and separated from medial margin of mesopterygoid. Paralleled in nodes    211 and 300.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Relative    position of dorsal-fin anterior insertion (265): (1 &gt; 0) anterior to or at    vertical through pelvic-fin origin. Paralleled in node 282 and in <i>Creagrutus    anary</i>, <i>Moenkhausia xinguensis</i>, and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Bony    hooks on fin rays (307): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in the Gymnocharacinae,    in nodes 207, 283, 297, and 301, and in <i>Astyanax paris</i>, <i>Bryconamericus    mennii</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, and <i>Rhoadsia    altipinna</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon    elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> <i>Circulii</i>    on posterior field of scales (319): (1 &gt; 0) present. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 206. Paralleled in node 261 and in <i>Phenagoniates macrolepis</i>    and <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Bryconexodon juruenae</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Temporal    fossa (13): (1 &gt; 0) well developed. Paralleled in node 300 and in <i>Brycon    meeki</i> and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Distance    between cartilage anterior to orbitosphenoid and lateral ethmoids (38): (1 &gt;    0) contacting, or almost contacting, lateral ethmoids. Reversal of synapomorphy    1 of node 204. Paralleled in node 223 and in <i>Galeocharax humeralis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Anterior    paired projections of parasphenoid (40): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in <i>Bryconexodon    juruenae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Dorsolateral    processes of vomer (54): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes 215 and 218    and in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Articulation    between second and third infraorbitals (62): (2 &gt; 1) anteroventrally angled.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Articulation    between quadrate and anguloarticular (154): (1 &gt; 0) anterior to or at vertical    through middle eye. Paralleled in node 202 and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 212: (100    / 100 / 57 / 16)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acanthocharax</i>,    <i>Acestrocephalus</i>, <i>Charax</i>, <i>Cynopotamus</i>, <i>Galeocharax</i>,    <i>Phenacogaster</i>, <i>Priocharax</i>?, <i>and Roeboides</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This node corresponds    to the Characinae of Lucena &amp; Menezes (2003), with the exclusion of the    Heterocharacinae. As previously mentioned, the inclusion of <i>Priocharax</i>    in this clade is tentative.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Dorsal    expansion of rhinosphenoid (48): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in nodes 201    and 300 and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Anterior    extension of interopercle (163): (0 &gt; 1) not extending anteriorly beyond    terminus of horizontal arm of preopercle. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae,    in nodes 162 and 174, and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i> and <i>Piaractus    mesopotamicus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Form    and degree of ossification of first ceratobranchial gill rakers (200): (0 &gt;    1) rather thick and completely ossified distal region. Paralleled in nodes 176    and 299 and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>,    and <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Anterior    portions of branchiostegal rays (214): (0 &gt; 1) slender near their articulation    with ceratohyals. Paralleled in node 256 and in <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Dorsal    development of dorsal process of neural pedicle of third vertebra (221): (0    &gt; 1) broadly overlapping neural complex. Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node    189.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Transitional    vertebrae with haemal canal (229): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in node 195    and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>, <i>Metynnis    maculatus</i>, and <i>Piabina argentea</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 247    and in <i>Bryconamericus alpha</i> and <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Anal-fin    position (284): (0 &gt; 1) extended anteriorly ventral to dorsal fin. Paralleled    in nodes 170, 208, and 236 and in <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (289): (0 &gt; 1) 35 or more. Paralleled in node 207    and in <i>Gymnocorymbus ternetzi</i>, <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>, <i>Piabucus    melanostomus</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>,    <i>Stethaprion erythrops</i>, and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>. Some trees:    Paralleled in node 261 and in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    coverage of dilator fossa by sixth infraorbital (69): (0 &gt; 1) leaving a conspicuous    naked area in anterior region of dilator fossa. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae,    in node 197, and in <i>Charax stenopterus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, and    <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Laterosensory    canal of sixth infraorbital (76): (1 &gt; 0) not branched. Paralleled in the    Iguanodectinae, in node 203, and in <i>Charax stenopterus</i>, <i>Cyphocharax    stellatus</i>, and <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Lateral    line (91): (0 &gt; 1) interrupted. Paralleled in nodes 227, 229, 279, 288, and    294 and in <i>Characidium rachovii</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    anisitsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Canal    of lateral line on caudal-fin membrane (92): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of the Characidae. Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae and <i>Bryconops</i>    clade, in nodes 227, 229, 244, 287, 294, and 298, and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>,    <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i>, <i>Charax stenopterus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon anisitsi</i>, and <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Length    of ascending process of premaxilla (104): (0 &gt; 1) reaching just anterior    end of nasal. Paralleled in nodes 225 and 294 and in <i>Charax stenopterus</i>,    and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Bryconamericus    agna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Number    of teeth in inner premaxillary row (130): (0 &gt; 1) eight or more. Paralleled    in the Aphyoditeinae, in node 170, and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Grundulus    cochae</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>, and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Articulation    between quadrate and anguloarticular (154): (1 &gt; 0) anterior to or at vertical    through middle eye. Paralleled in node 202 and <i>Bryconexodon juruenae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Ethmopalatine    cartilage (171): (0 &gt; 1) present and conspicuous. Paralleled in <i>Charax    stenopterus</i> and <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Bony    lamella dorsal to fourth basibranchial (185): (1 &gt; 0) present. Paralleled    in nodes 168, 170, 203, and 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Pelvic-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (309): (1 &gt; 0)    absent. Paralleled in <i>Creagrutus anary</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon eques</i>,    <i>H</i>. <i>luetkenii</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, and <i>Stethaprion    erythrops</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i> and <i>Psellogrammus    kennedyi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Pectoral-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (310): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in node 268 and in <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>,    <i>A</i>. <i>lineatus</i>, <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Bryconamericus</i>    cf. <i>iheringii</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>rubropictus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>,    and <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Gill-derived    gland on males (352): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in node 196.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 211: (100    / 100 / 98 / 59)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acanthocharax</i>?,    <i>Acestrocephalus</i>, <i>Charax</i>, <i>Cynopotamus</i>, <i>Galeocharax</i>,    and <i>Roeboides</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    a clade composed of <i>Acanthocharax</i> (not analyzed in this study), <i>Acestrocephalus</i>,    <i>Charax</i>, <i>Cynopotamus</i>, <i>Galeocharax</i>, and <i>Roeboides</i>,    as the sister group of <i>Phenacogaster</i>, was proposed by Lucena (1998);    the tentative inclusion of <i>Acanthocharax</i> in this clade follows that paper.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Position    of sphenotic spine relative to hyomandibula (11): (0 &gt; 1) displaced anteriorly    relative to anterior margin of hyomandibula. Paralleled in node 162 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus    pantaneiro</i>, <i>Piabina argentea</i>, <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>, and <i>Serrasalmus    maculatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Subtemporal    fossa (18): (1 &gt; 0) medially extended to middle exoccipital. Paralleled in    <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Pores    of laterosensory canal of lower jaw (80): (0 &gt; 1) seven or more. Paralleled    in node 299 and in <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Morphology    of premaxillary, maxillary, and dentary teeth (118): (1 &gt; 0) all teeth conical,    caniniform or mamilliform. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae, in nodes 174    and 181, and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>, <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, and <i>Exodon    paradoxus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Foramen    on articular condyle of quadrate (149): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes    168 and 231 and in <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    eques</i>, and <i>Lonchogenys ilisha</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Form    of quadrate (150): (0 &gt; 1) with anterodorsal portion equal or longer than    ventral region. Paralleled in the <i>Pseudochalceus</i> clade, in nodes 170,    176, and 299, and in <i>Exodon paradoxus</i> and <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Position    of longitudinal cartilage dorsal to ectopterygoid (161): (0 &gt; 1) displaced    laterally and separated from medial margin of mesopterygoid. Paralleled in node    300 and in <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Ventral    margin of anterior ceratohyal (179): (1 &gt; 0) smooth and without notches.    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 189. Paralleled in <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Length    of interhyal (211): (0 &gt; 1) equal to or longer than one-half of symplectic    length. Paralleled in node 174 and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>    and <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Distance    between attachment site of first and second branchiostegal rays (216): (0 &gt;    1) longer than distance between second and third rays.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Anterior    margin of cleithrum (232): (0 &gt; 1) with anterior pointed projection.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Position    of ventral end of posttemporal (253): (0 &gt; 1) posterior to lateral margin    of epioccipital. Paralleled in node 228 and in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>,    <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Probolodus    heterostomus</i>, and <i>Prochilodus lineatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Number    of supraneurals (280): (1 &gt; 0) four or fewer. Paralleled in nodes 223 and    262 and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    bifasciatus</i>, and <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    the Aphyoditeinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>14.</b> Posterior    attachment of A1 section of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> (332): (0 &gt; 1) restricted    or almost restricted to horizontal arm of preopercle. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae    and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>, <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina    australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>15.</b> Attachment    of medial tendon of A1 section of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> (333): (0 &gt;    1) on preopercle posterior to quadrate. Reversal of synapomorphy 8 of the Characidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 214: (100    / 100 / 54 / 49)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acanthocharax</i>?,    <i>Charax</i>, and <i>Roeboides</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">A close relationship    between <i>Acanthocharax</i> (not analyzed here), <i>Charax</i>, and <i>Roeboides</i>    was proposed by Lucena (1998). <i>Acanthocharax</i> is tentatively included    in this clade following his hypothesis. The analyzed species of <i>Charax</i>    and <i>Roeboides</i> form a monophyletic clade, partially corroborating the    hypothesis of Lucena (1998). <i>Charax stenopterus</i> is the only species of    this genus herein analyzed. This species was included in a different genus (<i>Asiphonichthys</i>    Cope) by G&eacute;ry (1977) due to having only one row of premaxillary teeth    and an incomplete lateral line. Perhaps the inclusion of a species of <i>Charax</i>    with more generalized morphology could affect the list of synapomorphies of    this and/or the following node.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (52): (1 &gt; 0) extends dorsal of entire neural complex    of Weberian apparatus. Paralleled in node 221 and in <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Longitudinal    ridge covering laterosensory pores of dentary (117): (0 &gt; 1) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of anal pterygiophores anterior to first haemal spine (293): (0 &gt; 1) four    or more. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae and in <i>Cynopotamus argenteus</i>    and <i>Gymnocorymbus ternetzi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Charax stenopterus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    coverage of dilator fossa by sixth infraorbital (69): (0 &gt; 1) leaving a conspicuous    naked area in anterior region of dilator fossa. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae,    in node 197, and in <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>,    and <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Laterosensory    canal of sixth infraorbital (76): (1 &gt; 0) not branched. Paralleled in the    Iguanodectinae, in node 203, and in <i>Cyphocharax stellatus</i>, <i>Micralestes    stormsi</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Canal    of lateral line on caudal-fin membrane (92): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of the Characidae. Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae and <i>Bryconops</i>    clade, in nodes 227, 229, 244, 287, 294, and 298, and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>,    <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    anisitsi</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Length    of ascending process of premaxilla (104): (0 &gt; 1) reaching just anterior    end of nasal. Paralleled in nodes 225 and 294 and in <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>    and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Bryconamericus    agna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Size    and number of anterior dentary teeth (142): (0 &gt; 1) eight or more small and    slender teeth at front of dentary. Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae and in <i>Pyrrhulina    australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Ethmopalatine    cartilage (171): (0 &gt; 1) present and conspicuous. Paralleled in <i>Phenacogaster    tegatus</i> and <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 218: (100    / 100 / 84 / 82)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genus <i>Roeboides</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    <i>Roeboides</i> was tested in a cladistic context by Lucena (1998). Members    of <i>Roeboides</i> share modifications of the dentition associated with its    lepidophagous habit, a feeding mode also mentioned for <i>Bryconexodon</i>,    <i>Exodon</i>, and <i>Roeboexodon</i>, among the Characinae. The hypothesis    of Lucena (1998) that this kind of dentition and the lepidophagous habit were    originated in parallel in these genera and in <i>Roeboides</i> is corroborated    in this study.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Posteriorly-oriented    epioccipital spine (7): (1 &gt; 0) present. Paralleled in nodes 162 and 177.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Length    of sphenotic spine (10): (0 &gt; 1) extending ventrally to articulation between    sphenotic and hyomandibula. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of the Characinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Dorsolateral    processes of vomer (54): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in node 215 and in <i>Bryconexodon    juruenae</i> and <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Branching    of laterosensory canals of fourth or fifth infraorbitals (74): (0 &gt; 1) present.    Paralleled in the <i>Bryconops</i> clade, in nodes 167, 177, 260, and 276, and    in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>, <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>, and <i>Piaractus    mesopotamicus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Mamilliform    teeth outside mouth (120): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in node 277 and in    <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Proximal    and medial radials of anal fins (294): (0 &gt; 1) fused in most pterygiophores.    Paralleled in nodes 184, 208, and 221 and in <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i> and    <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 295.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Roeboides descalvadensis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    opening between ventral diverging lamellae of mesethmoid and anterior process    of lateral ethmoid (15): (0 &gt; 1) small, ovate and partially occluded by diverging    lamellae of mesethmoid and anterior process of lateral ethmoid. Paralleled in    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i> and <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Articulation    between ventral margin of metapterygoid and posterodorsal margin of quadrate    (155): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in nodes 176 and 299 and in <i>Deuterodon    langei</i>, <i>Heterocharax macrolepis</i>, <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>, and    <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Cartilages    anterior to basihyal (188): (0 &gt; 1) two well developed blocks of cartilage.    Paralleled in nodes 244 and 299 and in <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    bifasciatus</i>, <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>, and <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in node 265.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Form    of orbitosphenoid (37): (0 &gt; 1) massive, almost reaching parasphenoid ventrally.    Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of the Characidae. Paralleled in node 193 and in    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i> and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Length    of medial bony ridge of opercle (170): (1 &gt; 0) 60% or greater than opercular    length. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae, in node 210, and in <i>Astyanax abramis</i>,    <i>Creagrutus</i> cf. <i>taphorni</i>, and <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Acestrorhynchus pantaneiro</i> and <i>Salminus    brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Suprapreopercle    (175): (0 &gt; 1) autogenous, separated from preopercle. Paralleled in nodes    210 and 302 and in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i> and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> <i>Circulii</i>    on posterior field of scales (319): (1 &gt; 0) present. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 206. Paralleled in node 261 and in <i>Exodon paradoxus</i> and <i>Phenagoniates    macrolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Scales    covering anal-fin base (327): (0 &gt; 1) several rows covering basal third of    anal fin. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae, in nodes 210 and 221, and in <i>Bario    steindachneri</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Paragoniates alburnus</i>,    <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Humeral    spot (341): (0 &gt; 1) horizontally-ovate. Paralleled in node 259 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus    pantaneiro</i>, <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, and <i>Jupiaba mucronata</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 210: (100    / 100 / 85 / 52)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acestrocephalus</i>,    <i>Cynopotamus</i>, and <i>Galeocharax</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Members of this    node were included in the genus <i>Cynopotamus</i> by G&eacute;ry (1977), who    considered three subgenera: <i>Acestrocephalus</i> (including <i>Galeocharax</i>),    <i>Hybocharax</i> G&eacute;ry &amp; Vu-T&acirc;n-Tu&ecirc;, and <i>Cynopotamus</i>.    This author mentioned that the members of this clade (his <i>Cynopotamus</i>)    "look exactly like a big <i>Charax</i> with rough scales" (G&eacute;ry, 1977:    306), undoubtedly referring to the spinoid scales which characterizes the members    of this group. The monophyly of a clade composed of <i>Acestrocephalus</i>,    <i>Cynopotamus</i>, and <i>Galeocharax</i> was proposed by Lucena (1998).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventral    projection of lagenar capsule (3): (1 &gt; 0) not extending ventrally to horizontal    through articulation between basioccipital and parasphenoid. Reversal of synapomorphy    2 of node 205. Paralleled in <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Form    of fourth infraorbital (67): (1 &gt; 0) approximately square or more developed    longitudinally than dorsoventrally. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 189.    Paralleled in 200, 228, 277, and 282.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Posterior    dorsoventral expansion of fourth infraorbital (68): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled    in nodes 174 and 299.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Bony    lamella covering dentary foramen laterally (116): (0 &gt; 1) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Length    of medial bony ridge of opercle (170): (1 &gt; 0) 60% or greater than opercular    length. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae and in <i>Astyanax abramis</i>, <i>Creagrutus</i>    cf. <i>taphorni</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, and <i>Roeboides    microlepis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Acestrorhynchus pantaneiro</i>    and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Suprapreopercle    (175): (0 &gt; 1) autogenous, separated from preopercle. Paralleled in nodes    210 and 302 and in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>,    and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Articulation    between anterior and posterior ceratohyals (181): (0 &gt; 1) with bony interdigitations.    Paralleled in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>,    and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on second ceratobranchial (193): (0 &gt; 1) two. Paralleled in    nodes 225, 276, and 297 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Scales    (317): (0 &gt; 2) spinoid.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Scales    covering anal-fin base (327): (0 &gt; 1) several rows covering basal third of    anal fin. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae, in node 221, and in <i>Bario steindachneri</i>,    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Paragoniates alburnus</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>,    <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>, and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Sclerotic    bones (350): (0 &gt; 1) two bones separated by cartilages. Paralleled in nodes    208, 221, 250, and 259.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Acestrocephalus sardina</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Bony    lamellae associated with supraneurals (282): (1 &gt; 0) absent or small. Paralleled    in nodes 197, 272, and 299 and in <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 215: (100    / 100 / 61 / 77)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Cynopotamus</i>    and <i>Galeocharax</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">G&eacute;ry (1977)    considered <i>Galeocharax</i> to be a synonym of <i>Acestrocephalus</i> (both    treated by him as subgenera of <i>Cynopotamus</i>), implicitly suggesting a    closer relationship between these two genera than with <i>Cynopotamus</i>. This    same relationship was found by Lucena (1998), who obtained a clade formed by    <i>Acestrocephalus</i> and <i>Galeocharax</i>. According to the present hypothesis,    however, <i>Galeocharax</i> is the sister group of <i>Cynopotamus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Dorsolateral    processes of vomer (54): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in node 218 and in <i>Bryconexodon    juruenae</i> and <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Form    of anterior gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (198): (0 &gt; 1) with fused    bases forming plates extensively articulated with ceratobranchial.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Galeocharax humeralis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Contact    between frontals anteriorly to frontal fontanel (21): (0 &gt; 1) present. Reversal    of synapomorphy 4 of node 206. Paralleled in <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Exodon    paradoxus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>, and <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Knodus breviceps</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Bony    lamellae bordering sensory canal of nasal (34): (0 &gt; 1) wider at some point    than tubular region. Paralleled in nodes 174 and 181 and in <i>Leporinus striatus</i>    and <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Distance    between cartilage anterior to orbitosphenoid and lateral ethmoids (38): (1 &gt;    0) contacting, or almost contacting, lateral ethmoids. Reversal of synapomorphy    1 of node 204. Paralleled in node 223 and in <i>Bryconexodon juruenae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Relative    position of anterior margin of antorbital and first infraorbital (57): (0 &gt;    1) anterior margin of antorbital posterior to first infraorbital. Reversal of    synapomorphy 1 of Characoidea. Paralleled in node 184.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Uroneurals    (306): (0 &gt; 1) two pairs. Reversal of synapomorphy 15 of node 205. Paralleled    in the Tetragonopterinae, in nodes 276 and 300, and in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>    and <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Cynopotamus argenteus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Position    of sphenotic spine relative to the orbit (12): (0 &gt; 1) distinctly posterior    to orbital margin. Paralleled in nodes 193 and 299 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus    pantaneiro</i>, <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, and <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Anterior    margin of supraoccipital (51): (0 &gt; 1) situated anterior to vertical through    posterior orbital margin. Paralleled in node 220 and in <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Bony    lamellae between second and third basibranchials (184): (0 &gt; 1) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of anal pterygiophores anterior to first haemal spine (293): (0 &gt; 1) four    or more. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in node 214, and in <i>Gymnocorymbus    ternetzi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 203: (25    / 89 / 5 / 11)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Aphyocharacinae,    Aphyoditeinae, Cheirodontinae, Gymnocharacinae, Rhoadsiinae, Stethaprioninae,    Stevardiinae, and Tetragonopterinae; <i>Astyanax</i> clade, <i>Astyanax paris</i>    clade, <i>Bramocharax</i> clade, <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i> clade, <i>Hyphessobrycon    anisitsi</i> clade, and <i>Pseudochalceus</i> clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This node is incongruent    with the results by Mirande (2009) and was not previously proposed. In that    analysis the <i>Jupiaba</i> clade was the sister group of a clade including    the remaining characids lacking a supraorbital. In the present study the subfamily    Characinae is the sister group of that clade of characids, whereas the <i>Jupiaba</i>    clade of Mirande (2009) is included in the Tetragonopterinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Relative    size of frontal and parietal fontanels (23): (1 &gt; 0) length of frontal fontanel    up to 2/3 length of parietal fontanel. Reversed in node 264.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Laterosensory    canal of sixth infraorbital (76): (1 &gt; 0) not branched. Paralleled in the    Iguanodectinae and in <i>Charax stenopterus</i>, <i>Cyphocharax stellatus</i>,    <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>. Reversed in <i>Markiana    nigripinnis</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>, <i>Oligosarcus</i> cf. <i>jenynsii</i>,    and <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Bony    lamella dorsal to fourth basibranchial (185): (1 &gt; 0) present. Paralleled    in nodes 168, 170, and 302 and in <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>. Reversed in    node 296 and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Hollandichthys    multifasciatus</i>, <i>Mimagoniates rheocharis</i>, <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>,    <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>, and <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Dorsal-fin    rays articulating with first dorsal pterygiophore (266): (0 &gt; 1) three or    four. Paralleled in node 276 and in <i>Metynnis maculatus</i> and <i>Salminus    brasiliensis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>. Reversed    in <i>Bario steindachneri</i> and <i>Thayeria obliqua</i>. Some trees: Reversed    in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i> and <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 228: (13    / 57 / - / 4)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamily Rhoadsiinae;    <i>Bramocharax</i> clade and <i>Pseudochalceus</i> clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This node is incongruent    with the final hypothesis by Mirande (2009), in which the Rhoadsiinae was related    with the Characinae, rather than with the <i>Bramocharax</i> and <i>Pseudochalceus</i>    clades. However, this node was obtained in the most stable hypothesis under    self-weighted optimization by Mirande (2009: <a href="#f4">fig. 4</a>).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Form    of fourth infraorbital (67): (1 &gt; 0) approximately square or more developed    longitudinally than dorsoventrally. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 189.    Paralleled in 200, 210, 277, and 282.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Position    of ventral end of posttemporal (253): (0 &gt; 1) posterior to lateral margin    of epioccipital. Paralleled in node 211 and in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>,    <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Probolodus    heterostomus</i>, and <i>Prochilodus lineatus</i>. Reversed in <i>Nematocharax    venustus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 275: <i>Bramocharax</i>    clade (86 / 98 / 42 / 48)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Bramocharax</i>    and <i>Oligosarcus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The genera <i>Bramocharax</i>    and <i>Oligosarcus</i> were related with <i>Hollandichthys</i> and <i>Pseudochalceus</i>    in the hypothesis proposed by Mirande (2009), and the latter two genera were    included in the <i>Bramocharax</i> clade. <i>Hollandichthys</i> and <i>Pseudochalceus</i>    are instead related with the Rhoadsiinae in this study. Rosen (1972) considered    <i>Bramocharax</i> to be monophyletic and derived from some species of <i>Astyanax</i>.    However, a recent molecular analysis proposed that this genus is not monophyletic    and that each species of <i>Bramocharax</i> is related with different populations    of <i>Astyanax</i> from Central America (Ornelas-Garc&iacute;a <i>et al</i>.,    2008). The hypothesis of non-monophyly of <i>Bramocharax</i> is surprising giving    the morphological resemblance between its species; however, the high congruence    of that hypothesis with the geographical 
distribution of the clades proposed    by Ornelas Garc&iacute;a <i>et al</i>. (2008) and the morphological plasticity    of some characids make this hypothesis plausible. These authors proposed parallel    evolution of "<i>Bramocharax</i> ecomorphs" from different species or populations    of <i>Astyanax</i> and suggested that "the morphotype of <i>Bramocharax</i>    represents a recurrent trophic adaptation" (Ornelas-Garc&iacute;a <i>et al</i>.,    2008). Only one species of <i>Bramocharax</i> was analyzed in this study, and    this analysis is insufficient to adequately test the hypothesis of the non-monophyly    of <i>Bramocharax</i> proposed by those authors. The close relationship between    <i>Bramocharax</i> and <i>Astyanax</i> is not, however, supported by the present    hypothesis, which instead relates <i>Bramocharax</i> with <i>Oligosarcus</i>.    The inclusion of some Mesoamerican species of <i>Astyanax</i> with relatively    high number of maxillary teeth, such as 
<i>A</i>. <i>nasutus</i> Meek and some    morphologically conservative species of <i>Bramocharax</i>, such as <i>B</i>.    <i>bailey</i> Rosen, would be useful to test the monophyly and position of this    clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphy:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Form    of epioccipital bridge (5): (0 &gt; 1) depressed in its middle region.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (53): (0 &gt; 1) extends only to anterior limit of neural    complex. Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node 205. Paralleled in nodes 272 and    287 and in <i>Deuterodon iguape</i> and <i>Lonchogenys ilisha</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Ventral    margin of horizontal process of anguloarticular (109): (0 &gt; 1) perpendicular    to laterosensory canal of dentary from medial view. Paralleled in node 199 and    in <i>Bario steindachneri</i> and <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of cusps of anterior maxillary teeth (139): (0 &gt; 1) five or more cusps. Paralleled    in the Rhoadsiinae, in nodes 273, 283, and 294, and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>,    <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Hemibrycon dariensis</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    pulchripinnis</i>, and <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in node 246.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of supraneurals (280): (1 &gt; 0) four or fewer. Paralleled in nodes 211, 223,    and 262, and in <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon bifasciatus</i>,    and <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 300: (100    / 100 / 79 / 39)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genus <i>Oligosarcus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The genus <i>Oligosarcus</i>    was traditionally considered to be related with <i>Acestrorhynchus</i> (<i>e</i>.    <i>g</i>. Menezes, 1969). G&eacute;ry (1977), classified both genera in the    tribe Acestrorhynchini of the subfamily Characinae. The phylogeny of Buckup    (1998), however, did not yield a close relationship between these two genera,    and <i>Acestrorhynchus</i> was excluded from the Characidae. The monophyly of    <i>Oligosarcus</i> was not tested in the literature, although the species of    this genus share some unique or unusual characters within Characidae, mostly    involving their dentition (Menezes, 1969). The morphologically most generalized    described species of this genus, <i>Oligosarcus pintoi</i> Campos is not herein    analyzed, and probably some of the listed synapomorphies would apply to a subclade    within <i>Oligosarcus</i>. According to the present analysis, the undescribed    new 
species included in this clade (treated as an undescribed new genus and    species by Mirande, 2009) should be described as a species of <i>Oligosarcus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Temporal    fossa (13): (1 &gt; 0) well developed. Paralleled in <i>Brycon meeki</i>, <i>Bryconexodon    juruenae</i>, and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Dorsal    expansion of rhinosphenoid (48): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in nodes 201    and 212 and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Articulation    between second and third infraorbitals (62): (0 &gt; 2) posteroventrally angled.    Paralleled in the Characinae, in node 176, and in <i>Bryconops melanurus</i>    and <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Ectopterygoid    teeth row (159): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in node 168 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus    pantaneiro</i>, <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>,    <i>Serrasalmus maculatus</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Position    of longitudinal cartilage dorsal to ectopterygoid (161): (0 &gt; 1) displaced    laterally and separated from medial margin of mesopterygoid. Paralleled in node    211 and in <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Bony    lamellae bordering laterosensory canal of suprapreopercle (176): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (288): (1 &gt; 0) 24 or less. Reversal of synapomorphy    5 of the Characidae. Paralleled in nodes 200 and 277 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus    pantaneiro</i> and <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Uroneurals    (306): (0 &gt; 1) two pairs. Reversal of synapomorphy 15 of node 205. Paralleled    in the Tetragonopterinae, in node 276, and in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>,    <i>Galeocharax humeralis</i>, and <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b><i>Oligosarcus</i>    sp.:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Posterior    branch of posttemporal laterosensory canal (88): (1 &gt; 0) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 299: (100    / 100 / 98 / 53)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Oligosarcus    bolivianus</i>, <i>O. jenynsii</i>, other <i>Oligosarcus</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The species of    <i>Oligosarcus</i> are rather morphologically homogeneous, and the monophyly    of this genus as currently composed was accepted even without a phylogeny supporting    it. The synapomorphies of this node are perhaps applicable to a more inclusive    clade composed of most species of the genus.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Position    of sphenotic spine relative to the orbit (12): (0 &gt; 1) distinctly posterior    to orbital margin. Paralleled in node 193 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus pantaneiro</i>,    <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Cynopotamus argenteus</i>, and <i>Gymnocharacinus    bergii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Posterior    dorsoventral expansion of fourth infraorbital (68): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled    in nodes 174 and 210.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Pores    of laterosensory canal of lower jaw (80): (0 &gt; 1) seven or more. Paralleled    in node 211 and in <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> A pair    of large conical teeth in premaxilla (121): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in    node 174.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Abrupt    decrease in size of dentary teeth (148): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the    <i>Bryconops</i> clade, in nodes 222 and 255, and in <i>Astyanax latens</i>    and <i>A</i>. <i>paris</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Form    of quadrate (150): (0 &gt; 1) with anterodorsal portion equal or longer than    ventral region. Paralleled in the <i>Pseudochalceus</i> clade, in nodes 170,    176, and 211, and in <i>Exodon paradoxus</i> and <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Articulation    between ventral margin of metapterygoid and posterodorsal margin of quadrate    (155): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in node 176 and in <i>Deuterodon langei</i>,    <i>Heterocharax macrolepis</i>, <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>, <i>Roeboides descalvadensis</i>,    and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Cartilages    anterior to basihyal (188): (0 &gt; 1) two well developed blocks of cartilage.    Paralleled in node 244 and in <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon bifasciatus</i>,    <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>, and <i>Roeboides    descalvadensis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 265.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Form    and degree of ossification of first ceratobranchial gill rakers (200): (0 &gt;    1) rather thick and completely ossified distal region. Paralleled in nodes 176    and 212 and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>,    and <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Bony    lamellae associated with supraneurals (282): (1 &gt; 0) absent or small. Paralleled    in nodes 197 and 272 and in <i>Acestrocephalus sardina</i> and <i>Nematocharax    venustus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Bony    hooks on last pelvic-fin ray of adult males (314): (0 &gt; 1) as numerous as    in other rays. Paralleled in nodes 232, 240, and 258 and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Oligosarcus</i> cf. <i>jenynsii</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Laterosensory    canal of sixth infraorbital (76): (0 &gt; 1) branched. Reversal of synapomorphy    2 of node 203. Paralleled in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>,    and <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>No autapomorphies    found for <i>Oligosarcus bolivianus</i>.</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 227: (32    / 84 / - / 3)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamily Rhoadsiinae;    <i>Pseudochalceus</i> clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Hollandichthys</i>    and <i>Pseudochalceus</i> was related to <i>Bramocharax</i> and <i>Oligosarcus</i>    in the hypothesis by Mirande (2009) and included in his <i>Bramocharax</i> clade.    In the present study the former genera are rather related with the Rhoadsiinae    and included in the <i>Pseudochalceus</i> clade. It is herein preferred not    to include <i>Hollandichthys</i> and <i>Pseudochalceus</i> in the Rhoadsiinae    given the low support of this node. However this clade is rather stable among    the analyses performed for this study and its monophyly should be further evaluated.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    line (91): (0 &gt; 1) interrupted. Paralleled in nodes 229, 279, 288, and 294    and in <i>Characidium rachovii</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    anisitsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>,    and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Canal    of lateral line on caudal-fin membrane (92): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of the Characidae. Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae and <i>Bryconops</i>    clade, in nodes 229, 244, 287, 294, and 298, and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>,    <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i>, <i>Charax stenopterus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon anisitsi</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster    tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 293: <i>Pseudochalceus</i>    clade (69 / 81 / 50 / 14)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Hollandichthys</i>    and <i>Pseudochalceus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Hollandichthys</i>    was considered to be a synonym of <i>Pseudochalceus</i> by G&eacute;ry (1977),    implying a close relationship between these two genera. The sister-group relationship    between <i>Hollandichthys</i> and <i>Pseudochalceus</i> was subsequently proposed    by Bertaco (2003).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Form    of quadrate (150): (0 &gt; 1) with anterodorsal portion equal or longer than    ventral region. Paralleled in nodes 170, 176, 211, and 299 and in <i>Exodon    paradoxus</i> and <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Margin    of first pectoral ray in adult specimens (230): (0 &gt; 1) conspicuously serrated.    Paralleled in nodes 162 and 168.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (1 &gt; 0) reaching horizontal arm of preopercle.
