Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 180. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae and    Iguanodectinae, in nodes 184, 198, 225, and 302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Brycon pesu</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Moenkhausia    sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.    Some trees: Reversed in node 292.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Denticles    on gill rakers (201): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gymnocharacinae,    in nodes 245 and 253, and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i> and <i>H</i>. <i>herbertaxelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Length    of interhyal (211): (0 &gt; 1) equal to or longer than one-half of symplectic    length. Paralleled in nodes 174 and 211 and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Form    of third postcleithrum (250): (1 &gt; 0) slender, without associated lamella.    Reversal of synapomorphy 6 of node 204. Paralleled in node 242 and in <i>Gymnocharacinus    bergii</i> and <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Bony    hooks on fin rays (307): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in the Gymnocharacinae,    in nodes 207, 283, 297, and 301, and in <i>Astyanax paris</i>, <i>Bryconamericus    mennii</i>, <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, and <i>Rhoadsia    altipinna</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon    elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Rhinosphenoid    (47): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of the Characidae. Paralleled    in nodes 207, 260, 280, and 298 and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Attonitus    ephimeros</i>, <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>,    <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Overlap    of maxilla by second infraorbital (61): (0 &gt; 1) present. Reversal of synapomorphy    6 of node 205. Paralleled in <i>Mimagoniates rheocharis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Articulation    between second and third infraorbitals (62): (0 &gt; 2) posteroventrally angled.    Paralleled in the Characinae, in nodes 176 and 300, and in <i>Bryconops melanurus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Bony    lamellae between second and third basibranchials (184): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled    in the Serrasalmidae and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Jupiaba scologaster</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>,    <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates    bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Bony    lamella dorsal to fourth basibranchial (185): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of node 203. Paralleled in node 296 and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Mimagoniates rheocharis</i>, <i>Nematocharax    venustus</i>, <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>, and <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> First    pelvic-fin ray (256): (0 &gt; 1) branched.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Number    of branched pelvic-fin rays (258): (1 &gt; 0) six or less. Paralleled in the    Aphyocharacinae, in nodes 220, 236, 280, and 302, and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>, <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>,    and <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania    nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Insemination    (358): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in node 239.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Type    of spermatozoa (359): (0 &gt; 1) introsperm. Paralleled in node 237.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Sperm    storage area on testes (360): (0 &gt; 1) present, as broad as spermatogenic    area.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 226: Rhoadsiinae    (44 / 91 / 7 / 5)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Carlana</i>,    <i>Nematocharax</i> Weitzman, Menezes &amp; Britski, <i>Parastremma</i> Eigenmann,    and <i>Rhoadsia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The close relationship    between <i>Carlana</i>, <i>Parastremma</i> (not analyzed), and <i>Rhoadsia</i>,    which form the subfamily Rhoadsiinae was proposed and previously discussed in    the literature (<i>e</i>. <i>g</i>. G&eacute;ry, 1977). Although this subfamily    was not phylogenetically diagnosed, it was recognized as monophyletic in the    last revision of the family (Cardoso, 2003b). The close relationship of the    monotypic <i>Nematocharax</i> to the Rhoadsiinae had been previously proposed    by Mirande (2009) and corroborated in this study. According to the present results,    the nomenclatural alternatives are to define a new subfamily for <i>Nematocharax</i>,    or include this genus in the Rhoadsiinae. The latter of these alternatives is    preferred herein as more conservative than is the creation of new names.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Form    of teeth of inner premaxillary tooth row (128): (0 &gt; 1) with cusps aligned    in straight series and without anterior concavity. Paralleled in nodes 195,    245, and 280 and in <i>Hemigrammus bleheri</i> and <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of cusps of anterior maxillary teeth (139): (0 &gt; 1) five or more cusps. Paralleled    in nodes 273, 283, and 294 and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>, <i>Brycon    orbignyanus</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Hemibrycon dariensis</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>, and <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in node 246.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Cusps    of teeth on outer premaxillary row (125): (0 &gt; 1) five or more cusps. Paralleled    in nodes 265 and 294 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconops melanurus</i>,    <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, and <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Bryconamericus agna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Posterior    extent of ventral process of quadrate (151): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of posterior    margin of symplectic. Paralleled in the <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i> clade    and Iguanodectinae, in nodes 284, 289, and 298, and in <i>Astyanax mexicanus</i>,    <i>A</i>. cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>,    <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Metynnis    maculatus</i>, <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>,    <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>, <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>, and <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Bony    lamella dorsal to fourth basibranchial (185): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of node 203. Paralleled in node 296 and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Mimagoniates    rheocharis</i>, <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>, and <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Position    of ventral end of posttemporal (253): (1 &gt; 0) anterior or lateral to lateral    margin of epioccipital. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 228.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of supraneurals (280): (1 &gt; 0) four or fewer. Paralleled in nodes 211, 223,    and 262, and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>,    and <i>Hyphessobrycon bifasciatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Bony    lamellae associated with supraneurals (282): (1 &gt; 0) absent or small. Paralleled    in nodes 197, 272, and 299 and in <i>Acestrocephalus sardina</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Dorsal-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (311): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in nodes 248 and 268 and in <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>,    <i>A</i>. <i>lineatus</i>, <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>, <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>, and <i>Probolodus    heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Scales    covering caudal-fin lobes (328): (0 &gt; 1) covering one-third of their length.    Paralleled in node 222 and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>,    and <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Knodus breviceps</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 225: (100    / 100 / 100 / 76)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Carlana</i>,    <i>Parastremma</i>, and <i>Rhoadsia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The composition    of this node corresponds to the subfamily Rhoadsiinae according to Cardoso (2003b)    and previous authors. The inclusion of <i>Parastremma</i> in this clade was    not tested, but the genus is listed in this clade following Cardoso (2003b).    It is probable, however, that some of the reported synapomorphies of this node    actually apply to a more inclusive clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Form    of mesethmoid spine (27): (0 &gt; 1) relatively short, with premaxillae articulating    with each other anterior to mesethmoid. Paralleled in node 234 and in <i>Chalceus    macrolepidotus</i> and <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Posterior    portion of mesethmoid spine (28): (0 &gt; 1) as broad as lateral wings of mesethmoid.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (1 &gt; 0) reaching horizontal arm of preopercle.    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 180. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae and    Iguanodectinae, in nodes 184, 198, and 302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Brycon pesu</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Moenkhausia    sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>,    and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>. Some trees: Reversed in node 292.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Ontogenetic    lengthening of maxilla (101): (0 &gt; 1) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Length    of ascending process of premaxilla (104): (0 &gt; 1) reaching just anterior    end of nasal. Paralleled in node 294 and in <i>Charax stenopterus</i>, <i>Phenacogaster    tegatus</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Bryconamericus    agna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Orientation    of anterior dentary teeth (141): (0 &gt; 1) oriented anteriorly, almost parallel    to main axis of dentary. Paralleled in <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on second ceratobranchial (193): (0 &gt; 1) two. Paralleled in    nodes 210, 276, and 297 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventral    projection of lagenar capsule (3): (1 &gt; 0) not extending ventrally to horizontal    through articulation between basioccipital and parasphenoid. Reversal of synapomorphy    2 of node 205. Paralleled in node 210.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Dorsal    process of pterotic where tendon from epaxial musculature attach (45): (0 &gt;    1) present, projecting dorsally from tube for semicircular canal. Paralleled    in the Heterocharacinae, in node 193, and in <i>Serrasalmus maculatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Margins    of toothed region of maxilla (96): (0 &gt; 1) dorsally divergent. Paralleled    in nodes 162, 209, 254, and 282 and in <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Form    of third postcleithrum (250): (1 &gt; 0) slender, without associated lamella.    Reversal of synapomorphy 6 of node 204. Paralleled in node 242 and in <i>Gymnocharacinus    bergii</i> and <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Bony    hooks on fin rays (307): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in the Gymnocharacinae,    in nodes 207, 283, 297, and 301, and in <i>Astyanax paris</i>, <i>Bryconamericus    mennii</i>, <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, and <i>Pseudochalceus    kyburzi</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon    elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Number    of rows of premaxillary teeth (122): (1 &gt; 0) one. Paralleled in node 195    and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Carnegiella strigata</i>, <i>Grundulus    cochae</i>, <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>, <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>,    <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, and <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (0 &gt; 1) two. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 179. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in node 280, and in <i>Brycon    orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>, <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>,    <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>,    <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 249 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 202: (6    / 82 / - / 3)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Aphyocharacinae,    Aphyoditeinae, Cheirodontinae, Gymnocharacinae, Stevardiinae, and Tetragonopterinae;    <i>Astyanax</i> clade, <i>Astyanax paris</i> clade, <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>    clade, and <i>Hyphessobrycon anisitsi</i> clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This node is incongruent    with the hypothesis by Mirande (2009). As with node 202 such incongruence is    due to the relative positions of <i>Jupiaba</i> and the Characinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Extent    of implantation of teeth along maxilla (137): (1 &gt; 0) not reaching middle    of maxillary lamella. Reversal of synapomorphy 9 of node 205. Reversed in node    208 and in <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, <i>Hemibrycon surinamensis</i>, <i>Nematobrycon    palmeri</i>, and <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Articulation    between quadrate and anguloarticular (154): (1 &gt; 0) anterior to or at vertical    through middle eye. Paralleled in <i>Bryconexodon juruenae</i> and <i>Phenacogaster    tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 224: Tetragonopterinae    (-9 / 69 / - / 4)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Bario</i>    Myers, <i>Brachychalcinus</i> Boulenger, <i>Deuterodon</i>, <i>Gymnocorymbus</i>,    <i>Hasemania</i> Ellis, <i>Hemigrammus</i> Gill, <i>Hyphessobrycon Durbin</i>,    <i>Jupiaba</i>, <i>Moenkhausia</i>, <i>Myxiops</i>?, <i>Paracheirodon</i>, <i>Orthospinus</i>    Reis, <i>Petitella</i> G&eacute;ry &amp; Bouti&egrave;re?, <i>Poptella Eigenmann</i>,    <i>Pristella</i> Eigenmann, <i>Probolodus</i>, <i>Stethaprion</i> Cope, <i>Stichonodon</i>    Eigenmann, <i>Tetragonopterus</i>, and <i>Thayeria.</i></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The subfamily Tetragonopterinae    was the most diverse among the Characidae under the classical systematics of    the family (<i>e</i>. <i>g</i>. G&eacute;ry, 1977). Reis (2003b) later restricted    this subfamily to the genus <i>Tetragonopterus</i> due to the lack of presumably    apomorphic features shared by its members. In that classification, most tetragonopterines    were classified as <i>incertae sedis</i> within Characidae (Lima <i>et al</i>.,    2003). Both in the phylogeny by Mirande (2009) as in the present study <i>Tetragonopterus    argenteus</i> is the sister group of the Stethaprioninae. In the phylogeny of    Mirande (2009) the Tetragonopterinae and Stethaprioninae form a monophyletic    unit which is the sister group of a large clade of characids. In that hypothesis    both subfamilies were valid and <i>Hemigrammus</i>, along with several other    genera, formed the <i>Hemigrammus</i> clade. In the 
phylogenetic hypothesis    herein obtained both the Stethaprioninae and Tetragonopterinae are nested in    a large clade composed additionally by the members of the <i>Hemigrammus</i>    clade of Mirande (2009). This monophyletic assemblage is named Tetragonopterinae,    which has precedence over Stethaprioninae. This clade includes also the type-species    of the highly diverse genera <i>Hemigrammus</i> and <i>Moenkhausia</i>, and    presumably also <i>Hyphessobrycon</i>. Weitzman &amp; Palmer (1997) and Weitzman    &amp; Malabarba (1998) discussed the possible polyphyly of <i>Hyphessobrycon</i>,    and the paraphyly of <i>Hemigrammus.</i> This analysis corroborates their findings    that a phylogenetic classification of <i>Hemigrammus</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon</i>    would result in generic reassignments of many species currently in those genera.    Probably the same statement is applicable to <i>Moenkhausia</i>. <i>Petitella</i>    (not analyzed herein) shares with <i>Hemigrammus 
bleheri</i> a presumably apomorphic    coloration, with an intensely red head and the presence of three conspicuous    black bars in the caudal fin. Indeed, <i>Petitella georgiae</i> G&eacute;ry    &amp; Bouti&egrave;re is mainly distinguished from <i>Hemigrammus bleheri</i>    as having only one row of premaxillary teeth (<i>vs</i>. two rows). Thus, <i>Petitella</i>    is tentatively included in this node. <i>Myxiops</i>, as discussed below, shares    several presumably apomorphic features with <i>Deuterodon</i> and it is also    tentatively included in this clade. Most internal clades of the Characidae are    poorly supported, and this node is not an exception. The monophyly and composition    of the Tetragonopterinae as herein defined, thus, should be further tested.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphy:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Uroneurals    (306): (0 &gt; 1) two pairs. Reversal of synapomorphy 15 of node 205. Paralleled    in nodes 276 and 300 and in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>, <i>Galeocharax    humeralis</i>, and <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>. Reversed in node 288 and in    <i>Gymnocorymbus ternetzi</i> and <i>Jupiaba scologaster</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Mamilliform    teeth outside mouth (120): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes 218 and 277.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of rows of premaxillary teeth (122): (1 &gt; 0) one. Paralleled in node 195    and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Carnegiella    strigata</i>, <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>, <i>Paracheirodon    axelrodi</i>, and <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of teeth in inner premaxillary row (129): (1 &gt; 0) four or fewer. Paralleled    in node 198 and in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Posterior    extent of ventral process of quadrate (151): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of posterior    margin of symplectic. Paralleled in the <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i> clade    and Iguanodectinae, in nodes 284, 289, and 298, and in <i>Astyanax mexicanus</i>,    <i>A</i>. cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>,    <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Metynnis    maculatus</i>, <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>,    <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>, <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>, and <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (234): (0 &gt; 1) with concavity ventral to first postcleithrum.    Reversal of synapomorphy 4 of node 204. Paralleled in nodes 196 and 289 and    in <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Position    of ventral end of posttemporal (253): (0 &gt; 1) posterior to lateral margin    of epioccipital. Paralleled in nodes 211 and 228 and in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>,    <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, and <i>Prochilodus    lineatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Dorsal-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (311): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in nodes 248 and 268 and in <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>,    <i>A</i>. <i>lineatus</i>, <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>, <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>, and <i>Nematocharax    venustus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Caudal-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (312): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in node 268 and in <i>Acrobrycon tarijae</i>, <i>Astyanax</i>    cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>, <i>A</i>. <i>lineatus</i>, <i>Bario steindachneri</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>, and <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 223: (9    / 70 / - / 1)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Bario</i>,    <i>Brachychalcinus</i>, <i>Deuterodon</i>, <i>Gymnocorymbus</i>, <i>Hasemania</i>,    <i>Hemigrammus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon</i>, <i>Jupiaba</i>, <i>Moenkhausia</i>,    <i>Myxiops</i>?, <i>Paracheirodon</i>, <i>Orthospinus</i>, <i>Petitella</i>,    <i>Poptella</i>, <i>Pristella</i>, <i>Stethaprion</i>, <i>Stichonodon</i>, <i>Tetragonopterus,</i>    and <i>Thayeria</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Distance    between cartilage anterior to orbitosphenoid and lateral ethmoids (38): (1 &gt;    0) contacting, or almost contacting, lateral ethmoids. Reversal of synapomorphy    1 of node 204. Paralleled in <i>Bryconexodon juruenae</i> and <i>Galeocharax    humeralis</i>. Reversed in node 286 and in <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of supraneurals (280): (1 &gt; 0) four or fewer. Paralleled in nodes 211 and    262, and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    bifasciatus</i>, and <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    the Aphyoditeinae. Reversed in <i>Hemigrammus unilineatus</i>. Some trees: Reversed    in <i>Hasemania nana</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 283: (25    / 53 / 17 / 1)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Deuterodon</i>,    <i>Jupiaba</i>, and <i>Myxiops</i>?.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    a clade including the genera <i>Deuterodon</i> and <i>Jupiaba</i> had not been    previously proposed. However, <i>Jupiaba acanthogaster</i> (Eigenmann), <i>Jupiaba    minor</i> (Travassos), and <i>Jupiaba pinnata</i> (Eigenmann), were originally    described as members of <i>Deuterodon</i>, suggesting some resemblance between    these two genera. The sister-group relationship of <i>Deuterodon</i> and <i>Jupiaba</i>    was herein obtained without analyzing those three species, whose study may be    useful to test both the monophyly of this node and that of <i>Deuterodon</i>    and <i>Jupiaba</i>. <i>Myxiops</i> shares several presumably apomorphic features    with <i>Deuterodon</i> and is tentatively included in this node.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Number    of cusps of anterior maxillary teeth (139): (0 &gt; 1) five or more cusps. Paralleled    in the Rhoadsiinae, in nodes 273 and 294, and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>,    <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Hemibrycon dariensis</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>, and <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in node 246.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Bony    hooks on fin rays (307): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in the Gymnocharacinae,    in nodes 207, 297, and 301, and in <i>Astyanax paris</i>, <i>Bryconamericus    mennii</i>, <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus    kyburzi</i>, and <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania    nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 296: (100    / 100 / 69 / 71)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genus <i>Jupiaba</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    <i>Jupiaba</i> was proposed by Zanata (1997) and supported by unique modifications    of the pelvic bone. In the final hypothesis of Mirande (2009) the species of    <i>Jupiaba</i> were the sister group of the remaining distal characids lacking    a supraorbital bone, and was included in the <i>Jupiaba</i> clade. In the present    hypothesis <i>Jupiaba</i> is nested within the Tetragonopterinae as the sister    group of <i>Deuterodon</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Bony    lamella dorsal to fourth basibranchial (185): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of node 203. Paralleled in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus    bergii</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Mimagoniates rheocharis</i>,    <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>, <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>, and <i>Prodontocharax    melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Anterior    tip of pelvic bone (263): (0 &gt; 1) pointed, lacking associated cartilage and    frequently projecting outside body wall.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Jupiaba scologaster</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Bony    lamellae between second and third basibranchials (184): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled    in the Serrasalmidae and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Piabucus    melanostomus</i>, <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, and    <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Uroneurals    (306): (1 &gt; 0) absent or just one pair. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of the    Tetragonopterinae. Paralleled in node 288 and in <i>Gymnocorymbus ternetzi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Jupiaba mucronata</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Humeral    spot (341): (0 &gt; 1) horizontally-ovate. Paralleled in node 259 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus    pantaneiro</i>, <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, and <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 282: (100    / 100 / 89 / 69)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Deuterodon</i>    and <i>Myxiops</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    <i>Deuterodon</i> was proposed by Lucena &amp; Lucena (2002), who based their    hypothesis in some unique features of the maxilla shared by the members of this    genus. Prior to that paper some species of <i>Deuterodon</i> were included in    <i>Astyanax</i> (Eigenmann, 1917; G&eacute;ry, 1977). An evaluation on the monophyly    of <i>Deuterodon</i> is beyond the scope of this paper, and only two species    of this genus are herein analyzed. The genus <i>Myxiops</i> (not analyzed here)    shares all the synapomorphies of the genus <i>Deuterodon</i> as proposed by    Lucena &amp; Lucena (2002). <i>Myxiops</i> was principally diagnosed by Zanata    &amp; Akama (2004) based on autapomorphies and by the possession of only one    row of premaxillary teeth (<i>vs</i>. two in <i>Deuterodon</i>), a moderately    homoplastic character within Characidae. The placement of <i>Myxiops</i> should    be tested in 
the future, but the information from its description permits its    inclusion, at least tentatively, in this clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Form    of fourth infraorbital (67): (1 &gt; 0) approximately square or more developed    longitudinally than dorsoventrally. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 189.    Paralleled in 200, 210, 228, and 277.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Margins    of toothed region of maxilla (96): (0 &gt; 1) dorsally divergent. Paralleled    in nodes 162, 209, and 254 and in <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i> and <i>Rhoadsia    altipinna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Position    of coronomeckelian (110): (0 &gt; 1) situated mainly dorsal to Meckelian cartilage.    Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 206. Paralleled in nodes 200 and 290 and    in <i>Hemigrammus erythrozonus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Relative    position of dorsal-fin anterior insertion (265): (1 &gt; 0) anterior to or at    vertical through pelvic-fin origin. Paralleled in <i>Creagrutus anary</i>, <i>Exodon    paradoxus</i>, <i>Moenkhausia xinguensis</i>, and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Deuterodon langei</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Expansion    of lamellar portion of maxilla just posterior to toothed region (97): (0 &gt;    1) very pronounced. Paralleled in node 232. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Paracheirodon    axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Articulation    between ventral margin of metapterygoid and posterodorsal margin of quadrate    (155): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes 176 and 299 and in <i>Heterocharax    macrolepis</i>, <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>, <i>Roeboides descalvadensis</i>,    and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Distribution    of denticles on gill rakers (202): (0 &gt; 1) along entire surface of gill rakers.    Paralleled in node 269 and in <i>Astyanax correntinus</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf.    <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon eques</i>, and <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Development    of transverse process of neural arch of third vertebra (219): (0 &gt; 1) well    developed and extending beyond anterior margin of tripus. Paralleled in node    302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>, <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>, <i>Engraulisoma    taeniatum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>,    and <i>Thayeria obliqua</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Microschemobrycon    casiquiare</i> and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Process    of scapula forming anterior border of scapular foramen (244): (0 &gt; 1) absent.    Paralleled in nodes 193 and 252 and in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>, <i>Hoplias</i>    cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon herbertaxelrodi</i>, <i>Leporinus    striatus</i>, <i>Odontostilbe paraguayensis</i>, and <i>Thayeria obliqua</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Deuterodon iguape</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (53): (0 &gt; 1) extends only to anterior limit of neural    complex. Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node 205. Paralleled in nodes 272 and    287 and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i> and <i>Lonchogenys ilisha</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 222: (-4    / 68 / - / 1)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Bario</i>,    <i>Brachychalcinus</i>, <i>Gymnocorymbus</i>, <i>Hasemania</i>, <i>Hemigrammus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon</i>, <i>Moenkhausia</i>, <i>Paracheirodon</i>, <i>Orthospinus</i>,    <i>Petitella</i>, <i>Poptella</i>, <i>Pristella</i>, <i>Stethaprion</i>, <i>Stichonodon</i>,    <i>Tetragonopterus,</i> and <i>Thayeria</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Abrupt    decrease in size of dentary teeth (148): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the    <i>Bryconops</i> clade, in nodes 255 and 299, and in <i>Astyanax latens</i>    and <i>A</i>. <i>paris</i>. Reversed in <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Scales    covering caudal-fin lobes (328): (0 &gt; 1) covering one-third of their length.    Paralleled in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>, <i>Markiana    nigripinnis</i>, and <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    <i>Knodus breviceps</i>. Some trees: Reversed in node 285.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 221: (95    / 100 / 55 / 17)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Brachychalcinus</i>,    <i>Gymnocorymbus</i>, <i>Orthospinus</i>, <i>Poptella</i>, <i>Stethaprion</i>,    <i>Stichonodon</i>, and <i>Tetragonopterus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The close relationship    between the genera assigned in the literature to Stethaprioninae (<i>Brachychalcinus</i>,    <i>Orthospinus</i>, <i>Poptella</i>, and <i>Stethaprion</i>) and the genera    <i>Gymnocorymbus</i>, <i>Stichonodon</i>, and <i>Tetragonopterus</i> was suggested    by Reis (1989), who examined the three latter genera as part of his outgroup    in a phylogenetic diagnosis of the Stethaprioninae. According to G&eacute;ry    (1977: 451) <i>Gymnocorymbus</i> "represent the adaptation of some deep <i>Moenkhausia</i>    toward a disciform body, accompanied by a naked predorsal line". That hypothesis    about the relationships of <i>Gymnocorymbus</i> was only partially tested here,    given that only four, non-deep-bodied, species of <i>Moenkhausia</i> were included    in the analysis. G&eacute;ry (1977) also noted the resemblance of <i>Stichonodon</i>    and <i>Tetragonopterus</i> with <i>Gymnocorymbus</i> and 
<i>Poptella</i>, and    some deep-bodied <i>Moenkhausia</i>, respectively, and considered them to be    closely related. This node was composed of the subfamilies Tetragonopterinae    and Stethaprioninae by Mirande (2009) whereas it is included in the Tetragonopterinae    according to the final hypothesis herein proposed.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (52): (1 &gt; 0) extends dorsal of entire neural complex    of Weberian apparatus. Paralleled in node 214 and in <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Separation    between posterior dentary teeth (147): (0 &gt; 1) more than width of these teeth.    Paralleled in <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>,    and <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Proximal    and medial radials of anal fins (294): (0 &gt; 1) fused in most pterygiophores.    Paralleled in nodes 184, 208, and 218 and in <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i> and    <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 295.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Scales    covering anal-fin base (327): (0 &gt; 1) several rows covering basal third of    anal fin. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae, in node 210, and in <i>Bario steindachneri</i>,    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Paragoniates alburnus</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>,    <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>, and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Sclerotic    bones (350): (0 &gt; 1) two bones separated by cartilages. Paralleled in nodes    208, 210, 250, and 259.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Laterosensory    canal of sixth infraorbital (76): (0 &gt; 1) branched. Reversal of synapomorphy    2 of node 203. Paralleled in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>,    <i>Oligosarcus</i> cf. <i>jenynsii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Length    of caudal-fin canal of lateral line (93): (0 &gt; 1) almost reaching posterior    margin of caudal fin. Paralleled in nodes 177 and 216 and in <i>Astyanax pelegrini</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Tubules    for passage of blood vessels on lamellar portion of maxilla (98): (0 &gt; 1)    tubule with anterior branch running parallel to anterior margin of maxilla and    reaching one third of its length. Paralleled in node 201.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Ethmopalatine    cartilage (171): (0 &gt; 1) present and conspicuous. Paralleled in <i>Charax    stenopterus</i> and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Base    of second pectoral ray (231): (1 &gt; 0) large and partially overlapping base    of first pectoral ray from medial view. Paralleled in nodes 164 and 301 and    in <i>Moenkhausia dichroura</i> and <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Anterior    margin of scales (318): (0 &gt; 1) with conspicuous undulations. Paralleled    in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> <i>Radii</i>    of scales (322): (0 &gt; 1) converging at focus. Reversal of synapomorphy 7    of the Characidae. Paralleled in node 273 and in <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in node 302 and in <i>Microschemobrycon casiquiare</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Second    humeral spot (342): (0 &gt; 1) present as a conspicuous vertical bar. Paralleled    in <i>Gymnocorymbus ternetzi</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon bifasciatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 220: (11    / 91 / 17 / 3)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Brachychalcinus</i>,    <i>Gymnocorymbus</i>, some <i>Moenkhausia</i>?, <i>Orthospinus</i>, <i>Poptella</i>,    <i>Stethaprion</i>, and <i>Stichonodon</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    the Stethaprioninae, including <i>Brachychalcinus</i>, <i>Orthospinus</i>, <i>Poptella</i>,    and <i>Stethaprion</i>, was proposed by Reis (1989). This author recognized    the significant resemblance of these genera to other deep-bodied characids,    although he raised the possibility that this feature arose independently in    different lineages of the Characidae. The Stethaprioninae, as redefined by Mirande    (2009) was composed of the genera listed by Reis (1989) plus <i>Gymnocorymbus</i>    (both species of <i>Gymnocorymbus</i> share the presumably apomorphic naked    predorsal line and this genus is assumed here to be monophyletic) and the monotypic    genus <i>Stichonodon</i>. The inclusion of <i>Stichonodon</i> in the Stethaprioninae    was originally proposed by Eigenmann (1907), who later classified this genus    in its own subfamily Stichonodontinae (<i>e</i>. <i>g</i>. Eigenmann, 1910,    
as Stichanodontinae). As mentioned above this node is included in the Tetragonopterinae    for temporal precedence over both Stethaprioninae and Stichonodontinae. The    Stethaprioninae was hypothesized to be related with some deep-bodied <i>Moenkhausia</i>    (G&eacute;ry, 1977). Both that issue and the evaluation of the monophyly of    <i>Moenkhausia</i> lie beyond the scope of this paper, but it is probable that    some species of <i>Moenkhausia</i> should be included in this subfamily (although    <i>Moenkhausia xinguensis</i>, the type species of the genus, is included in    a clade discussed below).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Anterior    margin of supraoccipital (51): (0 &gt; 1) situated anterior to vertical through    posterior orbital margin. Paralleled in <i>Cynopotamus argenteus</i> and <i>Metynnis    maculatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of branched pelvic-fin rays (258): (1 &gt; 0) six or less. Paralleled in the    Aphyocharacinae, in nodes 236, 280, and 302, and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>, <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>, <i>Hollandichthys    multifasciatus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, and <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 284: (11    / 77 / 2 / 3)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Gymnocorymbus</i>    and <i>Stichonodon</i>; some <i>Moenkhausia</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">As noted above,    the marked resemblance between <i>Gymnocorymbus</i> and <i>Stichonodon</i> was    highlighted by G&eacute;ry (1977) and Reis (1989), but the monophyly of a clade    comprising these two genera was not previously proposed. The monophyly of <i>Gymnocorymbus</i>    was not tested, although both species of this genus share the absence of scales    along the predorsal line, an unusual feature within the Characidae, and this    genus is provisionally treated as monophyletic. Some species of <i>Moenkhausia</i>,    however, share a naked predorsal line (<i>e</i>. <i>g</i>. <i>M</i>. <i>dorsinuda</i>    Zarske &amp; G&eacute;ry; not included in this study), and could be related    to or included in this clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Number    of maxillary teeth (135): (1 &gt; 0) only one, or absent. Paralleled in the    <i>Astyanax</i> clade, in node 290, and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Cheirodon    interruptus</i>, <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon bifasciatus</i>,    and <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i>,    <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>, and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Posterior    extent of ventral process of quadrate (151): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of posterior    margin of symplectic. Paralleled in the <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i> clade    and Iguanodectinae, in nodes 289 and 298, and in <i>Astyanax mexicanus</i>,    <i>A</i>. cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>,    <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Metynnis    maculatus</i>, <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>,    <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>, <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>, <i>Psellogrammus    kennedyi</i>, and <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Median    predorsal scales (325): (0 &gt; 1) leaving naked area anterior to dorsal fin.    Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae and in <i>Lonchogenys ilisha</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (1 &gt; 0) reaching horizontal arm of preopercle.    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 180. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae and    Iguanodectinae, in nodes 184, 198, 225, and 302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Brycon pesu</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Moenkhausia    sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, and <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>.    Some trees: Reversed in node 292.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Dorsal    end of laterosensory canal of preopercle and suprapreopercle (82): (0 &gt; 1)    overlapping anterodorsal process of opercle. Paralleled in the Alestidae, in    node 230, and in <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon eques</i>, <i>Parecbasis    cyclolepis</i>, and <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Length    of ascending process of premaxilla (104): (0 &gt; 1) reaching just anterior    end of nasal. Paralleled in nodes 225 and 294 and in <i>Charax stenopterus</i>    and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Bryconamericus    agna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Fossa    for inner row of replacement premaxillary teeth (133): (0 &gt; 1) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Maxillary    teeth (134): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Coptobrycon    bilineatus</i>, <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>, and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i> and <i>Psellogrammus    kennedyi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Abrupt    decrease in size of dentary teeth (148): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy    1 of node 222.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Contact    between ectopterygoid and anterodorsal region of quadrate (162): (0 &gt; 1)    absent. Paralleled in nodes 184 and 242, and in <i>Aphyocharax dentatus</i>,    <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>, and <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>. Some trees:    Paralleled in the Cheirodontinae and in <i>Microschemobrycon casiquiare</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Ventral    margin of anterior ceratohyal (179): (1 &gt; 0) smooth and without notches.    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 189. Paralleled in node 211.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (195): (1 &gt; 0)    16 or more. Paralleled in nodes 177 and 183 and in <i>Astyanax latens</i>, <i>A</i>.    cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>A</i>. <i>pelegrini</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon socolofi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia dichroura</i>, <i>Parecbasis    cyclolepis</i>, and <i>Piaractus mesopotamicus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Laminar    bony ridge on dorsal margin of abdominal ribs (224): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled    in node 297 and in <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Number    of dorsal pterygiophores (277): (0 &gt; 1) 11 or more. Paralleled in <i>Stethaprion    erythrops</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> <i>Radii</i>    of scales (322): (0 &gt; 1) converging at focus. Reversal of synapomorphy 7    of the Characidae. Paralleled in node 273 and in <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in node 302 and in <i>Microschemobrycon casiquiare</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Gymnocorymbus ternetzi</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (289): (0 &gt; 1) 35 or more. Paralleled in nodes    207 and 212 and in <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>,    <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, <i>Stethaprion erythrops</i>,    and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 261 and in    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of anal pterygiophores anterior to first haemal spine (293): (0 &gt; 1) four    or more. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in node 214, and in <i>Cynopotamus    argenteus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Uroneurals    (306): (1 &gt; 0) absent or just one pair. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of the    Tetragonopterinae. Paralleled in node 288 and in <i>Jupiaba scologaster</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Second    humeral spot (342): (0 &gt; 1) present as a conspicuous vertical bar. Paralleled    in <i>Hyphessobrycon bifasciatus</i> and <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 219: (100    / 100 / 61 / 49)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Brachychalcinus,    Orthospinus</i>, <i>Poptella</i>, and <i>Stethaprion</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    this clade (as the Stethaprioninae) was proposed by Reis (1989), supported by    the presence of a predorsal spine, and the possession of randomly distributed    anal-fin bony hooks in mature males. The composition of this clade follows Reis    (1989).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphy:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Anteriorly    oriented spine formed by first dorsal-fin ray (267): (0 &gt; 1) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Stethaprion erythrops</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    coverage of dilator fossa by sixth infraorbital (69): (1 &gt; 0) almost complete,    at least in its ventral border. Paralleled in <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Anterior    extension of pelvic-bone along main axis (262): (0 &gt; 1) projecting anterior    of lateral and medial lamellae of pelvic bone. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae,    in node 302, and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>,    and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of dorsal pterygiophores (277): (0 &gt; 1) 11 or more. Paralleled in <i>Stichonodon    insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (289): (0 &gt; 1) 35 or more. Paralleled in nodes    207 and 212 and in <i>Gymnocorymbus ternetzi</i>, <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>,    <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>, and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    node 261 and in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Pelvic-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (309): (1 &gt; 0)    absent. Paralleled in <i>Creagrutus anary</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon eques</i>,    <i>H</i>. <i>luetkenii</i>, <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>, and <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i> and <i>Psellogrammus    kennedyi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Semicircular    grooves on posterior field of scales (323): (0 &gt; 1) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>No autapomorphies    found for <i>Poptella paraguayensis</i>.</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 274: (-4    / 71 / - / 1)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Bario</i>,    <i>Hasemania</i>, <i>Hemigrammus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon</i>, <i>Moenkhausia</i>,    <i>Paracheirodon</i>, <i>Petitella</i>?, <i>Pristella</i>, and <i>Thayeria</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphy:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Bony    hooks on first pelvic-fin ray of adult males (315): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled    in <i>Aphyocharacidium bolivianum</i>, <i>Aphyocharax anisitsi</i>, <i>Aulixidens    eugeniae</i>, and <i>Nantis indefessus</i>. Some trees: Reversed in node 291.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 273: (11    / 83 / 19 / 3)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Bario</i>    and <i>Moenkhausia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This clade includes    the analyzed species of <i>Bario</i> and <i>Moenkhausia</i>. Although a relationship    between these genera was previously proposed (<i>e</i>. <i>g</i>. G&eacute;ry,    1977), no published phylogenetic hypothesis supported that proposal. The genus    <i>Moenkhausia</i> has not been demonstrated to be monophyletic; indeed, some    of its species were related with other genera (<i>e</i>. <i>g</i>. <i>M</i>.    <i>georgiae</i> G&eacute;ry with <i>Tetragonopterus</i>; G&eacute;ry, 1977).    This genus probably is not monophyletic even with the inclusion of <i>Bario    steindachneri</i>, as suggest the results herein obtained. The monophyly and    phylogeny of <i>Moenkhausia</i> were studied in a still unpublished thesis (Benine,    2004), the results of which when published will surely help in resolve the taxonomy    of this diverse genus.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Number    of cusps of anterior maxillary teeth (139): (0 &gt; 1) five or more cusps. Paralleled    in the Rhoadsiinae, in nodes 283 and 294, and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>,    <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Hemibrycon dariensis</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>, and <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in node 246.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> <i>Radii</i>    of scales (322): (0 &gt; 1) converging at focus. Reversal of synapomorphy 7    of the Characidae. Paralleled in <i>Stichonodon insignis</i> and <i>Tetragonopterus    argenteus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302 and in <i>Microschemobrycon    casiquiare</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Moenkhausia xinguensis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Relative    position of dorsal-fin anterior insertion (265): (1 &gt; 0) anterior to or at    vertical through pelvic-fin origin. Paralleled in node 282 and in <i>Creagrutus    anary</i>, <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>, and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 272: (100    / 100 / 30 / 12)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Bario steindachneri</i>,    <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>, other <i>Moenkhausia</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (53): (0 &gt; 1) extends only to anterior limit of neural    complex. Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node 205. Paralleled in node 287 and    in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>, <i>Deuterodon iguape</i>, and <i>Lonchogenys    ilisha</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Bony    lamellae associated with supraneurals (282): (1 &gt; 0) absent or small. Paralleled    in nodes 197 and 299 and in <i>Acestrocephalus sardina</i> and <i>Nematocharax    venustus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> <i>Radii</i>    oriented towards anterior field of scales (321): (2 &gt; 1) only as longitudinal    groove without defined margins.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Distance    between cartilage anterior to orbitosphenoid and lateral ethmoids (38): (0 &gt;    1) distant from lateral ethmoids. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 223. Paralleled    in node 286.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (1 &gt; 0) reaching horizontal arm of preopercle.    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 180. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae and    Iguanodectinae, in nodes 184, 198, 225, and 302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Brycon pesu</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus    kyburzi</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>. Some    trees: Reversed in node 292.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Lateral    line (91): (0 &gt; 1) interrupted. Paralleled in nodes 227, 229, 279, 288, and    294 and in <i>Characidium rachovii</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    anisitsi</i>, <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Posterior    extent of ventral process of quadrate (151): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of posterior    margin of symplectic. Paralleled in the <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i> clade    and Iguanodectinae, in nodes 284, 289, and 298, and in <i>Astyanax mexicanus</i>,    <i>A</i>. cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>,    <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Metynnis    maculatus</i>, <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>, <i>Probolodus    heterostomus</i>, <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>, and <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (196): (0 &gt; 1)    ten or fewer. Paralleled in the Characinae and in <i>Bryconops melanurus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>, and <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>. Some    trees: Paralleled in node 196 and in <i>Hemigrammus erythrozonus</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon    herbertaxelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Bario steindachneri</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Contact    between frontals anteriorly to frontal fontanel (21): (0 &gt; 1) present. Reversal    of synapomorphy 4 of node 206. Paralleled in <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>, <i>Galeocharax    humeralis</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>, and <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Knodus breviceps</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Dorsal    end of laterosensory canal of preopercle and suprapreopercle (82): (0 &gt; 1)    overlapping anterodorsal process of opercle. Paralleled in the Alestidae, in    node 230, and in <i>Hyphessobrycon eques</i>, <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>,    <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Ventral    margin of horizontal process of anguloarticular (109): (0 &gt; 1) perpendicular    to laterosensory canal of dentary from medial view. Paralleled in node 199 and    in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i> and <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Dorsal-fin    rays articulating with first dorsal pterygiophore (266): (1 &gt; 0) two. Reversal    of synapomorphy 4 of node 203. Paralleled in <i>Thayeria obliqua</i>. Some trees:    Paralleled in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i> and <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Pectoral-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (310): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in node 268 and in <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>,    <i>A</i>. <i>lineatus</i>, <i>Bryconamericus</i> cf. <i>iheringii</i>, <i>B</i>.    <i>rubropictus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>, <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>,    and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Dorsal-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (311): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in nodes 248 and 268 and in <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>,    <i>A</i>. <i>lineatus</i>, <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    luetkenii</i>, <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>, <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>, and    <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Caudal-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (312): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in node 268 and in <i>Acrobrycon tarijae</i>, <i>Astyanax</i>    cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>, <i>A</i>. <i>lineatus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>,    <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>, and <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Scales    covering anal-fin base (327): (0 &gt; 1) several rows covering basal third of    anal fin. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae, in nodes 210 and 221, and in <i>Markiana    nigripinnis</i>, <i>Paragoniates alburnus</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, <i>Roeboides    microlepis</i>, and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 289: (-16    / 61 / - / 1)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Hasemania</i>?,    <i>Hemigrammus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon</i>, <i>Paracheirodon</i>, <i>Petitella</i>?,    <i>Pristella</i>, and <i>Thayeria</i>; some <i>Moenkhausia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    a group of species congruent with the taxa in this node was not previously proposed.    In the hypothesis by Mirande (2009) the clade composed of <i>Moenkhausia dichroura</i>    and <i>M</i>. cf. <i>intermedia</i> are the sister group of the clade composed    of <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i> and <i>M</i>.    <i>xinguensis</i>, the type species of the genus. In that hypothesis the analyzed    species of <i>Moenkhausia</i> formed a monophyletic unit except for the inclusion    of <i>Bario steindachneri</i>. In the present hypothesis, <i>Moenkhausia</i>    is composed of two lineages not forming a monophyletic group. As the type species    of the genus is <i>M</i>. <i>xinguensis</i>, related to <i>Bario</i> and <i>M</i>.    <i>sanctaefilomenae</i>, the species of <i>Moenkhausia</i> included in this    node should be transferred to a new genus, or to <i>Hemigrammus</i>, as 
discussed    below.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Posterior    extent of ventral process of quadrate (151): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of posterior    margin of symplectic. Paralleled in the <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i> clade    and Iguanodectinae, in nodes 284 and 298, and in <i>Astyanax mexicanus</i>,    <i>A</i>. cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>,    <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Metynnis    maculatus</i>, <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>,    <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>, <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>, <i>Psellogrammus    kennedyi</i>, and <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (234): (0 &gt; 1) with concavity ventral to first postcleithrum.    Reversal of synapomorphy 4 of node 204. Paralleled in node 196 and in <i>Probolodus    heterostomus</i> and <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>. Some trees: Reversed in node    295.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 297: (100    / 100 / 82 / 40)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Moenkhausia    bonita</i> Benine, Castro &amp; Sabino?, <i>M</i>. <i>dichroura</i>, <i>M</i>.    <i>gracilima</i> Eigenmann?, <i>M</i>. <i>lepidura</i>?, <i>M</i>. <i>intermedia</i>,    and other <i>Moenkhausia</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The species included    in this clade were considered within the <i>Moenkhausia lepidura</i> group by    G&eacute;ry (1977), characterized by the possession of a low body. An assessment    of the monophyly of this group of species, however, is beyond the scope of this    paper. G&eacute;ry (1977) mentioned that <i>Moenkhausia dichroura</i>, <i>M</i>.    <i>gracilima</i>, <i>M</i>. <i>intermedia</i>, and <i>M</i>. <i>lepidura</i>,    among the species of his <i>lepidura</i> group share the dark coloration of    the caudal-fin dorsal lobe. <i>Moenkhausia bonita</i> shares with <i>M</i>.    <i>dichroura</i> and <i>M</i>. <i>intermedia</i> the dark coloration of both    caudal-fin lobes, and it is tentatively included in this clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on second ceratobranchial (193): (0 &gt; 1) two. Paralleled in    nodes 210, 225, and 276 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Laminar    bony ridge on dorsal margin of abdominal ribs (224): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled    in <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i> and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Bony    hooks on fin rays (307): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in the Gymnocharacinae,    in nodes 207, 283, and 301, and in <i>Astyanax paris</i>, <i>Bryconamericus    mennii</i>, <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus    kyburzi</i>, and <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania    nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Color    of caudal-fin lobes (345): (0 &gt; 3) both lobes dark brown or black. Paralleled    in <i>Bryconamericus exodon</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Moenkhausia</i> cf. <i>intermedia</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (235): (0 &gt; 1) with markedly concave margin, almost forming    straight angle. Paralleled in nodes 162, 247, and 253 and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Characidium borellii</i>, <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>,    <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Position    of ventral margin of posttemporal (252): (1 &gt; 0) anterior to lateral margin    of epioccipital. Paralleled in nodes 162, 285, and 301 and in <i>Aulixidens    eugeniae</i>, <i>Creagrutus anary</i>, <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina    australis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 247 and in <i>Knodus breviceps</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Moenkhausia dichroura</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Alignment    of cusps of medial teeth on inner premaxillary row (127): (1 &gt; 0) forming    anteriorly concave semicircle from ventral view. Paralleled in nodes 183 and    262. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (195): (1 &gt; 0)    16 or more. Paralleled in nodes 177 and 183 and in <i>Astyanax latens</i>, <i>A</i>.    cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>A</i>. <i>pelegrini</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon socolofi</i>, <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, <i>Piaractus mesopotamicus</i>,    and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Base    of second pectoral ray (231): (1 &gt; 0) large and partially overlapping base    of first pectoral ray from medial view. Paralleled in nodes 164 and 301 and    in <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i> and <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 288: (-2    / 55 / - / 1)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Hasemania</i>?,    <i>Hemigrammus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon</i>, <i>Paracheirodon</i>, <i>Petitella</i>?,    <i>Pristella</i>, and <i>Thayeria</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Following the nomenclatural    preference against the creation of new names, all of the genera included in    this node should be synonymized to <i>Hemigrammus</i>, which has temporal precedence    over the remaining genera, excepting perhaps <i>Petitella</i> which was not    analyzed in this paper and whose relationships are uncertain. An alternative    solution would imply the creation of at least two new generic names, for <i>Moenkhausia    dichroura</i> and <i>M</i>. <i>intermedia</i> (and species related to them)    and <i>Hemigrammus ulreyi</i>. The present phylogenetic hypothesis would imply    many generic reassignments, especially in the species of the highly diverse    genus <i>Hyphessobrycon</i>. If this hypothesis is further corroborated, <i>Hemigrammus</i>    would become the most diverse genus of the Characidae, with approximately 200    species. The synonymies and generic reassignments implied for this 
contribution    should be further corroborated by more concerned papers, analyzing a higher    number of species of this diverse clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    line (91): (0 &gt; 1) interrupted. Paralleled in nodes 227, 229, 279, and 294    and in <i>Characidium rachovii</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    anisitsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>,    and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Uroneurals    (306): (1 &gt; 0) absent or just one pair. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of the    Tetragonopterinae. Paralleled in <i>Gymnocorymbus ternetzi</i> and <i>Jupiaba    scologaster</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>No autapomorphies    found for <i>Hemigrammus ulreyi</i>.</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 287: (-4    / 54 / - / 1)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Hasemania</i>?,    <i>Hemigrammus</i> (excepting, at least, <i>H. ulreyi</i>), <i>Hyphessobrycon</i>,    <i>Paracheirodon</i>, <i>Petitella</i>?, <i>Pristella</i>, and <i>Thayeria</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This clade is composed    of a group of species putatively included in the rosy tetra clade of Weitzman    &amp; Palmer (1997), or which are related to it, according to those authors.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (53): (0 &gt; 1) extends only to anterior limit of neural    complex.
