<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Posterior    extent of ventral process of quadrate (151): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of posterior    margin of symplectic. Paralleled in the <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i> clade    and Iguanodectinae, in nodes 284, 289, and 298, and in <i>Astyanax mexicanus</i>,    <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>, <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>,    <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>, <i>Micralestes    stormsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>,    <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>, <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>, and <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (195): (1 &gt; 0)    16 or more. Paralleled in nodes 177 and 183 and in <i>Astyanax latens</i>, <i>A</i>.    <i>pelegrini</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon socolofi</i>,    <i>Moenkhausia dichroura</i>, <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, <i>Piaractus mesopotamicus</i>,    and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 262: (-2    / 94 / 21 / 4)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Ctenobrycon</i>?,    <i>Markiana</i>, and <i>Psellogrammus</i>; <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>abramis</i>,    <i>A</i>. <i>asuncionensis</i>, <i>A</i>. <i>correntinus</i>, <i>A</i>. <i>lineatus</i>,    <i>A</i>. <i>pelegrini</i>, other <i>Astyanax</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Eigenmann (1921)    defined three subgenera in <i>Astyanax</i>, based on differences in squamation.    The subgenus <i>Poecilurichthys</i> Gill included those species with irregularly    arranged predorsal scales. <i>Astyanax abramis</i>, <i>A</i>. <i>asuncionensis</i>    (as <i>A</i>. <i>bimaculatus paraguayensis</i> Eigenmann), <i>A</i>. <i>correntinus</i>,    and <i>A</i>. <i>pelegrini</i> are among the species listed for this subgenus    by Eigenmann (1921). All these species are contained in this node, along with    <i>Astyanax lineatus</i> (included in the subgenus <i>Astyanax</i> by Eigenmann,    1921), <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, and <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi.</i> The subgenus    <i>Poecilurichthys</i> could be redefined as containing the species of this    node; however, the topology of the <i>Astyanax</i> clade does not justify such    subgeneric division.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Alignment    of cusps of medial teeth on inner premaxillary row (127): (1 &gt; 0) forming    anteriorly concave semicircle from ventral view. Paralleled in node 183 and    in <i>Moenkhausia dichroura</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302. Reversed    in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of supraneurals (280): (1 &gt; 0) four or fewer. Paralleled in nodes 211 and    223, and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    bifasciatus</i>, and <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    the Aphyoditeinae. Reversed in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Papillae    on tongue (357): (0 &gt; 1) forming longitudinal rows anteriorly.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Astyanax correntinus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Distribution    of denticles on gill rakers (202): (0 &gt; 1) along entire surface of gill rakers.    Paralleled in node 269 and in <i>Deuterodon langei</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon eques</i>, and <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 261: (-11    / 93 / 6 / 4)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Ctenobrycon</i>?,    <i>Markiana</i>, and <i>Psellogrammus</i>; <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>abramis</i>,    <i>A</i>. <i>asuncionensis</i>, <i>A</i>. <i>lineatus</i>, <i>A</i>. <i>pelegrini</i>,    other <i>Astyanax</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Relative    size of frontal and parietal fontanels (23): (1 &gt; 0) length of frontal fontanel    up to 2/3 length of parietal fontanel. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 264.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Horizontal    process of anguloarticular (108): (0 &gt; 1) broadly covered by dentary which    reaches posterior border of Meckelian cartilage. Reversal of synapomorphy 1    of node 206. Paralleled in nodes 246 and 253 and in <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Cusps    of teeth on outer premaxillary row (125): (1 &gt; 0) one to three cusps. Reversal    of synapomorphy 1 of node 265.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Relative    length of palatine (172): (0 &gt; 1) distinctly longer than one-half length    of ectopterygoid. Paralleled in nodes 197 and 302 and in <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>    and <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>. Reversed in node 259.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> <i>Circulii</i>    on posterior field of scales (319): (1 &gt; 0) present. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 206. Paralleled in <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>, <i>Phenagoniates macrolepis</i>,    and <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>. Reversed in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Longitudinal    position of insertion of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> tendon on dentary (330):    (0 &gt; 1) on vertical through middle or anterior half of Meckelian cartilage.    Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in nodes 184, 186, 209, 241, and 270, and    in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i> and <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (289): (0 &gt; 1) 35 or more. (some trees under k9-14).    Paralleled in nodes 207 and 212 and in <i>Gymnocorymbus ternetzi</i>, <i>Metynnis    maculatus</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>,    <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, <i>Stethaprion erythrops</i>, and <i>Thoracocharax    stellatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (52): (1 &gt; 0) extends dorsal of entire neural complex    of Weberian apparatus. Paralleled in nodes 214 and 221.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Lateral    coverage of dilator fossa by sixth infraorbital (69): (0 &gt; 1) leaving a conspicuous    naked area in anterior region of dilator fossa. Paralleled in the Iguanodetinae,    in node 197, and in <i>Charax stenopterus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, and    <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Posterior    extent of ventral process of quadrate (151): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of posterior    margin of symplectic. Paralleled in the <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i> clade    and Iguanodectinae, in nodes 284, 289, and 298, and in <i>Astyanax mexicanus</i>,    <i>A</i>. cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>,    <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Metynnis    maculatus</i>, <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>,    <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>, <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>, and <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Proximal    and medial radials of anal fins (294): (0 &gt; 1) fused in most pterygiophores.    Paralleled in nodes 184, 208, 218, and 221 and in <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in node 295.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Scales    (317): (0 &gt; 3) crenate.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Maxillary    teeth (134): (1 &gt; 0) absent. (some trees under k9-14). Paralleled in <i>Aulixidens    eugeniae</i>, <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i>, <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>, <i>Parecbasis    cyclolepis</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hyphessobrycon    elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Pelvic-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (309): (1 &gt; 0)    absent. (some trees under k9-14). Paralleled in <i>Creagrutus anary</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    eques</i>, <i>H</i>. <i>luetkenii</i>, <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>, and <i>Stethaprion erythrops</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Markiana    nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Astyanax pelegrini</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of caudal-fin canal of lateral line (93): (0 &gt; 1) almost reaching posterior    margin of caudal fin. Paralleled in nodes 177 and 216 and in <i>Tetragonopterus    argenteus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (195): (1 &gt; 0)    16 or more. Paralleled in nodes 177 and 183 and in <i>Astyanax latens</i>, <i>A</i>.    cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    socolofi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia dichroura</i>, <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, <i>Piaractus    mesopotamicus</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 260: (-37    / 87 / - / 7)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genus <i>Markiana</i>;    <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>abramis</i>, <i>A</i>. <i>asuncionensis</i>, <i>A</i>.    <i>lineatus</i>, other <i>Astyanax</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Although a close    relationship between <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i> and <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>    is not supported in the present hypothesis, these species, despite having much    different overall morphologies, share the absence of an ossified rhinosphenoid,    an overlap of the horizontal arm of the preopercle by the third infraorbital,    the possession of only four teeth on the inner premaxillary row, and the presence    of two uroneurals. These characters determine that these two species constitute    a monophyletic clade in the analyses performed under self-weighted optimization    both in Mirande (2009: <a href="#f4">fig. 4</a>) and in several analyses performed    for the present study. The variable relative positions of <i>B</i>. <i>scleroparius</i>    and <i>Markiana</i> contributes to the low stability of this node and most of    the remaining nodes of the <i>Astyanax</i> clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Rhinosphenoid    (47): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of the Characidae. Paralleled    in nodes 207, 280, and 298 and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Attonitus    ephimeros</i>, <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>,    <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, and <i>Salminus    brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Form    of fourth infraorbital (67): (1 &gt; 0) approximately square or more developed    longitudinally than dorsoventrally. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 266.    Paralleled in <i>Astyanax troya</i>. Some trees: Reversed in <i>A</i>. <i>asuncionensis</i>    and <i>A</i>. cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Branching    of laterosensory canals of fourth or fifth infraorbitals (74): (0 &gt; 1) present.    Paralleled in the <i>Bryconops</i> clade, in nodes 167, 177, 218, and 276, and    in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>, <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>, and <i>Piaractus    mesopotamicus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    opening between ventral diverging lamellae of mesethmoid and anterior process    of lateral ethmoid (15): (0 &gt; 1) small, ovate and partially occluded by diverging    lamellae of mesethmoid and anterior process of lateral ethmoid. Paralleled in    <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i> and <i>Roeboides descalvadensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Form    of orbitosphenoid (37): (0 &gt; 1) massive, almost reaching parasphenoid ventrally.    Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of the Characidae. Paralleled in node 193 and in    <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i> and <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Dorsolateral    processes of vomer (54): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes 215 and 218    and in <i>Bryconexodon juruenae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Articulation    between second and third infraorbitals (62): (0 &gt; 1) anteroventrally angled.    Paralleled in node 196 and in <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (1 &gt; 0) reaching horizontal arm of preopercle.    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 180. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae and    Iguanodectinae, in nodes 184, 198, 225, and 302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Brycon pesu</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>,    <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>, and <i>Stichonodon    insignis</i>. Some trees: Reversed in node 292.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Laterosensory    canal of sixth infraorbital (76): (0 &gt; 1) branched. Reversal of synapomorphy    2 of node 203. Paralleled in <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>, <i>Oligosarcus</i>    cf. <i>jenynsii</i>, and <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Lateral    surface of vertical canal of preopercle (81): (0 &gt; 1) covered by musculature    and/or infraorbitals. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 204.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Tubules    for passage of blood vessels on lamellar portion of maxilla (98): (1 &gt; 2)    anastomosed tubules.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Alignment    of cusps of medial teeth on inner premaxillary row (127): (0 &gt; 1) forming    shallow arch or aligned in straight series from ventral view. Reversal of synapomorphy    1 of node 262.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Number    of teeth in inner premaxillary row (129): (1 &gt; 0) four or fewer. Paralleled    in node 198 and in <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11</b>. Suprapreopercle    (175): (0 &gt; 1) autogenous, separated from preopercle. Paralleled in nodes    210 and 302 and in <i>Roeboides microlepis</i> and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Bony    lamellae bordering laterosensory canal of suprapreopercle (176): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in node 300.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Position    of ventral end of posttemporal (253): (0 &gt; 1) posterior to lateral margin    of epioccipital. Paralleled in nodes 211 and 228 and in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>,    <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>, and <i>Prochilodus    lineatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>14.</b> Ventral    exit of laterosensory canal of supracleithrum (254): (1 &gt; 0) covered by posterior    lamella of supracleithrum and exiting medially. Reversal of synapomorphy 14    of node 205. Paralleled in node 193.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>15.</b> Number    of supraneurals (280): (0 &gt; 1) five or more. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of    node 262.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>16.</b> Anterior    notch on first anal pterygiophore (292): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in node    162.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>17.</b> Uroneurals    (306): (0 &gt; 1) two pairs. Reversal of synapomorphy 15 of node 205. Paralleled    in the Tetragonopterinae, in nodes 276 and 300, and in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>    and <i>Galeocharax humeralis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>18.</b> Anterior    margin of scales (318): (0 &gt; 1) with conspicuous undulations. Paralleled    in <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>19.</b> <i>Circulii</i>    on posterior field of scales (319): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy    5 of node 261.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>20.</b> <i>Radii</i>    on scales (320): (1 &gt; 0) absent or reduced in number. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae    and Serrasalminae, in node 174, and in <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>, <i>Distichodus    maculatus</i>, and <i>Phenagoniates macrolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>21.</b> Scales    covering anal-fin base (327): (0 &gt; 1) several rows covering basal third of    anal fin. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae, in nodes 210 and 221, and in <i>Bario    steindachneri</i>, <i>Paragoniates alburnus</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>,    <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>, and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>22.</b> Scales    covering caudal-fin lobes (328): (0 &gt; 1) covering one-third of their length.    Paralleled in node 222 and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>,    and <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Knodus breviceps</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>23.</b> Anterior    extension of <i>adductor arcus palatini</i> (336): (1 &gt; 0) covering most    of dorsal surface of mesopterygoid. Paralleled in node 166 and in <i>Creagrutus    anary</i> and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Brycon    orbignyanus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>24.</b> Number    of 2n chromosomes (363): (0 &gt; 1) 52 or more. Paralleled in the Characinae    and Serrasalmidae, in node 196, and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    herbertaxelrodi</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Hemigrammus unilineatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>25.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (289): (0 &gt; 1) 35 or more. (some trees under k9-14).    Paralleled in nodes 207 and 212 and in <i>Gymnocorymbus ternetzi</i>, <i>Metynnis    maculatus</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>,    <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, <i>Stethaprion erythrops</i>, and <i>Thoracocharax    stellatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 261.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>26.</b> Pelvic-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (309): (1 &gt; 0)    absent.(some trees under k9-14). Paralleled in <i>Creagrutus anary</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    eques</i>, <i>H</i>. <i>luetkenii</i>, <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>, and <i>Stethaprion erythrops</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Psellogrammus    kennedyi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Astyanax lineatus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Pectoral-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (310): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in node 268 and in <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>,    <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Bryconamericus</i> cf. <i>iheringii</i>, <i>B</i>.    <i>rubropictus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>, <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>,    and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Dorsal-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (311): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in nodes 248 and 268 and in <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>,    <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    luetkenii</i>, <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>, <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>, and    <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Caudal-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (312): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in node 268 and in <i>Acrobrycon tarijae</i>, <i>Astyanax</i>    cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>, <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>,    <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>, and <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Maxillary    teeth (134): (0 &gt; 1) present. (some trees under k 9-14).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 259: (100    / 100 / 44 / 32)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Astyanax abramis</i>,    <i>A</i>. <i>argyrimarginatus</i> Garutti?, <i>A</i>. <i>asuncionensis</i>,    <i>A</i>. <i>bimaculatus</i> (Linnaeus)?, <i>A</i>. <i>goyacensis</i> Eigenmann?,    <i>A</i>. <i>lacustris</i> (L&uuml;tken)?, <i>A</i>. <i>maculisquamis</i> Garutti    &amp; Britski?, <i>A</i>. <i>orthodus</i> Eigenmann?, <i>A</i>. <i>paraguayensis</i>    (Fowler)?, <i>A</i>. <i>saltor</i> Travassos?, <i>A</i>. <i>superbus</i> Myers?,    <i>A</i>. <i>validus</i> G&eacute;ry, Planquette &amp; Le Bail?, other <i>Astyanax</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This clade corresponds    to the <i>Astyanax bimaculatus</i> group of Garutti (1999), which is characterized    by a rounded or ovate humeral spot and a peduncular spot that projects posteriorly    over the median caudal-fin rays. The monophyly of this group was not tested,    although the form of such a humeral spot is infrequent in the Characidae. Thus,    the species included in this group by Garutti (1999) are listed with question    marks pending specific studies.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Relative    length of palatine (172): (1 &gt; 0) approximately one-half length of ectopterygoid,    or less. Reversal of synapomorphy 4 of node 261.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Humeral    spot (341): (0 &gt; 1) horizontally-ovate. Paralleled in <i>Acestrorhynchus    pantaneiro</i>, <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Jupiaba mucronata</i>, and <i>Roeboides    microlepis</i>. Reversal of synapomorphy 4 of node 261.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Little    spot on each scale of flanks (347): (0 &gt; 1) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Sclerotic    bones (350): (0 &gt; 1) two bones separated by cartilages. (some trees under    k 9-14). Paralleled in nodes 208, 210, 221, and 250.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Astyanax asuncionensis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Form    of fourth infraorbital (67): (0 &gt; 1) longer dorsoventrally than longitudinally.    Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 260. (some trees under k9-14). Paralleled    in <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>No autapomorphies    found for <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>abramis</i>.</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 258: (-11    / 72 / - / 7)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Astyanax abramis</i>,    <i>A</i>. cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>, other <i>Astyanax</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphy:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Bony    hooks on last pelvic-fin ray of adult males (314): (0 &gt; 1) as numerous as    in other rays. Paralleled in nodes 232, 240, and 299 and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Pectoral-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (310): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in node 268 and in <i>Astyanax lineatus</i>, <i>Bario steindachneri</i>,    <i>Bryconamericus</i> cf. <i>iheringii</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>rubropictus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    luetkenii</i>, <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Dorsal-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (311): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in nodes 248 and 268 and in <i>Astyanax lineatus</i>, <i>Bario    steindachneri</i>, <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>,    <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>, <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>, and <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Caudal-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (312): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in node 268 and in <i>Acrobrycon tarijae</i>, <i>Astyanax    lineatus</i>, <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>, <i>H</i>.    <i>socolofi</i>, and <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Form    of fourth infraorbital (67): (0 &gt; 1) longer dorsoventrally than longitudinally.    (some trees under k9-14). Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 260. Paralleled    in <i>Astyanax asuncionensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Sclerotic    bones (350): (1 &gt; 0) single anteroventrally open bone. (some trees under    k9-14).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Astyanax abramis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of medial bony ridge of opercle (170): (1 &gt; 0) 60% or greater than opercular    length. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae, in node 210, and in <i>Creagrutus</i>    cf. <i>taphorni</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, and <i>Roeboides    microlepis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Acestrorhynchus pantaneiro</i>    and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 198: (-27    / 94 / - / 1)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Aphyocharacinae,    Aphyoditeinae, Cheirodontinae, Gymnocharacinae, and Stevardiinae; <i>Bryconamericus    scleroparius</i> clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This node differs    to the hypothesis of Mirande (2009) only in the position of <i>Bryconamericus    scleroparius</i>, which was included in the <i>Astyanax</i> clade in that paper.    The sister-group relationship between <i>B</i>. <i>scleroparius</i> and <i>Markiana    nigripinnis</i> under several of the analyses performed in this study reduces    the stability of this node.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Dorsal    margin of lateral ethmoids (16): (0 &gt; 1) situated obliquely in dorsal view,    converging in an anteriorly directed angle. Paralleled in node 162. Reversed    in the Aphyoditeinae and in <i>Nematobrycon palmeri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (1 &gt; 0) reaching horizontal arm of preopercle.    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 180. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae and    Iguanodectinae, in nodes 184, 225, and 302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Brycon pesu</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Moenkhausia    sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>,    and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>. Some trees: Reversed in nodes 280 and 298 and    in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>, <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>, <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>,    and <i>Creagrutus</i> cf. <i>taphorni</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of teeth in inner premaxillary row (129): (1 &gt; 0) four or fewer. Paralleled    in node <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i> and <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>. Reversed    in nodes 195 and 235 and in <i>Grundulus cochae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b><i>Bryconamericus    scleroparius</i> clade</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Bryconamericus    brevirostris</i> (G&uuml;nther)?, <i>B</i>. <i>emperador</i> (Eigenmann &amp;    Ogle)?, <i>B</i>. <i>guaytarae</i> Eigenmann &amp; Henn?, <i>B</i>. <i>loisae</i>    (G&eacute;ry)?, <i>B</i>. <i>multiradiatus</i> Dahl?, <i>B</i>. <i>peruanus</i>    (M&uuml;ller &amp; Troschel)?, <i>B</i>. <i>scleroparius</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>simus</i>    (Boulenger)?, <i>B</i>. <i>terrabensis</i> Meek?, <i>B</i>. <i>zeteki</i> Hildebrand?.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Bryconamericus    scleroparius</i> was included in the <i>Astyanax</i> clade in the hypothesis    of Mirande (2009). In this study instead this species is the sister group of    a large clade of characids composed of the subfamilies Aphyocharacinae, Aphyoditeinae,    Cheirodontinae, Gymnocharacinae, and Stevardiinae. <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>    shares with <i>B</i>. <i>brevirostris</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>emperador</i> (with    eight or nine branched dorsal-fin rays), <i>B</i>. <i>peruanus</i>, <i>B</i>.    <i>scopiferus guaitarae</i> (=<i>B</i>. <i>guaytarae</i>), and <i>B</i>. <i>simus</i>    (Eigenmann, 1917) the presence of nine branched dorsal-fin rays and a relatively    high number of anal-fin rays. G&eacute;ry (1977) included these species plus    <i>B</i>. <i>caucanus</i> Eigenmann, <i>B</i>. <i>loisae</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>multiradiatus</i>,    <i>B</i>. <i>phoenicopterus</i> (Cope), <i>B</i>. 
<i>terrabensis</i>, and <i>B</i>.    <i>zeteki</i> in a <i>Bryconamericus peruanus</i> group, defined by the relatively    high number of anal-fin rays, but not necessarily having nine branched dorsal-fin    rays. Among these species, <i>Bryconamericus caucanus</i> and <i>B</i>. <i>phoenicopterus</i>    have only eight branched dorsal-fin rays (as in true <i>Bryconamericus</i>),    according to Eigenmann (1917), and these two species are not putatively considered    in this clade. Rom&aacute;n-Valencia (2000) mentioned that <i>Bryconamericus    dahli</i> has between 8 and 10 branched dorsal-fin rays. Such intraspecific    variation is rare among characids, but this species is also tentatively included    in this clade. As <i>Bryconamericus exodon</i>, the type species of the genus,    is included in the Stevardiinae, <i>B</i>. <i>scleroparius</i> and close relatives    should be transferred to another genus. <i>Eretmobrycon bayano</i> Fink, transferred    to <i>Bryconamericus</i> by 
Rom&aacute;n-Valencia (2000) has also 9 branched    dorsal-fin rays, at least in some individuals (Rom&aacute;n-Valencia, 2002).    <i>Bryconamericus bayano</i> is phylogenetically related to <i>Bryconamericus    emperador</i> and <i>B</i>. <i>scleroparius</i> according to Rom&aacute;n-Valencia    &amp; Vanegas-R&iacute;os (2009). Although that hypothesis was based only in    a molecular Maximum Likelihood approach and they did not propose synapomorphies    relating these species, it constitute the single reference about the relationships    of <i>B</i>. <i>bayano</i>. According to the results obtained herein and considering    the hypothesis of Rom&aacute;n-Valencia &amp; Vanegas-R&iacute;os (2009), it    is possible that <i>Eretmobrycon</i> should have to be resurrected to include    not only <i>B</i>. <i>bayano</i> but also <i>B</i>. <i>scleroparius</i> and    close relatives.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Rhinosphenoid    (47): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of the Characidae. Paralleled    in nodes 207, 260, 280, and 298 and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Attonitus    ephimeros</i>, <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>,    <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Branching    of laterosensory canals of fourth or fifth infraorbitals (74): (0 &gt; 1) present.    Paralleled in the <i>Bryconops</i> clade, in nodes 167, 177, 218, 260, and 276,    and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i> and <i>Piaractus mesopotamicus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Foramen    in posterior region of metapterygoid (168): (1 &gt; 2) in form of incomplete    arch, bordered posteriorly by hyomandibula. Reversal of synapomorphy 10 of node    205. Paralleled in <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Position    of ventral end of posttemporal (253): (0 &gt; 1) posterior to lateral margin    of epioccipital. Paralleled in nodes 211 and 228 and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>,    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>, and <i>Prochilodus    lineatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (288): (0 &gt; 1) 25 or more. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 200. Paralleled in nodes 208, 255, and 263 and in <i>Nematobrycon    palmeri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Uroneurals    (306): (0 &gt; 1) two pairs. Reversal of synapomorphy 15 of node 205. Paralleled    in the Tetragonopterinae, in nodes 276 and 300, and in <i>Galeocharax humeralis</i>    and <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 197: (16    / 95 / - / 3)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Aphyocharacinae,    Aphyoditeinae, Cheirodontinae, Gymnocharacinae, and Stevardiinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of sphenotic spine (10): (1 &gt; 0) not extending ventrally to articulation    between sphenotic and hyomandibula. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 180.    Paralleled in the Characinae and in node 176. Reversed in <i>Creagrutus anary</i>    and <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>. Some trees: Reversed in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Lateral    coverage of dilator fossa by sixth infraorbital (69): (0 &gt; 1) leaving a conspicuous    naked area in anterior region of dilator fossa. Paralleled in the Iguanodetinae    and in <i>Charax stenopterus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Phenacogaster    tegatus</i>, and <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>. Reversed in node 232 and in    <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Tubules    for passage of blood vessels on lamellar portion of maxilla (98): (1 &gt; 0)    a single tubule, parallel to dorsal margin of maxilla. Reversal of synapomorphy    2 of node 201.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Relative    length of palatine (172): (0 &gt; 1) distinctly longer than one-half length    of ectopterygoid. Paralleled in nodes 261 and 302 and in <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>    and <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>. Reversed in node 255 and in <i>Acrobrycon    tarijae</i>, <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Parecbasis    cyclolepis</i>, and <i>Piabina argentea</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Bony    lamellae associated with supraneurals (282): (1 &gt; 0) absent or small. Paralleled    in nodes 272 and 299 and in <i>Acestrocephalus sardina</i> and <i>Nematocharax    venustus</i>. Reversed in <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i> and <i>Prodontocharax    melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 281: Gymnocharacinae    (37 / 91 / 9 / 4)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Coptobrycon</i>,    <i>Grundulus</i> Valenciennes, <i>Gymnocharacinus</i> Steindachner, and <i>Nematobrycon</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The subfamily Gymnocharacinae    was proposed by Eigenmann (1910) as containing only <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>.    This group was maintained by G&eacute;ry (1977) as the tribe Gymnocharacini;    that author (G&eacute;ry, 1977: 535) mentioned that this species could be related    with some "generalized <i>Hemibrycon</i>-like tetragonopterine". Miquelarena    &amp; Ar&aacute;mburu (1983) listed 22 characters distinguishing <i>Gymnocharacinus    bergii</i> from the remaining Tetragonopterinae of G&eacute;ry (1977). According    to the present hypothesis some of those characters are synapomorphies of this    clade. Miquelarena &amp; Ar&aacute;mburu (1983) justified the validity of the    monotypic subfamily Gymnocharacinae based on the mentioned list of characters.    However, the number of synapomorphies itself is not an appropriate basis to    assign a group a particular nomenclatural category. Such decision requires 
an    underlying phylogenetic hypothesis. In the present analysis this clade also    includes <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i>, <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, and <i>Nematobrycon    palmeri</i>. A close relationship between these four species was not previously    proposed. Mirande (2009) proposed the Gymnocharacinae to be composed of <i>Coptobrycon</i>,    <i>Grundulus</i>, and <i>Gymnocharacinus</i>, leaving <i>Nematobrycon</i> in    the monotypic <i>Nematobrycon</i> clade. The monophyly of this clade was obtained    in the analyses under self-weighted optimization by Mirande (2009) and in the    final hypothesis herein proposed. Although this node is relatively less stable    than that of the Gymnocharacinae of Mirande (2009), it is herein preferred to    redefine this subfamily to include also <i>Nematobrycon</i>. Among the genera    included in this node, <i>Coptobrycon</i> and <i>Gymnocharacinus</i> are monotypic,    while both <i>Grundulus</i> and <i>Nematobrycon</i> are composed of few 
species    that greatly resemble each other and which are much different from the remaining    Characidae. Although the monophyly of <i>Grundulus</i> and <i>Nematobrycon</i>    were not proposed in terms of shared synapomorphies, these genera are treated    as monophyletic in this paper. The disjunct geographic distribution of the genera    included in this clade is noteworthy. The species of <i>Grundulus</i> and <i>Nematobrycon</i>    inhabit northwestern South America, <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i> lives in the    upper basin of the r&iacute;o Paran&aacute;, in eastern Brazil, and <i>Gymnocharacinus    bergii</i> is the most austral member of the family Characidae, inhabiting the    Argentine province of rio Negro in the northeastern Patagonia. Given the present    state of knowledge it is premature to advance conclusions about the biogeography    of this subfamily.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Denticles    on gill rakers (201): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in nodes 245 and 253 and    in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i> and <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i> and <i>H</i>. <i>herbertaxelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Bony    hooks on fin rays (307): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in nodes 207, 283, 297,    and 301 and in <i>Astyanax paris</i>, <i>Bryconamericus mennii</i>, <i>Exodon    paradoxus</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, and    <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i> and    <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Adipose    fin (356): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in node 181 and in <i>Carnegiella strigata</i>    and <i>Phenagoniates macrolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Nematobrycon palmeri</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Dorsal    margin of lateral ethmoids (16): (1 &gt; 0) aligned. Reversal of synapomorphy    1 of node 198. Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Anterior    paired projections of parasphenoid (40): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in <i>Bryconexodon    juruenae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Fourth    infraorbital (66): (0 &gt; 1) absent or much reduced and bordered posteriorly    by third and fifth infraorbitals. Paralleled in the Aphyocharacinae and Gasteropelecidae,    in node 186, and in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Hemigrammus    erythrozonus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, and <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Extent    of implantation of teeth along maxilla (137): (0 &gt; 1) extending across almost    entire maxillary lamella. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 202. Paralleled    in node 208 and in <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, <i>Hemibrycon surinamensis</i>,    and <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (288): (0 &gt; 1) 25 or more. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 200. Paralleled in nodes 208, 255, and 263 and in <i>Bryconamericus    scleroparius</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 280: (100    / 100 / 83 / 33)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Coptobrycon</i>,    <i>Grundulus</i>, and <i>Gymnocharacinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    these genera was proposed by Mirande (2009) as the resurrected and redefined    subfamily Gymnocharacinae. Although the relationship of <i>Nematobrycon</i>    with these three genera is somewhat unstable across the analyses herein performed,    the node composed of <i>Coptobrycon</i>, <i>Grundulus</i>, and <i>Gymnocharacinus</i>    is supported by several synapomorphies and is stable across all the explored    analytical conditions.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Rhinosphenoid    (47): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of the Characidae. Paralleled    in nodes 207, 260, and 298 and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Attonitus    ephimeros</i>, <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>,    <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, and <i>Salminus    brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (0 &gt; 1) not reaching horizontal arm of    preopercle, at least anteriorly. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 198. Paralleled    in node 298 and in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>, <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>, <i>Bryconamericus    rubropictus</i>, and <i>Creagrutus</i> cf. <i>tahorni</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Ventral    margin of horizontal process of anguloarticular (109): (1 &gt; 0) posteroventrally    angled relative to laterosensory canal of dentary from medial view. Reversal    of synapomorphy 1 of node 199. Paralleled in nodes 195 and 298 and in <i>Attonitus    ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Form    of teeth of inner premaxillary tooth row (128): (0 &gt; 1) with cusps aligned    in straight series and without anterior concavity. Paralleled in the Rhoadsiinae,    in nodes 195 and 245, and in <i>Hemigrammus bleheri</i> and <i>Odontostoechus    lethostigmus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (0 &gt; 1) two. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 179. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>,    <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>,    <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>,    <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 249 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Ventral    extension of coracoid lamella (241): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of ventral margin    of cleithrum. Paralleled in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Number    of branched pelvic-fin rays (258): (1 &gt; 0) six or less. Paralleled in the    Aphyocharacinae, in nodes 220, 236, and 302, and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>, <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>, <i>Hollandichthys    multifasciatus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, and <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (287): (1 &gt; 0) 17 or less. Reversal of synapomorphy    6 of the Characoidea. Paralleled in the Alestidae, in node 290, and in <i>Attonitus    ephimeros</i> and <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    <i>Hasemania nana</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Position    of sphenotic spine relative to the orbit (12): (0 &gt; 1) distinctly posterior    to orbital margin. Paralleled in nodes 193 and 299 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus    pantaneiro</i>, <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, and <i>Cynopotamus argenteus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Bony    lamellae bordering laterosensory canal of first infraorbital (58): (0 &gt; 1)    absent. Paralleled in node 208.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Premaxillary,    maxillary, and dentary teeth (119): (0 &gt; 1) pedunculate and uniformly shaped.    Paralleled in node 232 and in <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Cusps    of teeth on outer premaxillary row (125): (0 &gt; 1) five or more cusps. Paralleled    in nodes 265 and 294 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconops melanurus</i>,    <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, and <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Bryconamericus agna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of cusps of anterior maxillary teeth (139): (0 &gt; 1) five or more cusps. Paralleled    in the Rhoadsiinae, in nodes 273, 283, and 294, and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>,    <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Hemibrycon dariensis</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>,    and <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 246.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Relative    length of palatine (172): (1 &gt; 0) approximately one-half length of ectopterygoid,    or less. Reversal of synapomorphy 4 of node 197. Paralleled in node 255 and    in <i>Acrobrycon tarijae</i>, <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>,    and <i>Piabina argentea</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Bony    lamella dorsal to fourth basibranchial (185): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of node 203. Paralleled in node 296 and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Mimagoniates rheocharis</i>, <i>Nematocharax    venustus</i>, <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>, and <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Relative    number of precaudal vertebrae (226): (1 &gt; 0) exceeding caudal vertebrae in    two or more elements. Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of Characoidea. Paralleled    in <i>Brycinus carolinae</i> and <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus.</i></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Articulation    between ventral process of mesocoracoid and dorsal margin of scapula (245):    (0 &gt; 1) present and broad. Paralleled in node 252.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Form    of third postcleithrum (250): (1 &gt; 0) slender, without associated lamella.    Reversal of synapomorphy 6 of node 204. Paralleled in node 242 and in <i>Pseudochalceus    kyburzi</i> and <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Dorsal    development of third postcleithrum (251): (0 &gt; 1) not projects dorsally to    posterior region of scapula. Paralleled in node 192 and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Position    of last supraneural (283): (0 &gt; 1) located more than two vertebrae in front    of first dorsal pterygiophore. Paralleled in nodes 174 and 244 and in <i>Engraulisoma    taeniatum</i> and <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Longitudinal    position of insertion of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> tendon on dentary (330):    (0 &gt; 1) on vertical through middle or anterior half of Meckelian cartilage.    Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in nodes 184, 186, 209, 241, 261, and 270,    and in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i> and <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 279: (76    / 96 / 17 / 5)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Coptobrycon</i>    and <i>Grundulus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of laterosensory canal of dentary (79): (0 &gt; 1) reduced or absent. Paralleled    in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    elachys</i>, <i>H</i>. <i>luetkenii</i>, <i>Nantis</i> cf. <i>indefessus</i>,    and <i>Thayeria boehlkei</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Lateral    line (91): (0 &gt; 1) interrupted. Paralleled in nodes 227, 229, 288, and 294    and in <i>Characidium rachovii</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    anisitsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>,    and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Nostrils    (351): (0 &gt; 1) nostrils distinctly separate. Paralleled in node 168 and in    <i>Leporinus striatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Grundulus cochae</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Anterior    articulation of epioccipital bridge (6): (0 &gt; 1) only with parietal. Some    trees: Paralleled in <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Morphology    of premaxillary, maxillary, and dentary teeth (118): (1 &gt; 0) all teeth conical,    caniniform or mamilliform. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae, in nodes 174,    181, and 211, and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i> and <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of rows of premaxillary teeth (122): (1 &gt; 0) one. Paralleled in node 195    and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Carnegiella    strigata</i>, <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>, <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>,    <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, and <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of teeth in inner premaxillary row (129): (0 &gt; 1) five or more. Reversal    of synapomorphy 3 of node 198. Paralleled in nodes 195 and 235.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of teeth in inner premaxillary row (130): (0 &gt; 1) eight or more. Paralleled    in the Aphyoditeinae, in node 170, and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Prionobrama    paraguayensis</i>, and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Extent    of implantation of teeth along maxilla (137): (0 &gt; 1) extending across almost    entire maxillary lamella. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 202. Paralleled    in node 208 and in <i>Hemibrycon surinamensis</i>, <i>Nematobrycon palmeri</i>,    and <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Foramen    on articular condyle of quadrate (149): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes    168, 211, and 231 and in <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon eques</i>,    and <i>Lonchogenys ilisha</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Anterior    convergence of ventral diverging lamellae with nasal septum of mesethmoid (31):    (1 &gt; 0) absent, or confluent near anterior end of nasal septum. Paralleled    in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i> and <i>Knodus breviceps</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Nasal    (33): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Maxillary    teeth (134): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Iguanodectes    geisleri</i>, <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i> and <i>Psellogrammus    kennedyi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of maxillary teeth (135): (1 &gt; 0) only one, or absent. Paralleled in the    <i>Astyanax</i> clade, in nodes 284 and 290, and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>,    <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon bifasciatus</i>, and <i>Iguanodectes    geisleri</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Paracheirodon    axelrodi</i>, and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of branched-rays on dorsal-fin (270): (1 &gt; 0) eight or fewer. Paralleled    in the Stevardiinae and in <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, and <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Number    of rays on last anal pterygiophore (291): (0 &gt; 1) one. Paralleled in <i>Hasemania    nana</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Horizontal    line of chromatophores just dorsal to anal-fin base (344): (0 &gt; 1) present.    Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 196: (44    / 97 / - / 4)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Aphyocharacinae,    Aphyoditeinae, Cheirodontinae, and Stevardiinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    this node was originally proposed by Mirande (2009).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Articulation    between second and third infraorbitals (62): (0 &gt; 1) anteroventrally angled.    Paralleled in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i> and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>. Reversed    in <i>Acrobrycon tarijae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (234): (0 &gt; 1) with concavity ventral to first postcleithrum.    Reversal of synapomorphy 4 of node 204. Paralleled in node 289 and in <i>Probolodus    heterostomus</i> and <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>. Reversed in node 298 and in <i>Cheirodon    interruptus</i> and <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Gill-derived    gland on males (352): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.    Reversed in nodes 236 and 251 and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of 2n chromosomes (363): (0 &gt; 1) 52 or more. Paralleled in the Characinae    and Serrasalmidae and in <i>Chalceus macrolepidotus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon herbertaxelrodi</i>,    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Hemigrammus unilineatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (196): (0 &gt; 1)    ten or fewer. (k13-14). Paralleled in the Characinae and in <i>Bryconops melanurus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>, <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>, and <i>Moenkhausia    sanctaefilomenae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hemigrammus erythrozonus</i>    and <i>Hyphessobrycon herbertaxelrodi</i>. Reversed in node 237 and in <i>Bryconamericus</i>    cf. <i>exodon</i> and <i>B</i>. cf. <i>iheringii</i>. <b>Some trees:</b> Reversed    in the Cheirodontinae and in <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 195: (95    / 99 / 26 / 13)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Aphyocharacinae,    Aphyoditeinae, and Cheirodontinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    this node was also proposed by Mirande (2009). Most genera contained in this    clade were included in the Cheirodontinae by Eigenmann (1915), along with several    other genera. That classification was partially followed by G&eacute;ry (1977),    which included the genera herein included in the Aphyoditeinae in his Cheirodontinae    <i>sensu lato</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventral    margin of horizontal process of anguloarticular (109): (1 &gt; 0) posteroventrally    angled relative to laterosensory canal of dentary from medial view. Reversal    of synapomorphy 1 of node 199. Paralleled in nodes 280 and 298 and in <i>Attonitus    ephimeros</i>. Reversed in <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Position    of coronomeckelian (110): (1 &gt; 0) situated mainly lateral to Meckelian cartilage.    Reversal of synapomorphy 2. Paralleled in <i>Astyanax eigenmanniorum1</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of rows of premaxillary teeth (122): (1 &gt; 0) one. Paralleled in <i>Aulixidens    eugeniae</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Carnegiella strigata</i>, <i>Grundulus    cochae</i>, <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>, <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>,    <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, and <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Form    of teeth of inner premaxillary tooth row (128): (0 &gt; 1) with cusps aligned    in straight series and without anterior concavity. Paralleled in the Rhoadsiinae,    in nodes 245 and 280, and in <i>Hemigrammus bleheri</i> and <i>Odontostoechus    lethostigmus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of teeth in inner premaxillary row (129): (0 &gt; 1) five or more. Reversal    of synapomorphy 3 of node 198. Paralleled in node 235 and in <i>Grundulus cochae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Transitional    vertebrae with haemal canal (229): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in node 212    and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>, <i>Metynnis    maculatus</i>, and <i>Piabina argentea</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 247    and in <i>Bryconamericus alpha</i> and <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>. Reversed    in <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i> and <i>Serrapinnus calliurus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 194: Aphyocharacinae    (100 / 100 / 64 / 66)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Aphyocharax</i>,    <i>Inpaichthys</i> G&eacute;ry &amp; Junk, <i>Leptagoniates</i>?, <i>Paragoniates</i>    Steindachner, <i>Phenagoniates</i> Eigenmann &amp; Wilson, <i>Prionobrama</i>,    <i>Rachoviscus</i> Myers?, and <i>Xenagoniates</i> Myers.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">As classically    treated, the subfamily Aphyocharacinae included only <i>Aphyocharax</i> (Eigenmann,    1909). G&eacute;ry (1977), however, mentioned the pronounced resemblance between    <i>Aphyocharax</i> and the members of his Paragoniatinae (genera <i>Leptagoniates</i>,    <i>Paragoniates</i>, <i>Phenagoniates</i>, <i>Prionobrama</i>, <i>Rachoviscus</i>,    and <i>Xenagoniates</i>), especially with <i>Prionobrama</i> and <i>Rachoviscus</i>.    A similar group of genera was obtained as monophyletic by Quevedo (2006). <i>Leptagoniates</i>    was not analyzed in this paper, but it shares an overall resemblance with <i>Xenagoniates</i>    and, in the case of its type-species, <i>L</i>. <i>steindachneri</i> Boulenger,    a very long anal-fin, with more than 60 rays. This unusual character state could    be an evidence of close relationship between <i>Leptagoniates</i> and the Aphyocharacinae.    The relationships of 
<i>Rachoviscus</i> are also unclear. G&eacute;ry (1977)    mentioned that <i>R</i>. <i>crassiceps</i> Myers has non-aligned premaxillary    teeth, which seems to form two independent rows in some specimens. This condition    is comparable to that of <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i> among the species herein analyzed.    <i>Rachoviscus</i> additionally shares with <i>Inpaichthys</i> certain resemblances    in overall form and coloration. Both <i>Leptagoniates</i> and <i>Rachoviscus</i>    are provisionally included in this node based on the long anal-fin and the position    of the premaxillary teeth which probably relate these genera with <i>Xenagoniates</i>    and <i>Inpaichthys</i>, respectively. Thus, this node includes the subfamilies    Aphyocharacinae and Paragoniatinae of G&eacute;ry (1977), plus <i>Inpaichthys    kerri</i> as sister group of these former subfamilies. The nomenclatural options    derivable from these results are to conserve as valid both the Aphyocharacinae    and 
Paragoniatinae, add a new monotypic subfamily for <i>Inpaichthys</i>, or    join together all members of this clade in the same subfamily. The latter option    is preferred so as to be conservative in the creation of new categories, and    avoid the potential need to create other subfamilies for species eventually    resolved at the base of this clade. Among the available names, Aphyocharacinae    Eigenmann, 1909 has temporal precedence over Paragoniatinae G&eacute;ry, 1972.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Synchondral    articulation between lateral ethmoid and anterodorsal border of orbitosphenoid    (35): (1 &gt; 0) present. Paralleled in <i>Leporinus striatus</i>, <i>Mimagoniates    rheocharis</i>, <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Fourth    infraorbital (66): (0 &gt; 1) absent or much reduced and bordered posteriorly    by third and fifth infraorbitals. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae, in node    186, and in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Hemigrammus    erythrozonus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>,    and <i>Nematobrycon palmeri</i>. Reversed in node 207.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of branched pelvic-fin rays (258): (1 &gt; 0) six or less. Paralleled in nodes    220, 236, 280, and 302 and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>, <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>,    <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax    goethei</i>, and <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    <i>Hasemania nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>. Reversed in <i>Aphyocharax    dentatus</i> and <i>Paragoniates alburnus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of sphenotic spine (10): (0 &gt; 1) extending ventrally to articulation between    sphenotic and hyomandibula. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 197. Paralleled    in <i>Creagrutus anary</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Posterior    extension of rhinosphenoid cartilage (49): (0 &gt; 1) extended to vertical through    region of articulation between orbitosphenoid and pterosphenoid.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Antorbital    (55): (0 &gt; 1) absent or fused with first infraorbital. Paralleled in <i>Hoplias</i>    cf. <i>malabaricus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Canal    of lateral line on caudal-fin membrane (92): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of the Characidae. Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae and <i>Bryconops</i>    clade, in nodes 227, 229, 244, 287, 294, and 298, and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>,    <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i>, <i>Charax stenopterus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon anisitsi</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Abrupt    posterior expansion of interopercle (164): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in    the Cheirodontinae and in <i>Apareiodon affinis</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (234): (1 &gt; 0) without concavity ventral to first postcleithrum.    Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 196. Paralleled in node 298 and in <i>Cheirodon    interruptus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Bony    hooks on fin rays (307): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in the Gymnocharacinae,    in nodes 207, 283, 297, and 301, and in <i>Astyanax paris</i>, <i>Bryconamericus    mennii</i>, <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, and <i>Rhoadsia    altipinna</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon    elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Contact    between dorsal margin of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> and ventral margin of <i>dilator    operculi</i> (335): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in <i>Creagrutus anary</i>,    <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>, <i>Pristella    maxillaris</i>, <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 193: (100    / 100 / 98 / 74)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Aphyocharax</i>,    <i>Leptagoniates</i>?, <i>Paragoniates</i>, <i>Phenagoniates</i>, <i>Prionobrama</i>,    <i>Rachoviscus</i>?, and <i>Xenagoniates</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">G&eacute;ry (1977)    proposed a close relationship between his Aphyocharacinae and Paragoniatinae,    although he did not propose shared synapomorphies common to these two groups.    The high support and stability of this clade corroborate his proposal.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Position    of sphenotic spine relative to the orbit (12): (0 &gt; 1) distinctly posterior    to orbital margin. Paralleled in node 299 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus pantaneiro</i>,    <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Cynopotamus argenteus</i>, and <i>Gymnocharacinus    bergii</i>. Reversed in <i>Paragoniates alburnus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Articulation    between medial region of lateral ethmoid and frontal or mesethmoid (17): (0    &gt; 1) extensive articulation of entire lateral ethmoid dorsal margin. Paralleled    in node 170.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Form    of orbitosphenoid (37): (0 &gt; 1) massive, almost reaching parasphenoid ventrally.    Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of the Characidae. Paralleled in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>,    <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, and <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Dorsal    process of pterotic where tendon from epaxial musculature attach (45): (0 &gt;    1) present, projecting dorsally from tube for semicircular canal. Paralleled    in the Heterocharacinae and in <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i> and <i>Serrasalmus    maculatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Ventral    border of rhinosphenoid (50): (0 &gt; 1) almost contacting parasphenoid. Paralleled    in node 174.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Position    of opening on neurocranium communicating with laterosensory canal of sixth infraorbital    (77): (0 &gt; 1) in frontal. Paralleled in node 249 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>    and <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>. Reversed in <i>Phenagoniates macrolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Position    of opening on neurocranium communicating with sixth infraorbital laterosensory    canal (78): (0 &gt; 1) distinctly anterior to sphenotic tube for vertical semicircular    canal.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Alignment    of ascending process of premaxilla (105): (0 &gt; 1) medially shifted and separated    from nasal. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Process    of scapula forming anterior border of scapular foramen (244): (0 &gt; 1) absent.    Paralleled in node 252 and in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>, <i>Deuterodon langei</i>,    <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon herbertaxelrodi</i>,    <i>Leporinus striatus</i>, <i>Odontostilbe paraguayensis</i>, and <i>Thayeria    obliqua</i>. Reversed in <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Ventral    exit of laterosensory canal of supracleithrum (254): (1 &gt; 0) covered by posterior    lamella of supracleithrum and exiting medially. Reversal of synapomorphy 14    of node 205. Paralleled in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 192: (100    / 100 / 92 / 86)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genus <i>Aphyocharax</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    <i>Aphyocharax</i> was not adequately tested, although the species of this genus    share some modifications in the infraorbitals which suggest its monophyly (Lima,    2003c). This is partially corroborated in this paper, although a complete phylogeny    of the genus is still necessary.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Trigemino-facialis    foramen (42): (0 &gt; 1) narrow, as a cleft with sphenotic almost excluded from    its margin.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Dorsal    projection of maxilla (102): (0 &gt; 1) overlaps second infraorbital.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Dorsal    development of third postcleithrum (251): (0 &gt; 1) not projects dorsally to    posterior region of scapula. Paralleled in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i> and <i>Gymnocharacinus    bergii</i>.</font></p>
