<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Contact    between frontals anteriorly to frontal fontanel (21): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled    in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i> and <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Rhinosphenoid    (47): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of the Characidae. Paralleled    in nodes 207, 260, 280, and 298 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Bryconamericus    scleroparius</i>, <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>,    <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Length    of laterosensory canal of dentary (79): (0 &gt; 1) reduced or absent. Paralleled    in node 279 and in <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>,    <i>H</i>. <i>luetkenii</i>, <i>Nantis</i> cf. <i>indefessus</i>, and <i>Thayeria    boehlkei</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Canal    of lateral line on caudal-fin membrane (92): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of the Characidae. Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae and <i>Bryconops</i>    clade, in nodes 227, 229, 244, 287, 294, and 298, and in <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>,    <i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i>, <i>Charax stenopterus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon anisitsi</i>,    <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Relative    length of palatine (172): (1 &gt; 0) approximately one-half length of ectopterygoid,    or less. Reversal of synapomorphy 4 of node 197. Paralleled in node 255 and    in <i>Acrobrycon tarijae</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>,    and <i>Piabina argentea</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Gill-derived    gland on males (352): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy 6 of node    196. Paralleled in nodes 236 and 251.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 191: (100    / 100 / 68 / 35)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Aphyocharax    anisitsi</i>, <i>A</i>. <i>dentatus</i>, other <i>Aphyocharax</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The sister-group    relationship between <i>Aphyocharax anisitsi</i> and <i>A</i>. <i>dentatus</i>,    as obtained herein, should be tested in a phylogenetic analysis of this genus.    Both species have a reddish ventral caudal-fin lobe, a character-state shared    with other species of <i>Aphyocharax</i>, which could correspond to a more inclusive    node.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    ridge of anguloarticular (107): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the Cheirodontinae    and in <i>Aphyocharacidium bolivianum</i> and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Color    of caudal-fin lobes (345): (0 &gt; 1) ventral lobe orange or reddish, and dorsal,    lobe hyaline.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Aphyocharax dentatus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Contact    between ectopterygoid and anterodorsal region of quadrate (162): (0 &gt; 1)    absent. Paralleled in nodes 184 and 242, and in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>,    <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>. Some trees:    Paralleled in the Cheirodontinae and in <i>Microschemobrycon casiquiare</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of branched pelvic-fin rays (258): (0 &gt; 1) seven or more. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of the Aphyocharacinae. Paralleled in <i>Paragoniates alburnus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Aphyocharax anisitsi</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ascending    process on posterodorsal angle of exoccipital directed to neural complex of    Weberian apparatus (19): (0 &gt; 1) present.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Bony    hooks on base of pelvic-fin rays of adult males (313): (0 &gt; 1) as numerous    as on segmented portion of rays. Paralleled in node 229.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Bony    hooks on first pelvic-fin ray of adult males (315): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled    in node 274 and in <i>Aphyocharacidium bolivianum</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>,    and <i>Nantis indefessus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 208: (100    / 100 / 94 / 65)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Leptagoniates</i>?,    <i>Paragoniates</i>, <i>Phenagoniates</i>, <i>Prionobrama</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This clade includes    the Paragoniatinae of G&eacute;ry (1972, 1977) as a highly supported and stable    group, which, as already mentioned, is herein included in the Aphyocharacinae.    <i>Leptagoniates</i> is tentatively included in this clade, as explained at    node 193.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Bony    lamellae bordering laterosensory canal of first infraorbital (58): (0 &gt; 1)    absent. Paralleled in <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Extent    of implantation of teeth along maxilla (137): (0 &gt; 1) extending across almost    entire maxillary lamella. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 202. Paralleled    in <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, <i>Hemibrycon surinamensis</i>, <i>Nematobrycon    palmeri</i>, and <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Main    portion of fourth basibranchial (186): (0 &gt; 1) ossified.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Anal-fin    position (284): (0 &gt; 1) extended anteriorly ventral to dorsal fin. Paralleled    in nodes 170, 212, and 236 and in <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (288): (0 &gt; 1) 25 or more. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 200. Paralleled in nodes 255 and 263 and in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>    and <i>Nematobrycon palmeri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Proximal    and medial radials of anal fins (294): (0 &gt; 1) fused in most pterygiophores.    Paralleled in nodes 184, 218, and 221 and in <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i> and    <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 295.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Sclerotic    bones (350): (0 &gt; 1) two bones separated by cartilages. Paralleled in nodes    210, 221, 250, and 259.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Number    of teeth in inner premaxillary row (130): (0 &gt; 1) eight or more. Paralleled    in the Aphyoditeinae, in node 170, and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Grundulus    cochae</i>, <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>, and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Contact    between ectopterygoid and anterodorsal region of quadrate (162): (0 &gt; 1)    absent. Paralleled in nodes 184 and 242, and in <i>Aphyocharax dentatus</i>,    <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>. Some trees:    Paralleled in the Cheirodontinae and in <i>Microschemobrycon casiquiare</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Form    and degree of ossification of first ceratobranchial gill rakers (200): (0 &gt;    1) rather thick and completely ossified distal region. Paralleled in nodes 176,    212, and 299 and in <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i> and <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Base    of second pectoral ray (231): (1 &gt; 0) large and partially overlapping base    of first pectoral ray from medial view. Paralleled in nodes 164 and 301 and    in <i>Moenkhausia dichroura</i> and <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (235): (0 &gt; 1) with markedly concave margin, almost forming    straight angle. Paralleled in nodes 162, 247, and 253 and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Characidium borellii</i>, <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>,    <i>Moenkhausia</i> cf. <i>intermedia</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Ventral    articulation of mesocoracoid (246): (0 &gt; 1) only with coracoid.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Number    of epurals (296): (1 &gt; 0) one. Paralleled in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Contact    between dorsal margin of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> and ventral margin of <i>dilator    operculi</i> (335): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in <i>Creagrutus anary</i>,    <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>,    <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>. Some trees:    Paralleled in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 207: (39    / 92 / 64 / 48)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Leptagoniates</i>?,    <i>Paragoniates</i>, <i>Phenagoniates</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Although no synapomorphies    for this group of genera were proposed, G&eacute;ry (1977) included them in    his Paragoniatinae. That author considered <i>Prionobrama</i> to be a basal    member of this group, and highlighted its resemblance to <i>Aphyocharax</i>.    Uj (1990) included <i>Prionobrama</i> in his Aphyocharacidae (=Aphyocharacinae)    and not in his Paragoniatidae (=Paragoniatinae) together with the remaining    genera of the Paragoniatinae of G&eacute;ry (1977). However, Uj did not provided    explicit reasons supporting that hypothesis. In the present study <i>Prionobrama</i>    is the sister group of this clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Rhinosphenoid    (47): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of the Characidae. Paralleled    in nodes 260, 280, and 298 and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Attonitus    ephimeros</i>, <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>,    <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, and <i>Salminus    brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (53): (1 &gt; 0) extends posteriorly to, at least, middle    length of neural complex of Weberian apparatus. Paralleled in <i>Odontostilbe    paraguayensis</i> and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Fourth    infraorbital (66): (1 &gt; 0) present, well developed. Reversal of synapomorphy    2 of the Aphyocharacinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of supraneurals (281): (0 &gt; 1) eight or more. Paralleled in node 170 and    in <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i> and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (289): (0 &gt; 1) 35 or more. Paralleled in node 212    and in <i>Gymnocorymbus ternetzi</i>, <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>, <i>Piabucus    melanostomus</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>,    <i>Stethaprion erythrops</i>, and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>. Some trees:    Paralleled in node 261 and in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Bony    hooks on fin rays (307): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in the Gymnocharacinae,    in nodes 283, 297, and 301, and in <i>Astyanax paris</i>, <i>Bryconamericus    mennii</i>, <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus    kyburzi</i>, and <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania    nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Paragoniates alburnus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Position    of sphenotic spine relative to the orbit (12): (1 &gt; 0) bordering orbit posteriorly    and aligned with anterior border of fourth and fifth infraorbitals. Reversal    of synapomorphy 1 of node 193.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Development    of medial lamella of coracoid (238): (0 &gt; 1) expanded as a keel. Paralleled    in nodes 170 and 302 and in <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of branched pelvic-fin rays (258): (0 &gt; 1) seven or more. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of the Aphyocharacinae. Paralleled in <i>Aphyocharax dentatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Scales    covering anal-fin base (327): (0 &gt; 1) several rows covering basal third of    anal fin. Paralleled in the Serrasalmidae, in nodes 210 and 221, and in <i>Bario    steindachneri</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>,    <i>Roeboides microlepis</i>, and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 209: (100    / 100 / 100 / 100)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Leptagoniates</i>?,    <i>Phenagoniates</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The close relationship    between <i>Phenagoniates</i> and <i>Xenagoniates</i> was previously proposed    by Quevedo (2006). Probably <i>Leptagoniates</i> is also related with this clade,    and some of these synapomorphies actually correspond to a more inclusive clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventral    margin of toothed region of maxilla (95): (0 &gt; 1) strongly concave.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Margins    of toothed region of maxilla (96): (0 &gt; 1) dorsally divergent. Paralleled    in nodes 162, 254, and 282 and in <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i> and <i>Rhoadsia    altipinna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Medial    anteroventral notch of dentary (114): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in <i>Iguanodectes    geisleri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Longitudinal    ridge in quadrate bordering <i>adductor mandibulae</i> muscle ventrally and,    to some degree, laterally (152): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae    and in node 252.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Total    number of vertebrae (227): (0 &gt; 1) 41 or more. Reversal of synapomorphy 11    of node 205.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Longitudinal    position of insertion of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> tendon on dentary (330):    (0 &gt; 1) on vertical through middle or anterior half of Meckelian cartilage.    Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in nodes 184, 186, 241, 261, and 270, and    in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i> and <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    line (91): (1 &gt; 0) complete.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Horizontal    process of anguloarticular (108): (0 &gt; 1) broadly covered by dentary which    reaches posterior border of Meckelian cartilage. Reversal of synapomorphy 1    of node 206. Paralleled in nodes 246, 253, and 261.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Ventral    margin of horizontal process of anguloarticular (109): (0 &gt; 1) perpendicular    to laterosensory canal of dentary from medial view. Reversal of synapomorphy    1 of <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Ectopterygoid    teeth row (159): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes 168 and 300 and in    <i>Acestrorhynchus pantaneiro</i>, <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>, <i>Hoplias</i>    cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, and <i>Serrasalmus maculatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Bony    lamellae between second and third basibranchials (184): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled    in the Serrasalmidae and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Jupiaba    scologaster</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>,    and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (235): (0 &gt; 1) with markedly concave margin, almost forming    straight angle. Paralleled in nodes 162, 247, and 253 and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Characidium borellii</i>, <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>,    <i>Moenkhausia</i> cf. <i>intermedia</i>, and <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Process    of scapula forming anterior border of scapular foramen (244): (1 &gt; 0) present.    Reversal of synapomorphy 9 of node 193.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Third    postcleithrum (249): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae,    in node 302, and in <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>,    and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Position    of last supraneural (283): (0 &gt; 1) located more than two vertebrae in front    of first dorsal pterygiophore. Paralleled in nodes 174 and 244 and in <i>Engraulisoma    taeniatum</i> and <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Insertion    of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> tendon on dentary (331): (0 &gt; 1) anterior to    Meckelian cartilage. Paralleled in nodes 183, 186, and 253.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Phenagoniates macrolepis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Position    of opening on neurocranium communicating with laterosensory canal of sixth infraorbital    (77): (1 &gt; 0) between frontal and pterotic. Reversal of synapomorphy 6 of    node 193.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> <i>Circulii</i>    on posterior field of scales (319): (1 &gt; 0) present. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 206. Paralleled in node 261 and in <i>Exodon paradoxus</i> and <i>Roeboides    microlepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> <i>Radii</i>    on scales (320): (1 &gt; 0) absent or reduced in number. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae    and Serrasalminae, in node 174, and in <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>, <i>Distichodus    maculatus</i>, and <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Adipose    fin (356): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gymnocharacinae, in node 181,    and in <i>Carnegiella strigata</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 234: (100    / 100 / 27 / 21)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Subfamilies Aphyoditeinae    and Cheirodontinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">G&eacute;ry (1965a)    proposed the tribe Aphyoditeini, as part of the Cheirodontidi (=Cheirodontinae),    in which he later (G&eacute;ry, 1973) included a group of small species with    only one row of conical or tricuspid premaxillary teeth. This group was composed    of <i>Aphyocharacidium</i>, <i>Aphyodite</i> Eigenmann, <i>Axelrodia</i> G&eacute;ry,    <i>Brittanichthys</i> G&eacute;ry, <i>Macropsobrycon</i> Eigenmann, <i>Microschemobrycon</i>,    <i>Thrissobrycon</i> B&ouml;hlke, and <i>Tyttobrycon</i>. G&eacute;ry (1977)    included in his "Cheirodontinae and allied genera" a group of "Cheirodontinae    <i>sensu stricto</i>" and several groups of genera supposedly related with Cheirodontinae;    among them, G&eacute;ry (1977) included an <i>Aphyodite</i> group or Aphyoditeina,    composed of the same genera listed by G&eacute;ry (1973) in addition to <i>Atopomesus</i>    Myers, <i>Leptobrycon</i> Eigenmann, 
<i>Oligobrycon</i> Eigenmann, <i>Oxybrycon</i>    G&eacute;ry, <i>Paracheirodon</i>, <i>Parecbasis</i> Eigenmann, and <i>Prodontocharax</i>    Eigenmann &amp; Pearson. The genera <i>Macropsobrycon</i> and <i>Prodontocharax</i>    were included in Cheirodontinae by Malabarba (1998a), which considered the remaining    genera of the Aphyoditeina as not included in the Cheirodontinae, becoming <i>incertae    sedis</i> within the Characidae. That classification was retained by Lima <i>et    al</i>. (2003). A close relationship between the Aphyoditeinae and Cheirodontinae    was proposed several times in the literature, but never in a phylogenetic context.    The subfamily Aphyoditeinae was not phylogenetically diagnosed. Although a more    detailed study is necessary, it is resurrected as the sister group of the Cheirodontinae,    containing, at least, the genera <i>Aphyocharacidium</i>, <i>Aphyodite</i>,    <i>Axelrodia</i>, <i>Microschemobrycon</i>, and <i>Parecbasis</i>, included    in 
this analysis.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Form    of mesethmoid spine (27): (0 &gt; 1) relatively short, with premaxillae articulating    with each other anterior to mesethmoid. Paralleled in node 225 and in <i>Chalceus    macrolepidotus</i> and <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Length    of maxilla relative to dentary (100): (0 &gt; 1) maxilla not reaching posterior    end of Meckelian cartilage. Paralleled in node 245. Reversed in <i>Odontostilbe    pequira</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Pseudotympanum    limited by first pleural rib, <i>lateralis superficialis</i>, second pleural    rib, <i>obliquus inferioris</i>, and <i>obliquus superioris</i> (339): (0 &gt;    1) present. Paralleled in <i>Characidium rachovii</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in node 295.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 257: Aphyoditeinae    (100 / 100 / 60 / 19)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Aphyocharacidium</i>,    <i>Aphyodite</i>, <i>Axelrodia</i>, <i>Leptobrycon</i>?, <i>Microschemobrycon</i>,    <i>Oxybrycon</i>?, <i>Parecbasis</i>, and <i>Tyttobrycon</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">As mentioned above,    this is the first published phylogenetic diagnosis of the Aphyoditeinae. According    to G&eacute;ry (1977) both <i>Atopomesus pachyodus</i> Myers and <i>Oligobrycon    microstomus</i> Eigenmann have strong teeth, which are not compressed anteroposteriorly    and the former genus has seven premaxillary teeth, while the latter has only    four. Both genera are considered here as <i>incertae sedis</i> within the Characidae.    The genus <i>Leptobrycon</i> has numerous premaxillary teeth (14) (G&eacute;ry,    1977), and it is included tentatively in this clade pending further studies.    According to G&eacute;ry (1977), <i>Oxybrycon</i> has two rows of dentary teeth,    as does the aphyoditein <i>Aphyocharacidium</i>. This character state is unique    to these species among the characids without a supraorbital bone, being interpreted    herein as a potential synapomorphy of a clade containing 
<i>Aphyocharacidium</i>    and <i>Oxybrycon</i>. <i>Leptobrycon</i> and <i>Oxybrycon</i> have a long maxilla    that reaches the posterior end of Meckelian cartilage and differ in that from    the species included in the Aphyoditeinae or Cheirodontinae. This character    state, however, could be a synapomorphy of these two genera. Given the available    information, <i>Leptobrycon</i> and <i>Oxybrycon</i> are tentatively included    in the Aphyoditeinae. The species of <i>Tyttobrycon</i> look like the Aphyoditeinae,    with a very short maxilla not reaching the posterior end of the Meckelian cartilage    (with the exception of <i>T</i>. <i>xeruini</i> G&eacute;ry) (G&eacute;ry, 1973),    and they have eight or nine premaxillary teeth (excepting <i>T</i>. <i>dorsimaculatus</i>    G&eacute;ry, with six or seven). This genus is also included in the Aphyoditeinae    at least provisionally. All the genera of Aphyoditeinae lack phylogenetic diagnoses    and their monophyly was not tested, 
but they are herein treated provisionally    as monophyletic.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Dorsal    margin of lateral ethmoids (16): (1 &gt; 0) aligned. Reversal of synapomorphy    1 of node 198. Paralleled in <i>Nematobrycon palmeri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Canal    of lateral line on caudal-fin membrane (92): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of the Characidae. Paralleled in the <i>Bryconops</i> clade,    in nodes 227, 229, 244, 287, 294, and 298, and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>,    <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i>, <i>Charax stenopterus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon anisitsi</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster    tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of teeth in inner premaxillary row (130): (0 &gt; 1) eight or more. Paralleled    in node 170, and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, <i>Phenacogaster    tegatus</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>, and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Size    and number of anterior dentary teeth (142): (0 &gt; 1) eight or more small and    slender teeth at front of dentary. Paralleled in <i>Charax stenopterus</i> and    <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of supraneurals (280): (1 &gt; 0) four or fewer. Paralleled in in nodes 211,    223, and 262 and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon bifasciatus</i>, and <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>. Some trees:    Reversed in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (53): (1 &gt; 0) extends posteriorly to, at least, middle    length of neural complex of Weberian apparatus. Paralleled in node 207 and in    <i>Odontostilbe paraguayensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Lateral    coverage of dilator fossa by sixth infraorbital (69): (1 &gt; 0) almost complete,    at least in its ventral border. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 197. Paralleled    in node 232.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Dorsal    end of laterosensory canal of preopercle and suprapreopercle (82): (0 &gt; 1)    overlapping anterodorsal process of opercle. Paralleled in the Alestidae, in    node 230, and in <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon eques</i>, <i>Pristella    maxillaris</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Lateral    ridge of anguloarticular (107): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the Cheirodontinae,    in node 191, and in <i>Aphyocharacidium bolivianum</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Maxillary    teeth (134): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Coptobrycon    bilineatus</i>, <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i> and <i>Psellogrammus    kennedyi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Relative    length of palatine (172): (1 &gt; 0) approximately one-half length of ectopterygoid,    or less. Reversal of synapomorphy 4 of node 197. Paralleled in node 255 and    in <i>Acrobrycon tarijae</i>, <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus    bergii</i>, and <i>Piabina argentea</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (0 &gt; 1) two. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 179. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in node 280, and in <i>Brycon    orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Cheirodon    interruptus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>,    <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>, <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 249 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (195): (1 &gt; 0)    16 or more. Paralleled in nodes 177 and 183 and in <i>Astyanax latens</i>, <i>A</i>.    cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>A</i>. <i>pelegrini</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon socolofi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia dichroura</i>, <i>Piaractus mesopotamicus</i>,    and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Laminar    bony ridge on dorsal margin of abdominal ribs (224): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled    in node 297 and in <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Transitional    vertebrae with haemal canal (229): (1 &gt; 0) present. Reversal of synapomorphy    6 of node 195. Paralleled in <i>Serrapinnus calliurus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Relative    position of dorsal-fin anterior insertion (265): (1 &gt; 0) anterior to or at    vertical through pelvic-fin origin. Paralleled in node 282 and in <i>Creagrutus    anary</i>, <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>, and <i>Moenkhausia xinguensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Bony    lamellae associated with supraneurals (282): (0 &gt; 1) wider than primary axis    of supraneurals. Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node 197. Paralleled in <i>Prodontocharax    melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Number    of maxillary teeth (135): (1 &gt; 0) only one, or absent. (k9-12). Paralleled    in the <i>Astyanax</i> clade, in nodes 284 and 290, and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>,    <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>, <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    bifasciatus</i>, and <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    <i>Hasemania nana</i> and <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>14.</b> Development    of transverse process of neural arch of third vertebra (219): (0 &gt; 1) well    developed and extending beyond anterior margin of tripus. (k13-14). Paralleled    in node 302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>, <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>,    <i>Deuterodon langei</i>, <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf.    <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>, and <i>Thayeria obliqua</i>. Some    trees: Paralleled in <i>Microschemobrycon casiquiare</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Microschemobrycon casiquiare</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Epiphyseal    branch of supraorbital canal (84): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Stevardiinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Contact    between ectopterygoid and anterodorsal region of quadrate (162): (0 &gt; 1)    absent. (k9-12). Paralleled in nodes 184 and 242, and in <i>Aphyocharax dentatus</i>,    <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>, and <i>Stichonodon    insignis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in the Cheirodontinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Development    of transverse process of neural arch of third vertebra (219): (0 &gt; 1) well    developed and extending beyond anterior margin of tripus. (k 13-14). Paralleled    in node 302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>, <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>,    <i>Deuterodon langei</i>, <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf.    <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>, and <i>Thayeria obliqua</i>. Some    trees: Paralleled in <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> <i>Radii</i>    of scales (322): (0 &gt; 1) converging at focus. (k9-12). Reversal of synapomorphy    7 of the Characidae. Paralleled in node 273 and in <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>    and <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Contact    between frontals anteriorly to frontal fontanel (21): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled    in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i> and <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (0 &gt; 1) not reaching horizontal arm of    preopercle, at least anteriorly. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 198. Paralleled    in nodes 280 and 298 and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>, <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>,    and <i>Creagrutus</i> cf. <i>tahorni</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Fourth    infraorbital (66): (0 &gt; 1) absent or much reduced and bordered posteriorly    by third and fifth infraorbitals. Paralleled in the Aphyocharacinae and Gasteropelecidae,    in node 186, and in <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Hemigrammus erythrozonus</i>,    <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>, and <i>Nematobrycon    palmeri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Process    of scapula forming anterior border of scapular foramen (244): (0 &gt; 1) absent.    Paralleled in nodes 193 and 252 and in <i>Deuterodon langei</i>, <i>Hoplias</i>    cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon herbertaxelrodi</i>, <i>Leporinus    striatus</i>, <i>Odontostilbe paraguayensis</i>, and <i>Thayeria obliqua</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Posterior    attachment of A1 section of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> (332): (0 &gt; 1) restricted    or almost restricted to horizontal arm of preopercle. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae,    in node 211, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i> and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Length    of sphenotic spine (10): (0 &gt; 1) extending ventrally to articulation between    sphenotic and hyomandibula. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 197. Paralleled    in <i>Creagrutus anary</i> and <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Number    of cusps of anterior maxillary teeth (138): (1 &gt; 0) conical, a single cusp.    Paralleled in <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Axelrodia    lindeae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Number    of supraneurals (280): (0 &gt; 1) five or more. Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of    the Aphyoditeinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 256: (100    / 100 / 60 / 21)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Aphyocharacidium</i>,    <i>Axelrodia</i>, <i>Leptobrycon</i>?, <i>Oxybrycon</i>? and <i>Tyttobrycon</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Although the monophyly    and relationships of the Aphyoditeinae are well supported in the present analysis,    the internal relationships of this subfamily are poorly resolved. The only obtained    sister-group relationship within this subfamily is that between <i>Aphyocharacidium    bolivianum</i> and <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Anterior    portions of branchiostegal rays (214): (0 &gt; 1) slender near their articulation    with ceratohyals. Paralleled in node 212 and in <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Large    foramen on pterosphenoid (43): (0 &gt; 1) present, well developed. (k9-12).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Form    of fourth infraorbital (67): (0 &gt; 1) longer dorsoventrally than longitudinally.    (k13-14). Reversal of synapomorphy 1 node 200. Paralleled in node 266. Some    trees: Paralleled in node 233.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Contact    between frontals anteriorly to frontal fontanel (21): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled    in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i> and <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (0 &gt; 1) not reaching horizontal arm of    preopercle, at least anteriorly. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 198. Paralleled    in nodes 280 and 298 and in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>, <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>,    and <i>Creagrutus</i> cf. <i>tahorni</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Morphology    of premaxillary, maxillary, and dentary teeth (118): (1 &gt; 0) all teeth conical,    caniniform or mamilliform. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae, in nodes 174,    181, and 211, and in <i>Grundulus cochae</i> and <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Position    of anterior teeth of dentary (146): (0 &gt; 1) internally situated with dentary    forming anterior ridge.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Bony    lamellae between second and third basibranchials (184): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled    in the Serrasalmidae and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>,    <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Jupiaba scologaster</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>,    <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates    bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Bony    lamella dorsal to fourth basibranchial (185): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of node 203. Paralleled in node 296 and in <i>Gymnocharacinus    bergii</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Mimagoniates rheocharis</i>,    <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>, <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>, and <i>Prodontocharax    melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Denticles    on gill rakers (201): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gymnocharacinae,    in nodes 245 and 253, and in <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i> and <i>H</i>. <i>herbertaxelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Shape    of dentigerous plate of fifth ceratobranchial (204): (1 &gt; 0) rounded, with    posterior notch. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae and in node 252.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Number    of branched pelvic-fin rays (258): (1 &gt; 0) six or less. Paralleled in the    Aphyocharacinae, in nodes 220, 236, 280, and 302, and in <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>,    <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax    goethei</i>, and <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    <i>Hasemania nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Ventral    procurrent caudal-fin rays of adult males (301): (0 &gt; 1) laminar. Paralleled    in node 229.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Ventral    procurrent caudal-fin rays of adult males (303): (0 &gt; 1) projecting ventrally    through peduncle musculature and skin. Paralleled in node 229 and in <i>Hoplocharax    goethei</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Bony    hooks on last pelvic-fin ray of adult males (314): (0 &gt; 1) as numerous as    in other rays. Paralleled in nodes 232, 240, 258, and 299.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Number    of cusps of anterior maxillary teeth (138): (1 &gt; 0) conical, a single cusp.    (k9-12). Paralleled in <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>14.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on second ceratobranchial (193): (1 &gt; 0) one. (k13-14). Paralleled    in nodes 238 and 253 and in <i>Bryconamericus exodon</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Aphyocharacidium bolivianum</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    ridge of anguloarticular (107): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the Cheirodontinae,    in node 191, and in <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Inner    row of dentary teeth (143): (1 &gt; 0) present. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of    node 189. Paralleled in the Heterocharacinae and in node 276.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Bony    hooks on first pelvic-fin ray of adult males (315): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled    in node 274 and in <i>Aphyocharax anisitsi</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>,    and <i>Nantis indefessus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Anterior    convergence of ventral diverging lamellae with nasal septum of mesethmoid (31):    (0 &gt; 1) confluent at posterior end of nasal septum. (k13-14).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 233: Cheirodontinae    (100 / 100 / 75 / 41)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acinocheirodon</i>    Malabarba &amp; Weitzman, <i>Amazonspinther</i>, <i>Aphyocheirodon</i> Eigenmann,    <i>Cheirodon</i>, <i>Cheirodontops</i> Schultz, <i>Compsura</i> Eigenmann, <i>Heterocheirodon</i>,    <i>Kolpotocheirodon</i> Malabarba &amp; Weitzman, <i>Macropsobrycon</i>, <sup>&#8224;</sup><i>Megacheirodon</i>,    <i>Nanocheirodon</i>, <i>Odontostilbe</i>, <i>Prodontocharax</i>, <i>Pseudocheirodon</i>    Meek &amp; Hildebrand, <i>Saccoderma</i> Schultz, <i>Serrapinnus</i>, and <i>Spintherobolus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The Cheirodontinae    is maybe the best studied subfamily of the Characidae. Its monophyly was cladistically    proposed by Malabarba (1998a), supported by the presence of a pseudotympanum    between the anterior two ribs, the absence of a humeral spot, the presence of    distally expanded teeth with narrow base, and the presence of only one row of    premaxillary teeth, which are aligned each other and have similar shapes. The    monophyly of this subfamily was corroborated in the unpublished thesis of B&uuml;hrnheim    (2006). Thus, testing the monophyly of this clade is not a primary objective    of this paper, and a relatively small sample of the species in this subfamily    was included. The composition of this subfamily follows Malabarba (1998a), B&uuml;hrnheim    (2006), and B&uuml;hrnheim <i>et al</i>. (2008).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    ridge of anguloarticular (107): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in in node 191    and in <i>Aphyocharacidium bolivianum</i> and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Abrupt    posterior expansion of interopercle (164): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in    <i>Apareiodon affinis</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Relative    length of first pelvic-fin ray of adult males (257): (0 &gt; 1) extending beyond    margin of other rays. Reversed in node 229.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Form    of fourth infraorbital (67): (0 &gt; 1) longer dorsoventrally than longitudinally.    (k13-14). Reversal of synapomorphy 1 node 200. Paralleled in node 266. Some    trees: Paralleled in node 256.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Contact    between ectopterygoid and anterodorsal region of quadrate (162): (0 &gt; 1)    absent. (some trees under k9-14). Paralleled in nodes 184 and 242, and in <i>Aphyocharax    dentatus</i>, <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>,    and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Microschemobrycon    casiquiare</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (196): (1 &gt; 0)    11 or more. (k13-14). Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node 196. Paralleled in    node 237 and in <i>Bryconamericus</i> cf. <i>exodon</i> and <i>B</i>. cf. <i>iheringii</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Margins    of toothed region of maxilla (96): (0 &gt; 1) dorsally divergent. Paralleled    in nodes 162, 209, 254, and 282 and in <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Extent    of implantation of teeth along maxilla (137): (0 &gt; 1) extending across almost    entire maxillary lamella. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 202. Paralleled    in node 208 and in <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, <i>Hemibrycon surinamensis</i>,    and <i>Nematobrycon palmeri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Orientation    of anterior dentary teeth (141): (0 &gt; 1) oriented anteriorly, almost parallel    to main axis of dentary. Paralleled in node 225.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Bony    lamella dorsal to fourth basibranchial (185): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of node 203. Paralleled in node 296 and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Mimagoniates    rheocharis</i>, <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>, and <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Form    of anterior expansion of basihyal (191): (0 &gt; 1) expanded, with anterior    margin with two-thirds or more of its length. Paralleled in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>,    <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>, and <i>Thayeria obliqua</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (0 &gt; 1) two. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 179. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in node 280, and in <i>Brycon    orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Cheirodon    interruptus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>,    <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>, <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 249 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Bony    lamellae associated with supraneurals (282): (0 &gt; 1) wider than primary axis    of supraneurals. Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node 197. Paralleled in <i>Parecbasis    cyclolepis.</i></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (287): (1 &gt; 0) 17 or less. Reversal of synapomorphy    6 of the Characoidea. Paralleled in the Alestidae, in nodes 280 and 290, and    in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Contact    between dorsal margin of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> and ventral margin of <i>dilator    operculi</i> (335): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in <i>Creagrutus anary</i>,    <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>,    <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 232: (100    / 100 / 61 / 18)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acinocheirodon</i>?,    <i>Amazonspinther</i>?, <i>Aphyocheirodon</i>?, <i>Cheirodon</i>, <i>Cheirodontops</i>?,    <i>Compsura</i>?, <i>Heterocheirodon</i>?, <i>Kolpotocheirodon</i>?, <i>Macropsobrycon</i>?,    <sup>&#8224;</sup><i>Megacheirodon</i>?, <i>Nanocheirodon</i>?, <i>Odontostilbe</i>,    <i>Pseudocheirodon</i>?, <i>Saccoderma</i>?, <i>Serrapinnus</i>, and <i>Spintherobolus</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Prodontocharax</i>    is the sister group of the remaining Cheirodontinae according to the present    analysis, which is in agreement with the hypothesis of Malabarba (1998a). However,    it is probable that some of the synapomorphies found for this node actually    correspond to a more inclusive clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    coverage of dilator fossa by sixth infraorbital (69): (1 &gt; 0) almost complete,    at least in its ventral border. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 197. Paralleled    in <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>. Reversed in <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Expansion    of lamellar portion of maxilla just posterior to toothed region (97): (0 &gt;    1) very pronounced. Paralleled in <i>Deuterodon langei</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Premaxillary,    maxillary, and dentary teeth (119): (0 &gt; 1) pedunculate and uniformly shaped.    Paralleled in <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i> and <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of maxillary teeth (136): (1 &gt; 0) up to three. Reversal of synapomorphy 8    of node 205. Paralleled in node 246 and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Last    unbranched dorsal-fin ray of adult males (269): (0 &gt; 1) distinctly longer    than first branched ray and in the form of filament. Reversed in node 229.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Bony    hooks on last pelvic-fin ray of adult males (314): (0 &gt; 1) as numerous as    in other rays. Paralleled in nodes 240, 258, and 299 and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Odontostilbe pequira</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of maxilla relative to dentary (100): (1 &gt; 0) maxilla reaching posterior    end of Meckelian cartilage. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 234.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 231: (90    / 99 / 7 / 32)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acinocheirodon</i>?,    <i>Amazonspinther</i>?, <i>Aphyocheirodon</i>?, <i>Cheirodon</i>, <i>Cheirodontops</i>?,    <i>Compsura</i>?, <i>Heterocheirodon</i>?, <i>Kolpotocheirodon</i>?, <i>Macropsobrycon</i>?,    <sup>&#8224;</sup><i>Megacheirodon</i>?, <i>Nanocheirodon</i>?, <i>Pseudocheirodon</i>?,    <i>Saccoderma</i>?, <i>Serrapinnus</i>, and <i>Spintherobolus</i>?; <i>Odontostilbe    microcephala</i>, <i>O</i>. <i>paraguayensis</i>, and other <i>Odontostilbe</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Foramen    on articular condyle of quadrate (149): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in nodes    168 and 211 and in <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    eques</i>, and <i>Lonchogenys ilisha</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of notches along ventral border of anterior ceratohyal (180): (0 &gt; 1) three.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Laterosensory    canal of sixth infraorbital (76): (0 &gt; 1) branched. Reversal of synapomorphy    2 of node 203. Paralleled in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, <i>Oligosarcus</i>    cf. <i>jenynsii</i>, and <i>Tetragonopterus argenteus</i> .</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Cartilages    anterior to basihyal (188): (0 &gt; 1) two well developed blocks of cartilage.    Paralleled in nodes 244 and 299 and in <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    bifasciatus</i>, <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>, and <i>Roeboides descalvadensis</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in node 265.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (0 &gt; 1) two. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 179. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in node 280, and in <i>Brycon    orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Cheirodon    interruptus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>,    <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 249 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 230: (90    / 98 / - / 100)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acinocheirodon</i>?,    <i>Amazonspinther</i>?, <i>Aphyocheirodon</i>?, <i>Cheirodon</i>, <i>Cheirodontops</i>?,    <i>Compsura</i>?, <i>Heterocheirodon</i>?, <i>Kolpotocheirodon</i>?, <i>Macropsobrycon</i>?,    <sup>&#8224;</sup><i>Megacheirodon</i>?, <i>Nanocheirodon</i>?, <i>Pseudocheirodon</i>?,    <i>Saccoderma</i>?, <i>Serrapinnus</i>, and <i>Spintherobolus</i>?; <i>Odontostilbe    paraguayensis</i> and other <i>Odontostilbe</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphy:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Dorsal    end of laterosensory canal of preopercle and suprapreopercle (82): (0 &gt; 1)    overlapping anterodorsal process of opercle. Paralleled in the Alestidae and    in <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon eques</i>, <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>,    <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Odontostilbe paraguayensis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of supraoccipital spine (53): (1 &gt; 0) extends posteriorly to, at least, middle    length of neural complex of Weberian apparatus. Paralleled in node 207 and in    <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Process    of scapula forming anterior border of scapular foramen (244): (0 &gt; 1) absent.    Paralleled in nodes 193 and 252 and in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>, <i>Deuterodon    langei</i>, <i>Hoplias</i> cf. <i>malabaricus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon herbertaxelrodi</i>,    <i>Leporinus striatus</i>, and <i>Thayeria obliqua</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 229: (100    / 100 / 93 / 29)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acinocheirodon</i>?,    <i>Amazonspinther</i>, <i>Cheirodon</i>, <i>Compsura</i>?, <i>Heterocheirodon</i>,    <i>Kolpotocheirodon</i>?, <i>Macropsobrycon</i>?, <sup>&#8224;</sup><i>Megacheirodon</i>,    <i>Nanocheirodon</i>, <i>Saccoderma</i>?, <i>Serrapinnus</i>, and <i>Spintherobolus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The genera <i>Cheirodon</i>    and <i>Serrapinnus</i> were included in the tribe Cheirodontini by Malabarba    (1998a), along with <i>Heterocheirodon</i>, <sup>&#8224;</sup><i>Megacheirodon</i>,    <i>Nanocheirodon</i>, and <i>Spintherobolus</i>. The genera <i>Acinocheirodon</i>    and <i>Kolpotocheirodon</i> were described posteriorly to that paper (Malabarba    &amp; Weitzman, 1999, 2000) and these two genera were included in the tribe    Compsurini. As the relationships between the Compsurini and the Cheirodontini    are unresolved (Malabarba, 1998a) the species of the Compsurini are included    with question marks. The genus <i>Amazonspinther</i> is the sister group of    <i>Spintherobolus</i>, forming a clade supported by 15 synapomorphies (B&uuml;hrnheim    <i>et al</i>., 2008); indeed it was originally treated as a species of this    genus (B&uuml;hrnheim, 2006). Both <i>Amazonspinther</i> and 
<i>Spintherobolus</i>    are included in Cheirodontini according to B&uuml;hrnheim <i>et al</i>. (2008),    and they are listed in this clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    line (91): (0 &gt; 1) interrupted. Paralleled in nodes 227, 279, 288, and 294    and in <i>Characidium rachovii</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    anisitsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>,    and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Canal    of lateral line on caudal-fin membrane (92): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of the Characidae. Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae and <i>Bryconops</i>    clade, in nodes 227, 244, 287, 294, and 298, and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>,    <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i>, <i>Charax stenopterus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon anisitsi</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster    tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Relative    length of first pelvic-fin ray of adult males (257): (1 &gt; 0) not extending    beyond margin of other rays. Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of the Cheirodontinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Last    unbranched dorsal-fin ray of adult males (269): (1 &gt; 0) approximately as    long as first branched ray. Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node 232.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Ventral    procurrent caudal-fin rays of adult males (301): (0 &gt; 1) laminar. Paralleled    in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Number    of ventral procurrent caudal-fin rays (302): (0 &gt; 1) 12 or more. Paralleled    in the <i>Bryconops</i> clade, in node 252, and in <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Ventral    procurrent caudal-fin rays of adult males (303): (0 &gt; 1) projecting ventrally    through peduncle musculature and skin. Paralleled in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>    and <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Bony    hooks on base of pelvic-fin rays of adult males (313): (0 &gt; 1) as numerous    as on segmented portion of rays. Paralleled in <i>Aphyocharax anisitsi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Serrapinnus calliurus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Transitional    vertebrae with haemal canal (229): (1 &gt; 0) present. Reversal of synapomorphy    6 of node 195. Paralleled in <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Form    and length of anterior anal-fin rays (290): (0 &gt; 1) longer and more compressed    laterally than posterior rays.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Position    of anal-fin bony hooks of adult males (316): (0 &gt; 1) medially positioned    and oriented posteriorly.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Lateral    coverage of dilator fossa by sixth infraorbital (69): (0 &gt; 1) leaving a conspicuous    naked area in anterior region of dilator fossa. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of    the Cheirodontinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of maxillary teeth (135): (1 &gt; 0) only one, or absent. Paralleled in the    <i>Astyanax</i> clade, in nodes 284 and 290, and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>,    <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon bifasciatus</i>, and <i>Iguanodectes    geisleri</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Paracheirodon    axelrodi</i>, and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (0 &gt; 1) two. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 179. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in node 280, and in <i>Brycon    orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Hoplocharax    goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>,    <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon    vulpinus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 249 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (234): (1 &gt; 0) without concavity ventral to first postcleithrum.    Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 196. Paralleled in node 298 and in <i>Inpaichthys    kerri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of branched pelvic-fin rays (258): (1 &gt; 0) six or less. Paralleled in the    Aphyocharacinae, in nodes 220, 236, 280, and 302, and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax    goethei</i>, and <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    <i>Hasemania nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 243: Stevardiinae    (74 / 97 / 43 / 9)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acrobrycon</i>    Eigenmann &amp; Pearson, <i>Argopleura</i>, <i>Attonitus</i>, <i>Aulixidens</i>,    <i>Boehlkea</i>?, <i>Bryconacidnus</i>?, <i>Bryconadenos</i>?, <i>Bryconamericus</i>,    <i>Caiapobrycon</i>?, <i>Ceratobranchia</i> ?, <i>Chrysobrycon</i> Weitzman    &amp; Menezes, <i>Corynopoma</i> Gill, <i>Creagrutus</i>, <i>Cyanocharax</i>,    <i>Diapoma</i>, <i>Gephyrocharax</i> Eigenmann, <i>Glandulocauda</i>, <i>Hemibrycon</i>,    <i>Hypobrycon</i>?, <i>Hysteronotus</i> Eigenmann, <i>Iotabrycon</i> Roberts,    <i>Knodus</i>, <i>Landonia</i> Eigenmann &amp; Henn, <i>Lophiobrycon</i>, <i>Microgenys</i>?,    <i>Mimagoniates</i>, <i>Monotocheirodon</i>?, <i>Nantis</i>, <i>Odontostoechus</i>,    <i>Othonocheirodus</i>?, <i>Phallobrycon</i>?, <i>Phenacobrycon</i> Eigenmann,    <i>Piabarchus</i>?, <i>Piabina</i>, <i>Planaltina</i> B&ouml;hlke, <i>Pseudocorynopoma</i>,    <i>Pterobrycon</i> Eigenmann, 
<i>Ptychocharax</i> Weitzman, Fink, Machado-Allison    &amp; Royero, <i>Rhinobrycon</i>?, <i>Rhinopetitia</i>?, <i>Scopaeocharax</i>    Weitzman &amp; Fink, <i>Tyttocharax</i> Fowler, and <i>Xenurobrycon</i> Myers    &amp; Miranda Ribeiro.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">G&eacute;ry (1977)    included in his tribe Tetragonopterini a group named <i>Hemibrycon</i> and allied    genera, based on the presence of only four teeth in the inner premaxillary row.    G&eacute;ry mentioned that this character is usually associated with a great    development of the third supraorbital, which reaches the horizontal arm of the    preopercle. This group was composed of <i>Boehlkea</i>, <i>Bryconacidnus</i>,    <i>Bryconamericus</i>, <i>Carlastyanax</i>, <i>Ceratobranchia</i>, <i>Coptobrycon</i>,    <i>Creagrudite</i>, <i>Hemibrycon</i>, <i>Knodus</i>, <i>Microgenys</i>, <i>Nematobrycon</i>,    <i>Piabarchus</i>, <i>Rhinobrycon</i>, and <i>Rhinopetitia</i>. All these genera    were classified as <i>incertae sedis</i> within the Characidae by Lima <i>et    al</i>. (2003). Malabarba &amp; Weitzman (2003) observed that most species of    these genera also share the possession of only eight branched 
dorsal-fin rays.    Those authors proposed a putatively monophyletic clade (their clade A) which    comprised the members of the Glandulocaudinae of Weitzman (2003) and the <i>incertae    sedis</i> genera <i>Attonitus</i>, <i>Boehlkea</i>, <i>Bryconacidnus</i>, <i>Bryconamericus</i>,    <i>Caiapobrycon</i>, <i>Ceratobranchia</i>, <i>Creagrutus</i>, <i>Cyanocharax</i>,    <i>Hemibrycon</i>, <i>Hypobrycon</i>, <i>Knodus</i>, <i>Microgenys</i>, <i>Monotocheirodon</i>,    <i>Odontostoechus</i>, <i>Othonocheirodus</i>, <i>Piabarchus</i>, <i>Piabina</i>,    <i>Rhinobrycon</i>, and <i>Rhinopetitia</i>. Weitzman <i>et al</i>. (2005) later    described <i>Bryconadenos</i> within this clade, and split the glandulocaudin    characids into the subfamilies Glandulocaudinae and Stevardiinae. Ruiz-C. &amp;    Rom&aacute;n-Valencia (2006) subsequently synonymized <i>Carlastyanax</i> with    <i>Astyanax</i>. This clade appears as monophyletic in the molecular phylogeny    of Calcagnotto <i>et al</i>. 
(2005), as composed of the genera <i>Bryconamericus</i>,    <i>Creagrutus</i>, <i>Gephyrocharax</i>, <i>Hemibrycon</i>, <i>Knodus</i>, and    <i>Mimagoniates</i>. In the present hypothesis this node includes <i>Aulixidens</i>    and <i>Nantis</i>, along with the analyzed genera of the clade A of Malabarba    &amp; Weitzman (2003). The genus <i>Nantis</i> was described after Malabarba    &amp; Weitzman (2003) and in its description some similarities with members    of the clade A were mentioned. These include the sharing of only eight branched    dorsal-fin rays, but <i>Nantis</i> was considered as <i>incertae sedis</i> because    of the possession of five teeth in the inner premaxillary row, instead of four    (Mirande <i>et al</i>., 2004; 2006a). <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i> was examined    by Malabarba &amp; Weitzman (2003), who observed nine branched dorsal-fin rays    in this species, differing from the eight rays herein observed. <i>Aulixidens    eugeniae</i> is included in this 
clade even after coding that character as polymorphic    for the species. Most genera included in this subfamily lack phylogenetic diagnoses;    however all the genera are herein treated as monophyletic, considering the position    of their type-species. For example, according to the present analysis, <i>Bryconamericus</i>    is not monophyletic, and at least one of its species (<i>B</i>. <i>scleroparius</i>)    is excluded from the Stevardiinae; however, as <i>B</i>. <i>exodon</i>, its    type-species, is included in the Stevardiinae, this genus is considered as part    of it. The genera included in the clade A by Malabarba &amp; Weitzman (2003)    but not analyzed here are listed with question marks. All members of the former    subfamilies Glandulocaudinae and Stevardiinae are included in this clade because    these clades were phylogenetically treated (as the Glandulocaudinae) by Weitzman    &amp; Menezes (1998). The name Stevardiinae Eigenmann, 1909 is used for this    clade due 
to priority over Glandulocaudinae Eigenmann, 1914 and Hemibryconini    G&eacute;ry, 1966. Diapomini Eigenmann, 1909, although proposed in the same    year than Stevardiinae, was a subclade of Stevardiinae prior to Mirande (2009);    thus, the latter name is preferred for this clade. In this manner, the subfamily    Stevardiinae is herein redefined to include all the genera of the clade A of    Malabarba &amp; Weitzman (2003) plus <i>Aulixidens</i> and <i>Nantis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Epiphyseal    branch of supraorbital canal (84): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in <i>Microschemobrycon    casiquiare</i>. Reversed in node 253.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of branched-rays on dorsal-fin (270): (1 &gt; 0) eight or fewer. Paralleled    in <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, and <i>Piabucus    melanostomus</i>. Reversed in node 235.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of dorsal pterygiophores (276): (1 &gt; 0) nine. Paralleled in node 184 and    in <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i> and <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>. Reversed in    <i>Mimagoniates rheocharis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 255: (100    / 100 / 90 / 22)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Boehlkea</i>?    and <i>Hemibrycon</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    <i>Hemibrycon</i> was treated in the unpublished doctoral thesis of Bertaco    (2008) and this issue lies beyond the scope of this paper. The two species of    this genus form a monophyletic group that is the sister group of the remaining    members of the Stevardiinae. According to their traditional definitions, <i>Boehlkea</i>    (not analyzed here) is differentiated from <i>Hemibrycon</i> only in having    the caudal fin covered by scales. Given that this character is rather homoplastic    in this phylogeny, <i>Boehlkea</i> is potentially related or even included in    <i>Hemibrycon</i>, and tentatively listed in this clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Abrupt    decrease in size of dentary teeth (148): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in the    <i>Bryconops</i> clade, in nodes 222 and 299, and in <i>Astyanax latens</i>    and <i>A. paris</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Relative    length of palatine (172): (1 &gt; 0) approximately one-half length of ectopterygoid,    or less. Reversal of synapomorphy 4 of node 197. Paralleled in <i>Acrobrycon    tarijae</i>, <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Parecbasis    cyclolepis</i>, and <i>Piabina argentea</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Palatine    foramen (173): (0 &gt; 1) present and very conspicuous. Paralleled in <i>Acrobrycon    tarijae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (288): (0 &gt; 1) 25 or more. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 200. Paralleled in nodes 208 and 263 and in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>    and <i>Nematobrycon palmeri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Hemibrycon surinamensis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Extent    of implantation of teeth along maxilla (137): (0 &gt; 1) extending across almost    entire maxillary lamella. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 202. Paralleled    in node 208 and in <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, <i>Nematobrycon palmeri</i>, and    <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Hemibrycon dariensis</i>:</b></font></p>
