<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Number    of cusps of anterior maxillary teeth (139): (0 &gt; 1) five or more cusps. Paralleled    in the Rhoadsiinae, in nodes 273, 283, and 294, and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>,    <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    pulchripinnis</i>, and <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in node 246.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 242: (39    / 96 / 26 / 9)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acrobrycon</i>,    <i>Argopleura</i>, <i>Attonitus</i>, <i>Aulixidens</i>, <i>Boehlkea</i>?, <i>Bryconacidnus</i>?,    <i>Bryconadenos</i>?, <i>Bryconamericus</i>, <i>Caiapobrycon</i>?, <i>Ceratobranchia</i>?,    <i>Chrysobrycon</i>, <i>Corynopoma</i>, <i>Creagrutus</i>, <i>Cyanocharax</i>,    <i>Diapoma</i>, <i>Gephyrocharax</i>, <i>Glandulocauda</i>, <i>Hypobrycon</i>?,    <i>Hysteronotus</i>, <i>Iotabrycon</i>, <i>Knodus</i>, <i>Landonia</i>, <i>Lophiobrycon</i>,    <i>Microgenys</i>?, <i>Mimagoniates</i>, <i>Monotocheirodon</i>?, <i>Nantis</i>,    <i>Odontostoechus</i>, <i>Othonocheirodus</i>?, <i>Phallobrycon</i>?, <i>Phenacobrycon</i>,    <i>Piabarchus</i>?, <i>Piabina</i>, <i>Planaltina</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma</i>,    <i>Pterobrycon</i>, <i>Ptychocharax</i>, <i>Rhinobrycon</i>?, <i>Rhinopetitia</i>?,    <i>Scopaeocharax</i>, <i>Tyttocharax</i>, and <i>Xenurobrycon</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The situation of    <i>Hemibrycon</i> as the sister group of the remaining Stevardiinae was not    mentioned explicitly, but a basal position of this genus, based on its generalized    morphology was proposed in the literature (<i>e</i>. <i>g</i>. G&eacute;ry,    1977). The Stevardiinae, as recognized herein, is not monophyletic in the analysis    of Lucena (1993), with <i>Hemibrycon</i> being in a relatively basal position    within the Characidae, as the sister group of a clade which includes most members    of the family. In the analysis of Calcagnotto <i>et al</i>. (2005) <i>Hemibrycon</i>    is the sister group of <i>Creagrutus</i> in a terminal node within the Stevardiinae,    as recognized here. This node includes all the Stevardiinae excepting <i>Hemibrycon</i>,    and maybe <i>Boehlkea</i>, which is, however, listed with a question mark.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Small    foramen near posterior margin of pterosphenoid (44): (0 &gt; 1) present, pierced    by a branch of supraorbital nerve. Reversed in <i>Mimagoniates rheocharis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Contact    between ectopterygoid and anterodorsal region of quadrate (162): (0 &gt; 1)    absent. Paralleled in node 184 and in <i>Aphyocharax dentatus</i>, <i>Engraulisoma    taeniatum</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>, and <i>Stichonodon insignis</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in the Cheirodontinae and in <i>Microschemobrycon casiquiare</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Form    of third postcleithrum (250): (1 &gt; 0) slender, without associated lamella.    Reversal of synapomorphy 6 of node 204. Paralleled in <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>,    <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, and <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Development    of transverse process of neural arch of third vertebra (219): (0 &gt; 1) well    developed and extending beyond anterior margin of tripus. Paralleled in node    302, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>, <i>Deuterodon langei</i>, <i>Engraulisoma    taeniatum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>,    and <i>Thayeria obliqua</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Microschemobrycon    casiquiare</i> and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of branched pelvic-fin rays (258): (1 &gt; 0) six or less. Paralleled in the    Aphyocharacinae, in nodes 220, 236, 280, and 302, and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax    goethei</i>, and <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    <i>Hasemania nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (196): (1 &gt; 0)    11 or more. (k13-14). Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node 196. Paralleled in    node 237 and in <i>Bryconamericus</i> cf. <i>exodon</i> and <i>B</i>. cf. <i>iheringii</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in the Cheirodontinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 241: (6    / 93 / 5 / 22)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acrobrycon</i>,    <i>Argopleura</i>, <i>Attonitus</i>, <i>Aulixidens</i>, <i>Boehlkea</i>?, <i>Bryconacidnus</i>?,    <i>Bryconadenos</i>?, <i>Bryconamericus</i>, <i>Caiapobrycon</i>?, <i>Ceratobranchia</i>?,    <i>Chrysobrycon</i>, <i>Corynopoma</i>, <i>Creagrutus</i>, <i>Diapoma</i>, <i>Gephyrocharax</i>,    <i>Glandulocauda</i>, <i>Hypobrycon</i>?, <i>Hysteronotus</i>, <i>Iotabrycon</i>,    <i>Knodus</i>, <i>Landonia</i>, <i>Lophiobrycon</i>, <i>Microgenys</i>?, <i>Mimagoniates</i>,    <i>Monotocheirodon</i>?, <i>Nantis</i>, <i>Odontostoechus</i>, <i>Othonocheirodus</i>?,    <i>Phallobrycon</i>?, <i>Phenacobrycon</i>, <i>Piabarchus</i>?, <i>Piabina</i>,    <i>Planaltina</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma</i>, <i>Pterobrycon</i>, <i>Ptychocharax</i>,    <i>Rhinobrycon</i>?, <i>Rhinopetitia</i>?, <i>Scopaeocharax</i>, <i>Tyttocharax</i>,    and <i>Xenurobrycon</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphy:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Longitudinal    position of insertion of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> tendon on dentary (330):    (0 &gt; 1) on vertical through middle or anterior half of Meckelian cartilage.    Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in nodes 184, 186, 209, 261, and 270, and    in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i> and <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>. Reversed    in nodes 237 and 298 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 246: (-11    / 73 / - / 100)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Bryconamericus    agna</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>alpha</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>exodon</i>, other <i>Bryconamericus</i>?,    <i>Knodus breviceps</i>, other <i>Knodus</i>?; <i>Phallobrycon</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    <i>Knodus</i> has been repeatedly challenged in the literature (<i>e</i>. <i>g</i>.    G&eacute;ry, 1977), and this genus was even proposed to be synonymized with    <i>Bryconamericus</i> (Rom&aacute;n-Valencia, 2000). A study of the monophyly    and relationships of <i>Knodus</i> is beyond the scope of this paper. This clade    includes <i>Bryconamericus exodon</i>, the type species of this genus, along    with <i>B</i>. <i>agna</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>alpha</i>, and <i>Knodus breviceps</i>,    the only species of that genus herein analyzed. This clade has a basal polytomy,    having as a possible solution, the sister-group relationship between <i>Knodus</i>    and the true <i>Bryconamericus</i>. However, both the resolution of this clade    and the position of <i>Knodus meridae</i> Eigenmann, the type species of the    genus need to be resolved to arrive at conclusions about the validity and 
relationships    of <i>Knodus</i>. Although the relationships of <i>Phallobrycon</i> are unknown,    Menezes <i>et al</i>. (2009) tentatively hypothesized the close relationship    of this genus with the inseminating species of <i>Knodus</i>, recognizing however    that such a hypothesis is an oversimplification of a very complex problem. The    inclusion of <i>Phallobrycon</i> in this node is tentative, because it would    depend both on the corroboration of the hypothesis proposed by Menezes <i>et    al</i>. (2009) and the position of the inseminating species of <i>Knodus</i>,    which were not analyzed in this paper.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Horizontal    process of anguloarticular (108): (0 &gt; 1) broadly covered by dentary which    reaches posterior border of Meckelian cartilage. Reversal of synapomorphy 1    of node 206. Paralleled in nodes 253 and 261 and in <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of maxillary teeth (136): (1 &gt; 0) up to three. Reversal of synapomorphy 8    of node 205. Paralleled in node 232 and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of cusps of anterior maxillary teeth (139): (0 &gt; 1) five or more cusps. (k9-11).    Paralleled in the Rhoadsiinae, in nodes 273, 283, and 294, and in <i>Bramocharax    bransfordii</i>, <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Hemibrycon    dariensis</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>, and <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>.    Reversed in node 247.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Knodus breviceps</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Anterior    convergence of ventral diverging lamellae with nasal septum of mesethmoid (31):    (1 &gt; 0) absent, or confluent near anterior end of nasal septum. Paralleled    in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i> and <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Contact    between frontals anteriorly to frontal fontanel (21): (0 &gt; 1) present. (k9-11).    Reversal of synapomorphy 4 of node 206. Paralleled in <i>Bario steindachneri</i>,    <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>, <i>Galeocharax humeralis</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>,    and <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Position    of ventral margin of posttemporal (252): (1 &gt; 0) anterior to lateral margin    of epioccipital. (k12-14). Paralleled in nodes 162, 285, and 301 and in <i>Aulixidens    eugeniae</i>, <i>Creagrutus anary</i>, <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>, <i>Moenkhausia</i>    cf. <i>intermedia</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in node 247.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Scales    covering caudal-fin lobes (328): (0 &gt; 1) covering one-third of their length.    (k9-11). Paralleled in node 222 and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Distichodus    maculatus</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>, and <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Bryconamericus alpha</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Transitional    vertebrae with haemal canal (229): (0 &gt; 1) absent. (some trees under k9-14).    Paralleled in nodes 195 and 212, and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Engraulisoma    taeniatum</i>, <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>, and <i>Piabina argentea</i>. Some    trees: Paralleled in node 247 and in <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Bryconamericus agna</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of ascending process of premaxilla (104): (0 &gt; 1) reaching just anterior    end of nasal. (some trees under k9-14) . Paralleled in nodes 225 and 294 and    in <i>Charax stenopterus</i>, <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>, and <i>Stichonodon    insignis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Cusps    of teeth on outer premaxillary row (125): (0 &gt; 1) five or more cusps. (some    trees under k9-14). Paralleled in nodes 265 and 294 and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>,    <i>Bryconops melanurus</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>,    and <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 247: (100    / 100 / 76 / 10)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Bryconamericus    exodon</i>, other <i>Bryconamericus</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (235): (0 &gt; 1) with markedly concave margin, almost forming    straight angle. Paralleled in nodes 162 and 253 and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>, <i>Characidium borellii</i>, <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>,    <i>Moenkhausia</i> cf. <i>intermedia</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>,    and <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Alignment    of teeth on anterior premaxillary row (124): (0 &gt; 1) not aligned, with one    or two teeth situated anterior to remaining teeth. (k12-14).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of cusps of anterior maxillary teeth (139): (1 &gt; 0) up to three. (k9-11).    Reversal of synapomorphy 3 of node 246.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (1 &gt; 0) one. (k9-11).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Transitional    vertebrae with haemal canal (229): (0 &gt; 1) absent. (some trees under k9-14).    Paralleled in nodes 195 and 212, and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Engraulisoma    taeniatum</i>, <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>, and <i>Piabina argentea</i>. Some    trees: Paralleled in <i>Bryconamericus alpha</i> and <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Position    of ventral margin of posttemporal (252): (1 &gt; 0) anterior to lateral margin    of epioccipital. (k12-14). Paralleled in nodes 162, 285, and 301 and in <i>Aulixidens    eugeniae</i>, <i>Creagrutus anary</i>, <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>, <i>Moenkhausia</i>    cf. <i>intermedia</i>, and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in <i>Knodus breviceps</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Bryconamericus</i> cf. <i>exodon</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (196): (1 &gt; 0)    11 or more. Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node 196. Paralleled in node 237 and    in <i>Bryconamericus</i> cf. <i>iheringii</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in the    Cheirodontinae and in <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Bryconamericus exodon</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on second ceratobranchial (193): (1 &gt; 0) one. Paralleled in    nodes 238 and 253. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Color    of caudal-fin lobes (345): (0 &gt; 3) both lobes dark brown or black. Paralleled    in node 297.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 240: (-18    / 84 / - / 14)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acrobrycon</i>,    <i>Argopleura</i>, <i>Attonitus</i>, <i>Aulixidens</i>, <i>Boehlkea</i>?, <i>Bryconacidnus</i>?,    <i>Bryconadenos</i>?, <i>Caiapobrycon</i>?, <i>Ceratobranchia</i>?, <i>Chrysobrycon</i>,    <i>Corynopoma</i>, <i>Creagrutus</i>, <i>Diapoma</i>, <i>Gephyrocharax</i>,    <i>Glandulocauda</i>, <i>Hypobrycon</i>?, <i>Hysteronotus</i>, <i>Iotabrycon</i>,    <i>Landonia</i>, <i>Lophiobrycon</i>, <i>Microgenys</i>?, <i>Mimagoniates</i>,    <i>Monotocheirodon</i>?, <i>Nantis</i>, <i>Odontostoechus</i>, <i>Othonocheirodus</i>?,    <i>Phallobrycon</i>?, <i>Phenacobrycon</i>, <i>Piabarchus</i>?, <i>Piabina</i>,    <i>Planaltina</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma</i>, <i>Pterobrycon</i>, <i>Ptychocharax</i>,    <i>Rhinobrycon</i>?, <i>Rhinopetitia</i>?, <i>Scopaeocharax</i>, <i>Tyttocharax</i>,    and <i>Xenurobrycon</i>; <i>Bryconamericus iheringii</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>mennii</i>,    <i>B</i>. <i>rubropictus</i>, 
<i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i>, other <i>Bryconamericus</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The species of    <i>Bryconamericus</i> included in this clade are separated from <i>B</i>. <i>exodon</i>,    the type species of the genus, and then should be transferred to another genus    according to this study.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphy:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Bony    hooks on last pelvic-fin ray of adult males (314): (0 &gt; 1) as numerous as    in other rays. Paralleled in nodes 232, 258, and 299 and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 239: (-20    / 59 / - / 22)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acrobrycon</i>,    <i>Argopleura</i>, <i>Attonitus</i>, <i>Aulixidens</i>, <i>Boehlkea</i>?, <i>Bryconacidnus</i>?,    <i>Bryconadenos</i>?, <i>Caiapobrycon</i>?, <i>Ceratobranchia</i>?, <i>Chrysobrycon</i>,    <i>Corynopoma</i>, <i>Diapoma</i>, <i>Gephyrocharax</i>, <i>Glandulocauda</i>,    <i>Hypobrycon</i>?, <i>Hysteronotus</i>, <i>Iotabrycon</i>, <i>Landonia</i>,    <i>Lophiobrycon</i>, <i>Microgenys</i>?, <i>Mimagoniates</i>, <i>Monotocheirodon</i>?,    <i>Othonocheirodus</i>?, <i>Phenacobrycon</i>, <i>Piabarchus</i>?, <i>Planaltina</i>,    <i>Pseudocorynopoma</i>, <i>Pterobrycon</i>, <i>Ptychocharax</i>, <i>Rhinobrycon</i>?,    <i>Rhinopetitia</i>?, <i>Scopaeocharax</i>, <i>Tyttocharax</i>, and <i>Xenurobrycon</i>;    <i>Bryconamericus mennii</i>, other <i>Bryconamericus</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The single synapomorphy    supporting this clade is the presence of insemination. This feature was reported    for several genera of the Characidae, including the members of the former subfamilies    Glandulocaudinae and Stevardiinae, which are included in this node (<i>e</i>.    <i>g</i>. Weitzman <i>et al</i>., 2005). The presence or absence of insemination    in many species was not evaluated, and this character (coded exclusively from    literature) has many missing entries in the data matrix. The study of the reproductive    biology of a higher number of species would serve as a better evaluation of    both the phylogenetic informativeness of this character and the monophyly of    this clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphy:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Insemination    (358): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 245: (32    / 70 / 2 / 4)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Attonitus</i>,    <i>Aulixidens</i>, <i>Boehlkea</i>?, <i>Bryconacidnus</i>?, <i>Bryconadenos</i>,    <i>Caiapobrycon</i>?, <i>Ceratobranchia</i>?, <i>Hypobrycon</i>?, <i>Microgenys</i>?,    <i>Monotocheirodon</i>?, <i>Othonocheirodus</i>?, <i>Piabarchus</i>?, <i>Rhinobrycon</i>?,    <i>Rhinopetitia</i>?; some <i>Bryconamericus</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The close relationship    between <i>Attonitus</i> and <i>Aulixidens</i> was not previously proposed.    The genus <i>Attonitus</i> was described from six synapomorphies which are unique    or very unusual in Characidae (Vari &amp; Ortega, 2000). Malabarba &amp; Vari    (2000) mentioned the similarity in the position of the mouth in <i>Attonitus</i>,    <i>Caiapobrycon</i>, <i>Ceratobranchia</i>, <i>Creagrutus</i>, <i>Hypobrycon</i>,    <i>Othonocheirodus</i>, <i>Piabina</i>, and <i>Rhinobrycon</i>, highlighting    that all these genera have also four teeth in the inner premaxillary row. Almir&oacute;n    <i>et al</i>. (2001) listed a series of features related with the mouth position    and the dentition which characterize the genera <i>Attonitus</i>, <i>Caiapobrycon</i>,    and <i>Hypobrycon</i>. Weitzman <i>et al</i>. (2005) proposed the close relationship    between <i>Attonitus</i> and <i>Bryconadenos</i>, based in 
the shared presence    of glandular cells at the anal-fin base; as this is an unique feature among    characids, <i>Bryconadenos</i> was included in this clade by those authors.    The study of the reproductive biology of <i>Aulixidens</i> and the inclusion    of members of <i>Bryconadenos</i>, <i>Caiapobrycon</i>, and <i>Hypobrycon</i>    in a phylogeny of the family would undoubtedly serve to test the hypothesis    herein proposed.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of maxilla relative to dentary (100): (0 &gt; 1) maxilla not reaching posterior    end of Meckelian cartilage. Paralleled in node 234.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Form    of teeth of inner premaxillary tooth row (128): (0 &gt; 1) with cusps aligned    in straight series and without anterior concavity. Paralleled in the Rhoadsiinae,    in nodes 195 and 280, and in <i>Hemigrammus bleheri</i> and <i>Odontostoechus    lethostigmus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Denticles    on gill rakers (201): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gymnocharacinae,    in node 253, and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i> and <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i> and <i>H</i>. <i>herbertaxelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Form    of anterior process of lateral ethmoid (14): (1 &gt; 0) broad in ventral view,    contacting proximal region of vomer in its entire length. Reversal of synapomorphy    1 of node 179. Paralleled in <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i> and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Anterior    convergence of ventral diverging lamellae with nasal septum of mesethmoid (31):    (1 &gt; 0) absent, or confluent near anterior end of nasal septum. Paralleled    in <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i> and <i>Knodus breviceps</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Anterior    end of ascending process of maxilla (94): (1 &gt; 0) with conspicuous notch.    Paralleled in node 184.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Number    of rows of premaxillary teeth (122): (1 &gt; 0) one. Paralleled in node 195    and in <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Carnegiella strigata</i>, <i>Grundulus    cochae</i>, <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>, <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>,    <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, and <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Maxillary    teeth (134): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i>,    <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>, <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>, and <i>Stichonodon    insignis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i> and <i>Psellogrammus    kennedyi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Number    of maxillary teeth (135): (1 &gt; 0) only one, or absent. Paralleled in the    <i>Astyanax</i> clade, in nodes 284 and 290, and in <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>,    <i>Coptobrycon bilineatus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon bifasciatus</i>, and <i>Iguanodectes    geisleri</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Paracheirodon    axelrodi</i>, and <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Number    of maxillary teeth (136): (1 &gt; 0) up to three. Reversal of synapomorphy 8    of node 205. Paralleled in nodes 232 and 246.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Separation    between posterior dentary teeth (147): (0 &gt; 1) more than width of these teeth.    Paralleled in node 221 and in <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>rutilus</i> and <i>Pristella    maxillaris</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Posterior    extent of ventral process of quadrate (151): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of posterior    margin of symplectic. Paralleled in the <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i> clade    and Iguanodectinae, in nodes 284, 289, and 298, and in <i>Astyanax mexicanus</i>,    <i>A</i>. cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>, <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>,    <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>, <i>Micralestes    stormsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>,    <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>, <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>, and <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Shape    of ectopterygoid (156): (0 &gt; 1) triangular and much broadened anteriorly.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>11.</b> Form    of anterior expansion of basihyal (191): (0 &gt; 1) expanded, with anterior    margin with two-thirds or more of its length. Paralleled in <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>,    <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Thayeria obliqua</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>12.</b> Interhyal    (210): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>13.</b> Transitional    vertebrae with haemal canal (229): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in nodes 195    and 212, and in <i>Engraulisoma taeniatum</i>, <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>, and    <i>Piabina argentea</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 247 and in <i>Bryconamericus    alpha</i> and <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>14.</b> Position    of ventral margin of posttemporal (252): (1 &gt; 0) anterior to lateral margin    of epioccipital. Paralleled in nodes 162, 285, and 301 and in <i>Creagrutus    anary</i>, <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>, <i>Moenkhausia</i> cf. <i>intermedia</i>,    and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 247 and in <i>Knodus    breviceps</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>15.</b> Bony    hooks on first pelvic-fin ray of adult males (315): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled    in node 274 and in <i>Aphyocharacidium bolivianum</i>, <i>Aphyocharax anisitsi</i>,    and <i>Nantis indefessus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>16.</b> Scales    covering caudal-fin lobes (328): (0 &gt; 1) covering one-third of their length.    Paralleled in node 222 and in <i>Distichodus maculatus</i>, <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>,    and <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Knodus breviceps</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Position    of sphenotic spine relative to the orbit (12): (0 &gt; 1) distinctly posterior    to orbital margin. Paralleled in nodes 193 and 299 and in <i>Acestrorhynchus    pantaneiro</i>, <i>Cynopotamus argenteus</i>, and <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Rhinosphenoid    (47): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of the Characidae. Paralleled    in nodes 207, 260, 280, and 298 and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Bryconamericus    scleroparius</i>, <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>,    <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Position    of opening on neurocranium communicating with laterosensory canal of sixth infraorbital    (77): (0 &gt; 1) in frontal. Paralleled in nodes 193 and 249 and in <i>Micralestes    stormsi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Ventral    margin of horizontal process of anguloarticular (109): (1 &gt; 0) posteroventrally    angled relative to laterosensory canal of dentary from medial view. Reversal    of synapomorphy 1 of node 199. Paralleled in nodes 195, 280, and 298.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Form    of anterior portion of ectopterygoid (157): (0 &gt; 1) slender and articulating    only to lateral margin of palatine, and lacking ligaments to neurocranium. Paralleled    in the Alestidae, in node 170, and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Bony    lamellae between second and third basibranchials (184): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled    in the Serrasalmidae and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>,    <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Jupiaba scologaster</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>,    <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates    bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (235): (0 &gt; 1) with markedly concave margin, almost forming    straight angle. Paralleled in nodes 162, 247, and 253 and in <i>Agoniates anchovia</i>,    <i>Characidium borellii</i>, <i>Iguanodectes geisleri</i>, <i>Moenkhausia</i>    cf. <i>intermedia</i>, <i>Prionobrama paraguayensis</i>, and <i>Xenagoniates    bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (287): (1 &gt; 0) 17 or less. Reversal of synapomorphy    6 of the Characoidea. Paralleled in the Alestidae, in nodes 280 and 290, and    in <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Longitudinal    position of insertion of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> tendon on dentary (330):    (1 &gt; 0) on vertical through posterior half of Meckelian cartilage. Reversal    of synapomorphy 1 of node 241. Paralleled in nodes 237 and 298.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (0 &gt; 1) two. (k12-14). Reversal    of synapomorphy 3 of node 179. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in node 280,    and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>, <i>Carlana    eigenmanni</i>, <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    elachys</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>, <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>,    <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>. Some trees:    Paralleled in node 249.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 238: (-13    / 87 / - / 22)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acrobrycon</i>,    <i>Argopleura</i>, <i>Boehlkea</i>?, <i>Bryconacidnus</i>?, <i>Bryconadenos</i>?,    <i>Caiapobrycon</i>?, <i>Ceratobranchia</i>?, <i>Chrysobrycon</i>, <i>Corynopoma</i>,    <i>Diapoma</i>, <i>Gephyrocharax</i>, <i>Glandulocauda</i>, <i>Hypobrycon</i>?,    <i>Hysteronotus</i>, <i>Iotabrycon</i>, <i>Landonia</i>, <i>Lophiobrycon</i>,    <i>Microgenys</i>?, <i>Mimagoniates</i>, <i>Monotocheirodon</i>?, <i>Othonocheirodus</i>?,    <i>Phenacobrycon</i>, <i>Piabarchus</i>?, <i>Planaltina</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma</i>,    <i>Pterobrycon</i>, <i>Ptychocharax</i>, <i>Rhinobrycon</i>?, <i>Rhinopetitia</i>?,    <i>Scopaeocharax</i>, <i>Tyttocharax</i>, and <i>Xenurobrycon</i>; <i>Bryconamericus    mennii</i>, other <i>Bryconamericus</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This node includes    <i>Bryconamericus mennii</i> and the Glandulocaudinae of Weitzman &amp; Menezes    (1998). This relationship, however, may change when some reproductive biology    features of <i>Bryconamericus mennii</i> become known. The species lacks sexual    dimorphism, and males even lack bony hooks, contrary to the Glandulocaudinae    of Weitzman (2003), in which the sexual characters are much developed. Although    <i>Bryconamericus mennii</i> has spermatozoa of the aquasperm type (Miquelarena    <i>et al</i>., 2002), the evaluation of the presence of insemination in this    species would be useful to test the monophyly of this clade.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphy:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on second ceratobranchial (193): (1 &gt; 0) one. Paralleled in    node 253 and in <i>Bryconamericus exodon</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Axelrodia    lindeae</i>. Reversed in <i>Diapoma terofali</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Bryconamericus mennii</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Bony    hooks on fin rays (307): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Paralleled in the Gymnocharacinae,    in nodes 207, 283, 297, and 301, and in <i>Astyanax paris</i>, <i>Exodon paradoxus</i>,    <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>, and <i>Rhoadsia altipinna</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 237: (83    / 98 / 64 / 40)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Acrobrycon</i>,    <i>Chrysobrycon</i>, <i>Corynopoma</i>, <i>Diapoma</i>, <i>Gephyrocharax</i>,    <i>Glandulocauda</i>, <i>Hysteronotus</i>, <i>Iotabrycon</i>, <i>Landonia</i>,    <i>Lophiobrycon</i>, <i>Mimagoniates</i>, <i>Phenacobrycon</i>, <i>Planaltina</i>,    <i>Pseudocorynopoma</i>, <i>Pterobrycon</i>, <i>Ptychocharax</i>, <i>Scopaeocharax</i>,    <i>Tyttocharax</i>, and <i>Xenurobrycon</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This node corresponds    to the Glandulocaudinae of Weitzman &amp; Fink (1985) and Weitzman &amp; Menezes    (1998), and to the Glandulocaudinae plus Stevardiinae of Weitzman <i>et al</i>.    (2005). The monophyly of this clade was proposed and tested by Weitzman &amp;    Menezes (1998), who advanced a phylogenetic diagnosis for the former Glandulocaudinae    based principally on data from the reproductive biology. Some of these features    were later discovered in non-glandulocaudin species, which weakened the original    hypothesis of monophyly of this group and resulted in its splitting into two    subfamilies, Glandulocaudinae and Stevardiinae (Weitzman <i>et al</i>., 2005).    Although this is a highly supported node, its deeply nested position within    the herein redefined Stevardiinae does not justify the use of a suprageneric    name for this clade, notwithstanding the traditionally used name Glandulocaudinae    
for this group of taxa (<i>e</i>. <i>g</i>. G&eacute;ry, 1977; Weitzman, 2003).    According to the final hypothesis of this paper, maintaining the name Glandulocaudinae,    extended to the base of this clade (to the node 239; also including <i>Attonitus</i>,    <i>Aulixidens</i>, and <i>Bryconamericus mennii</i>, whose relationships are    relatively poorly supported), would require the creation of four new categories    of subfamilial level (for <i>Cyanocharax</i>, and the nodes 255, 246, and 249).    Similarly, maintaining the original Glandulocaudinae as a separate subfamily    would imply the creation of six new names at the subfamilial level (those listed    above, plus one name for <i>Bryconamericus mennii</i> and one for the node 245).    Stevardiinae also has priority over the remaining suprageneric names proposed    in this clade (excepting the less inclusive Diapomini). This, and the probability    that the number of necessary nomenclatural changes would increase with the 
inclusion    of the many species not included in this analysis justify the synonymy of Glandulocaudinae    and the redefinition of Stevardiinae. The composition of this clade follows    Weitzman &amp; Menezes (1998).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (196): (1 &gt; 0)    11 or more. Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node 196. Paralleled in <i>Bryconamericus</i>    cf. <i>exodon</i> and <i>B</i>. cf. <i>iheringii</i>. Some trees: Paralleled    in the Cheirodontinae and in <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Longitudinal    position of insertion of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> tendon on dentary (330):    (1 &gt; 0) on vertical through posterior half of Meckelian cartilage. Reversal    of synapomorphy 1 of node 241. Paralleled in node 298 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Hypertrophied    ventral caudal-peduncle squamation (354): (0 &gt; 1) present. Reversed in <i>Mimagoniates    rheocharis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Caudal    gland cells consisting of modified mucous cells (355): (0 &gt; 1) present. Reversed    in <i>Mimagoniates rheocharis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Type    of spermatozoa (359): (0 &gt; 1) introsperm. Paralleled in <i>Hollandichthys    multifasciatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Acrobrycon tarijae</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Articulation    between second and third infraorbitals (62): (1 &gt; 0) vertical. Reversal of    synapomorphy 1 of node 196.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Relative    length of palatine (172): (1 &gt; 0) approximately one-half length of ectopterygoid,    or less. Reversal of synapomorphy 4 of node 197. Paralleled in node 255 and    in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Parecbasis    cyclolepis</i>, and <i>Piabina argentea</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Palatine    foramen (173): (0 &gt; 1) present and very conspicuous. Paralleled in node 255.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Caudal-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (312): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in node 268 and in <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>,    <i>A</i>. <i>lineatus</i>, <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>,    <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>, and <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 236: (16    / 91 / - / 5)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Chrysobrycon</i>,    <i>Corynopoma</i>, <i>Diapoma</i>, <i>Gephyrocharax</i>, <i>Glandulocauda</i>,    <i>Hysteronotus</i>, <i>Iotabrycon</i>, <i>Landonia</i>, <i>Lophiobrycon</i>,    <i>Mimagoniates</i>, <i>Phenacobrycon</i>, <i>Planaltina</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma</i>,    <i>Pterobrycon</i>, <i>Ptychocharax</i>, <i>Scopaeocharax</i>, <i>Tyttocharax</i>,    and <i>Xenurobrycon</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The basal position    of <i>Acrobrycon tarijae</i> relative to the remaining members of the Glandulocaudinae    of Weitzman &amp; Menezes (1998) was not previously proposed. According to these    authors <i>Acrobrycon</i> would be included in their tribe Diapomini, along    with the genera <i>Diapoma</i> and <i>Planaltina</i>. That group would be paraphyletic    in this analysis, given that <i>Diapoma</i> is related with <i>Mimagoniates</i>    and <i>Pseudocorynopoma</i>. Furthermore, in this analysis, the Stevardiinae    of Weitzman <i>et al</i>. (2005) are paraphyletic in terms of the "glandulocaudin"    <i>Mimagoniates</i>. However, only a few species of this clade are analyzed    here and a much more detailed phylogenetic analysis of this group was previously    published by Weitzman &amp; Menezes (1998). The position the of non-analyzed    "glandulocaudins" follows Weitzman &amp; Menezes (1998).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> First    postcleithrum (247): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in node 170.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of branched pelvic-fin rays (258): (1 &gt; 0) six or less. Paralleled in the    Aphyocharacinae, in nodes 220, 280, and 302, and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>, <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>, <i>Hollandichthys    multifasciatus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, and <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hasemania nana</i> and <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Anal-fin    position (284): (0 &gt; 1) extended anteriorly ventral to dorsal fin. Paralleled    in nodes 170, 208, and 212 and in <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Gill-derived    gland on males (352): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy 6 of node    196. Paralleled in node 251 and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 235: (16    / 74 / - / 5)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Chrysobrycon</i>?,    <i>Corynopoma</i>?, <i>Gephyrocharax</i>?, <i>Glandulocauda</i>?, <i>Hysteronotus</i>?,    <i>Iotabrycon</i>?, <i>Landonia</i>?, <i>Lophiobrycon</i>, <i>Mimagoniates</i>,    <i>Phenacobrycon</i>?, <i>Planaltina</i>?, <i>Pseudocorynopoma</i>, <i>Pterobrycon</i>?,    <i>Ptychocharax</i>?, <i>Scopaeocharax</i>?, <i>Tyttocharax</i>?, and <i>Xenurobrycon</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">A sister-group    relationship between <i>Mimagoniates</i> and <i>Pseudocorynopoma</i> has not    previously been proposed. Indeed, <i>Mimagoniates</i> was included in the tribe    Glandulocaudini and <i>Pseudocorynopoma</i> the in Hysteronotini by Weitzman    &amp; Menezes (1998). Later, most members of the Glandulocaudinae were transferred    to the Stevardiinae, with the exceptions of <i>Glandulocauda</i>, <i>Lophiobrycon</i>,    and <i>Mimagoniates</i>, which were the only members of the subfamily Glandulocaudinae,    as redefined by Weitzman <i>et al</i>. (2005). The assessment of the internal    relationships of the former members of the Glandulocaudinae were not a primary    objective of this paper, and the scheme of relationships found here would likely    change with the addition of more species or characters for this group.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Number    of teeth in inner premaxillary row (129): (0 &gt; 1) five or more. Reversal    of synapomorphy 3 of node 198. Paralleled in node 195 and in <i>Grundulus cochae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Number    of branched-rays on dorsal-fin (270): (0 &gt; 1) nine or more. Reversal of synapomorphy    2 of the Stevardiinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Relative    length of pterotic spine (46): (1 &gt; 0) projected more posteriorly than attachment    site of ligament from hyomandibula. Reversal of synapomorphy 4 of node 205.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Rhinosphenoid    (47): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of the Characidae. Paralleled    in nodes 207, 260, 280, and 298 and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Attonitus    ephimeros</i>, <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>,    <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, and <i>Salminus brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Posterior    extent of ventral process of quadrate (151): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of posterior    margin of symplectic. Paralleled in the <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i> clade    and Iguanodectinae, in nodes 284, 289, and 298, and in <i>Astyanax mexicanus</i>,    <i>A</i>. cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>,    <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Metynnis    maculatus</i>, <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>,    <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>, <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>, and <i>Psellogrammus    kennedyi</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Foramen    in posterior region of metapterygoid (168): (1 &gt; 2) in form of incomplete    arch, bordered posteriorly by hyomandibula. Reversal of synapomorphy 10 of node    205. Paralleled in <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Development    of medial lamella of coracoid (238): (0 &gt; 1) expanded as a keel. Paralleled    in nodes 170 and 302 and in <i>Paragoniates alburnus</i>, <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>,    and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Second    postcleithrum (248): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gasteropelecidae,    in node 302, and in <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Anterior    rays of dorsal fin of adult males (268): (0 &gt; 1) elongate and reaching posteriorly    to position close to adipose fin. Paralleled in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Number    of branched anal-fin rays (289): (0 &gt; 1) 35 or more. Paralleled in nodes    207 and 212 and in <i>Gymnocorymbus ternetzi</i>, <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>,    <i>Piabucus melanostomus</i>, <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>, <i>Stethaprion erythrops</i>,    and <i>Thoracocharax stellatus</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 261 and in    <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Proximal    and medial radials of anal fins (294): (0 &gt; 1) fused in most pterygiophores.    Paralleled in nodes 184, 208, 218, and 221 and in <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in node 295.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>10.</b> Pelvic-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (309): (1 &gt; 0)    absent. Paralleled in <i>Creagrutus anary</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon eques</i>,    <i>H</i>. <i>luetkenii</i>, <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>, and <i>Stethaprion    erythrops</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Markiana nigripinnis</i> and <i>Psellogrammus    kennedyi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Mimagoniates rheocharis</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Synchondral    articulation between lateral ethmoid and anterodorsal border of orbitosphenoid    (35): (1 &gt; 0) present. Paralleled in the Aphyocharacinae and in <i>Leporinus    striatus</i>, <i>Pristella maxillaris</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Small    foramen near posterior margin of pterosphenoid (44): (1 &gt; 0) absent, or not    pierced by nerves. Reversal of synapomorphy 1 of node 242.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Overlap    of maxilla by second infraorbital (61): (0 &gt; 1) present. Reversal of synapomorphy    6 of node 205. Paralleled in <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Bony    lamella dorsal to fourth basibranchial (185): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of node 203. Paralleled in node 296 and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Nematocharax    venustus</i>, <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>, and <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Relative    length of anterior dorsal-fin rays (271): (1 &gt; 0) not reaching tip of posterior    rays when adpressed. Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node 179.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Number    of dorsal pterygiophores (276): (0 &gt; 1) 10 or more. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of the Stevardiinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Anal-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (308): (1 &gt; 0)    absent.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>8.</b> Hypertrophied    ventral caudal-peduncle squamation (354): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy    3 of node 237.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>9.</b> Caudal    gland cells consisting of modified mucous cells (355): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal    of synapomorphy 4 of node 237.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 244: (100    / 100 / 96 / 100)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Chrysobrycon</i>?,    <i>Corynopoma</i>?, <i>Diapoma</i>, <i>Gephyrocharax</i>?, <i>Glandulocauda</i>?,    <i>Hysteronotus</i>?, <i>Iotabrycon</i>?, <i>Landonia</i>?, <i>Phenacobrycon</i>?,    <i>Planaltina</i>?, <i>Pterobrycon</i>?, <i>Ptychocharax</i>?, <i>Scopaeocharax</i>?,    <i>Tyttocharax</i>?, and <i>Xenurobrycon</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This node could    be composed of other members of the Stevardiinae (sensu Weitzman <i>et al</i>.,    2005) not included in this paper, in addition to <i>Diapoma</i>. Thus, the genera    of the former Glandulocaudinae and Stevardiinae not included in this analysis    are listed with question marks.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Canal    of lateral line on caudal-fin membrane (92): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of the Characidae. Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae and <i>Bryconops</i>    clade, in nodes 227, 229, 287, 294, and 298, and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>,    <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i>, <i>Charax stenopterus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon anisitsi</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster    tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Cartilages    anterior to basihyal (188): (0 &gt; 1) two well developed blocks of cartilage.    Paralleled in node 299 and in <i>Hasemania nana</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon bifasciatus</i>,    <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>, and <i>Roeboides    descalvadensis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 265.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Position    of last supraneural (283): (0 &gt; 1) located more than two vertebrae in front    of first dorsal pterygiophore. Paralleled in node 174 and in <i>Engraulisoma    taeniatum</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i> and <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Diapoma terofali</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on second ceratobranchial (193): (0 &gt; 1) two.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Posterior    extent of ventral process of quadrate (151): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of posterior    margin of symplectic. Paralleled in the <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i> clade    and Iguanodectinae, in nodes 284, 289, and 298, and in <i>Astyanax mexicanus</i>,    <i>A</i>. cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>,    <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Metynnis maculatus</i>, <i>Micralestes    stormsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>, <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>,    <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>, <i>Psellogrammus kennedyi</i>, and <i>Pseudocorynopoma    doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Position    of ventral margin of posttemporal (252): (1 &gt; 0) anterior to lateral margin    of epioccipital. Paralleled in nodes 162, 285, and 301 and in <i>Aulixidens    eugeniae</i>, <i>Creagrutus anary</i>, <i>Moenkhausia</i> cf. <i>intermedia</i>,    and <i>Pyrrhulina australis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 247 and in <i>Knodus    breviceps</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 249: (-9    / 77 / - / 4)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Boehlkea</i>?,    <i>Bryconacidnus</i>?, <i>Caiapobrycon</i>?, <i>Ceratobranchia</i>?, <i>Creagrutus</i>,    <i>Hypobrycon</i>?, <i>Microgenys</i>?, <i>Monotocheirodon</i>?, <i>Nantis</i>,    <i>Odontostoechus</i>, <i>Othonocheirodus</i>?, <i>Piabarchus</i>?, <i>Piabina</i>,    <i>Rhinobrycon</i>?, and <i>Rhinopetitia</i>?; <i>Bryconamericus iheringii</i>,    <i>B</i>. <i>rubropictus</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i>, other <i>Bryconamericus</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    this clade was not proposed prior to Mirande (2009). As with the preceding nodes,    the study of some features of the reproductive biology of the members of this    clade are especially important. According to the present analysis, the species    of <i>Bryconamericus</i> included in this clade are not closely related to <i>B</i>.    <i>exodon</i>, the type species of the genus, and they should be transferred    to, at least, two new genera. An alternative would be to include species in    all this clade to the same genus, which, by priority would be <i>Creagrutus</i>    G&uuml;nther, 1864. This action, however, is unjustified until future studies    including a higher proportion of the included species are carried out.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Position    of opening on neurocranium communicating with laterosensory canal of sixth infraorbital    (77): (0 &gt; 1) in frontal. Paralleled in node 193 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>    and <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Some trees:</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (0 &gt; 1) two. (k12-14). Reversal    of synapomorphy 3 of node 179. Paralleled in the Iguanodectinae, in node 280,    and in <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconaethiops macrops</i>, <i>Carlana    eigenmanni</i>, <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>, <i>Hoplocharax goethei</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    elachys</i>, <i>Odontostilbe microcephala</i>, <i>Parecbasis cyclolepis</i>,    <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i>, and <i>Rhaphiodon vulpinus</i>. Some trees:    Parelleled in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>. Reversed in node 253.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 248: (65    / 87 / - / 8)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><i>Bryconamericus    iheringii</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i>, other <i>Bryconamericus</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The morphological    similarity between <i>Bryconamericus iheringii</i> and <i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i>    is so marked that Ringuelet <i>et al</i>. (1967), among others, considered these    species as synonyms; however, the validity of <i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i> was later    demonstrated by Miquelarena &amp; Aquino (1995). The relationships of these    two species were previously unknown. Both species, but especially <i>B</i>.    <i>thomasi</i>, have a marked sexual dimorphism, with strong and numerous bony    hooks in males. The reproductive biology of these species is unknown and, as    in the previous nodes, such information may be relevant to an assessment of    the relationships of these species.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphy:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Dorsal-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (311): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in node 268 and in <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>,    <i>A</i>. <i>lineatus</i>, <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>, <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>, <i>Nematocharax    venustus</i>, and <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Bryconamericus thomasi</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Canal    of lateral line on caudal-fin membrane (92): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of the Characidae. Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae and <i>Bryconops</i>    clade, in nodes 227, 229, 244, 287, 294, and 298, and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>,    <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>, <i>Charax stenopterus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    anisitsi</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Bryconamericus</i> cf. <i>iheringii</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Number    of gill rakers on first hypobranchial and ceratobranchial (196): (1 &gt; 0)    11 or more. Reversal of synapomorphy 5 of node 196. Paralleled in node 237 and    in <i>Bryconamericus</i> cf. <i>exodon</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in the Cheirodontinae    and in <i>Cyanocharax alburnus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Pectoral-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (310): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in node 268 and in <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>,    <i>A</i>. <i>lineatus</i>, <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>, <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster    tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 251: (-9    / 68 / - / 4)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Boehlkea</i>?,    <i>Bryconacidnus</i>?, <i>Caiapobrycon</i>?, <i>Ceratobranchia</i>?, <i>Creagrutus</i>,    <i>Hypobrycon</i>?, <i>Microgenys</i>?, <i>Monotocheirodon</i>?, <i>Nantis</i>,    <i>Odontostoechus</i>, <i>Othonocheirodus</i>?, <i>Piabarchus</i>?, <i>Piabina</i>,    <i>Rhinobrycon</i>?, and <i>Rhinopetitia</i>?; <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>,    other <i>Bryconamericus</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">This clade was    not previously proposed. The presence of a gill gland, its single synapomorphy,    must be confirmed by histological examination in some species. Studies about    the presence and nature of this gland are desirable both to its use both in    species-level systematics and in phylogenetic studies.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphy:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Gill-derived    gland on males (352): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy 6 of node    196. Paralleled in node 236 and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 250: (51    / 85 / - / 4)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Boehlkea</i>?,    <i>Bryconacidnus</i>?, <i>Caiapobrycon</i>?, <i>Ceratobranchia</i>?, <i>Hypobrycon</i>?,    <i>Microgenys</i>?, <i>Monotocheirodon</i>?, <i>Othonocheirodus</i>?, <i>Piabarchus</i>?,    <i>Rhinobrycon</i>?, and <i>Rhinopetitia</i>?; <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>,    other <i>Bryconamericus</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">As is the case    with characters involving glands and reproductive structures, the character    supporting this clade should be studied in detail, especially in relation to    its potential variation during the growth. The analyzed members of this clade    may be populations of the same species, something that is currently under study    by the author.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphy:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Sclerotic    bones (350): (0 &gt; 1) two bones separated by cartilages. Paralleled in nodes    208, 210, 221, and 259.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (0 &gt; 1) not reaching horizontal arm of    preopercle, at least anteriorly. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 198. Paralleled    in nodes 280 and 298 and in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>, <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>,    and <i>Creagrutus</i> cf. <i>taphorni</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Length    of laterosensory canal of dentary (79): (0 &gt; 1) reduced or absent. Paralleled    in node 279 and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>,    <i>H</i>. <i>luetkenii</i>, <i>Nantis</i> cf. <i>indefessus</i>, and <i>Thayeria    boehlkei</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Canal    of lateral line on caudal-fin membrane (92): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of the Characidae. Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae and <i>Bryconops</i>    clade, in nodes 227, 229, 244, 287, 294, and 298, and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>,    <i>Bryconamericus thomasi</i>, <i>Charax stenopterus</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon    anisitsi</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Pectoral-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (310): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in node 268 and in <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>,    <i>A</i>. <i>lineatus</i>, <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Bryconamericus</i>    cf. <i>iheringii</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>, <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>,    and <i>Phenacogaster tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Dorsal-fin    bony hooks in adult males of species bearing hooks on fins (311): (0 &gt; 1)    present. Paralleled in nodes 248 and 268 and in <i>Astyanax</i> cf. <i>asuncionensis</i>,    <i>A</i>. <i>lineatus</i>, <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i>,    <i>H</i>. <i>socolofi</i>, <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>, and <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>No autapomorphies    found for <i>Bryconamericus</i> cf. <i>rubropictus.</i></b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 254: (-9    / 60 / - / 22)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Boehlkea</i>?,    <i>Bryconacidnus</i>?, <i>Caiapobrycon</i>?, <i>Ceratobranchia</i>?, <i>Creagrutus</i>,    <i>Hypobrycon</i>?, <i>Microgenys</i>?, <i>Monotocheirodon</i>?, <i>Nantis</i>,    <i>Odontostoechus</i>, <i>Othonocheirodus</i>?, <i>Piabarchus</i>?, <i>Piabina</i>,    <i>Rhinobrycon</i>?, and <i>Rhinopetitia</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The relationships    of <i>Nantis</i> were unknown prior to the analysis of Mirande (2009). In the    description of <i>N</i>. <i>indefessus</i>, this species was compared with the    members of clade A (=Stevardiinae), although it was not originally included    in this group due to the possession of five teeth in the inner premaxillary    row (instead of four) (Mirande <i>et al</i>., 2004). The results of this analysis    indicate that <i>Nantis</i> is a member of the herein redefined subfamily Stevardiinae.    The genera <i>Creagrutus</i>, <i>Odontostoechus</i>, and <i>Piabina</i> have    been included in the clade A (=Stevardiinae) by Malabarba &amp; Weitzman (2003),    but their relationships within this clade were previously unknown (Weitzman    <i>et al</i>., 2005).</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphy:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Margins    of toothed region of maxilla (96): (0 &gt; 1) dorsally divergent. Paralleled    in nodes 162, 209, and 282 and in <i>Prodontocharax melanotus</i> and <i>Rhoadsia    altipinna</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphies    of <i>Odontostoechus lethostigmus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Contact    between frontals anteriorly to frontal fontanel (21): (0 &gt; 1) present. Reversal    of synapomorphy 4 of node 206. Paralleled in <i>Bario steindachneri</i>, <i>Exodon    paradoxus</i>, <i>Galeocharax humeralis</i>, and <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Knodus breviceps</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Premaxillary,    maxillary, and dentary teeth (119): (0 &gt; 1) pedunculate and uniformly shaped.    Paralleled in node 232 and in <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Number    of rows of premaxillary teeth (122): (1 &gt; 0) one. Paralleled in node 195    and in <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Carlana eigenmanni</i>, <i>Carnegiella    strigata</i>, <i>Grundulus cochae</i>, <i>Paracheirodon axelrodi</i>, <i>Piabucus    melanostomus</i>, and <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Form    of teeth of inner premaxillary tooth row (128): (0 &gt; 1) with cusps aligned    in straight series and without anterior concavity. Paralleled in the Rhoadsiinae,    in nodes 195, 245, and 280, and in <i>Hemigrammus bleheri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Number    of cusps of anterior maxillary teeth (139): (0 &gt; 1) five or more cusps. Paralleled    in the Rhoadsiinae, in nodes 273, 283, and 294, and in <i>Bramocharax bransfordii</i>,    <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Gymnocharacinus bergii</i>, <i>Hemibrycon dariensis</i>,    and <i>Hyphessobrycon pulchripinnis</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in node 246.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 298: (100    / 100 / 88 / 22)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genus <i>Nantis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Rhinosphenoid    (47): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of the Characidae. Paralleled    in nodes 207, 260, and 280 and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Attonitus    ephimeros</i>, <i>Brycon orbignyanus</i>, <i>Bryconamericus scleroparius</i>,    <i>Hollandichthys multifasciatus</i>, <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>, and <i>Salminus    brasiliensis</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Ventral    extent of third infraorbital (64): (0 &gt; 1) not reaching horizontal arm of    preopercle, at least anteriorly. Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 198. Paralleled    in node 280 and in <i>Aphyodite grammica</i>, <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i>, <i>Bryconamericus    rubropictus</i>, and <i>Creagrutus</i> cf. <i>taphorni</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Canal    of lateral line on caudal-fin membrane (92): (1 &gt; 0) absent. Reversal of    synapomorphy 3 of the Characidae. Paralleled in the Aphyoditeinae and <i>Bryconops</i>    clade, in nodes 227, 229, 244, 287, and 294, and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>,    <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>, <i>B</i>. <i>thomasi</i>, <i>Charax stenopterus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon anisitsi</i>, <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>, and <i>Phenacogaster    tegatus</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Ventral    margin of horizontal process of anguloarticular (109): (1 &gt; 0) posteroventrally    angled relative to laterosensory canal of dentary from medial view. Reversal    of synapomorphy 1 of node 199. Paralleled in nodes 195 and 280 and in <i>Attonitus    ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Posterior    extent of ventral process of quadrate (151): (0 &gt; 1) falling short of posterior    margin of symplectic. Paralleled in the <i>Hyphessobrycon luetkenii</i> clade    and Iguanodectinae, in nodes 284 and 289 and in <i>Astyanax mexicanus</i>, <i>A</i>.    cf. <i>rutilus</i>, <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>, <i>Cyphocharax spilotus</i>,    <i>Diapoma speculiferum</i>, <i>Hemiodus</i> cf. <i>thayeria</i>, <i>Metynnis    maculatus</i>, <i>Micralestes stormsi</i>, <i>Moenkhausia sanctaefilomenae</i>,    <i>Nematocharax venustus</i>, <i>Probolodus heterostomus</i>, <i>Psellogrammus    kennedyi</i>, and <i>Pseudocorynopoma doriae</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in    node 302.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Posterior    margin of cleithrum (234): (1 &gt; 0) without concavity ventral to first postcleithrum.    Reversal of synapomorphy 2 of node 196. Paralleled in <i>Cheirodon interruptus</i>    and <i>Inpaichthys kerri</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Longitudinal    position of insertion of <i>adductor mandibulae</i> tendon on dentary (330):    (1 &gt; 0) on vertical through posterior half of Meckelian cartilage. Reversal    of synapomorphy 1 of node 241. Paralleled in node 237 and in <i>Attonitus ephimeros</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Nantis</i> cf. <i>indefessus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Length    of laterosensory canal of dentary (79): (0 &gt; 1) reduced or absent. Paralleled    in node 279 and in <i>Aphyocharax nattereri</i>, <i>Bryconamericus rubropictus</i>,    <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i>, <i>H</i>. <i>luetkenii</i>, and <i>Thayeria boehlkei</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Autapomorphy    of <i>Nantis indefessus</i>:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Bony    hooks on first pelvic-fin ray of adult males (315): (0 &gt; 1) present. Paralleled    in node 274 and in <i>Aphyocharacidium bolivianum</i>, <i>Aphyocharax anisitsi</i>,    and <i>Aulixidens eugeniae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Node 253: (100    / 100 / 96 / 32)</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">Genera <i>Boehlkea</i>?,    <i>Bryconacidnus</i>?, <i>Caiapobrycon</i>?, <i>Ceratobranchia</i>?, <i>Creagrutus</i>,    <i>Hypobrycon</i>?, <i>Microgenys</i>?, <i>Monotocheirodon</i>?, <i>Othonocheirodus</i>?,    <i>Piabarchus</i>?, <i>Piabina</i>, <i>Rhinobrycon</i>?, and <i>Rhinopetitia</i>?</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">The monophyly of    a clade composed of <i>Creagrutus</i> and <i>Piabina</i> was proposed by Vari    &amp; Harold (2001), supported by ten synapomorphies. Therefore, the study of    relationships between these two genera is not a primary objective of this paper.    The results herein obtained corroborate the hypothesis of Vari &amp; Harold    (2001). As several genera in the Stevardiinae were not analyzed, this clade    could be actually more inclusive.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>Synapomorphies:</b></font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>1.</b> Ventral    projection of mesethmoid spine, forming a keel between premaxillae (26): (0    &gt; 1) present. Paralleled in <i>Roeboexodon geryi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>2.</b> Epiphyseal    branch of supraorbital canal (84): (1 &gt; 0) present. Reversal of synapomorphy    1 of the Stevardiinae.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>3.</b> Length    of ascending process of premaxilla (104): (1 &gt; 0) reaching at least one-third    of length of nasal.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>4.</b> Horizontal    process of anguloarticular (108): (0 &gt; 1) broadly covered by dentary which    reaches posterior border of Meckelian cartilage. Reversal of synapomorphy 1    of node 206. Paralleled in nodes 246 and 261 and in <i>Xenagoniates bondi</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>5.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on first ceratobranchial (192): (1 &gt; 0) one. Reversal of synapomorphy    2 of node 249.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>6.</b> Rows    of gill rakers on second ceratobranchial (193): (1 &gt; 0) one. Paralleled in    node 238 and in <i>Bryconamericus exodon</i>. Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Axelrodia    lindeae</i>.</font></p>     
<p><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><b>7.</b> Denticles    on gill rakers (201): (0 &gt; 1) absent. Paralleled in the Gymnocharacinae,    in node 245, and in <i>Axelrodia lindeae</i> and <i>Pseudochalceus kyburzi</i>.    Some trees: Paralleled in <i>Hyphessobrycon elachys</i> and <i>H</i>. <i>herbertaxelrodi</i>.</font></p>
